story:
What is 45 Story and the Always Be Here For You Campaign?

 

Hello everybody,

My name is Keith Pulvermacher. I was raised around music and I have always known that I have a larger purpose than only making music. Music is the platform I have been given in order to make the world a better place. Back in 2014 I released my debut record called Midwestern. With your support I was able to give $2000.00 back to an organization called ' I Back Jack' to help support resources to fight childhood cancer. Making the best possible music I can is extremely important to me. Doing everything I can to give back and to be here for those who need it also means the world to me. Whatever is raised through this campaign merely shows how much you want to support the vision and the music. I am grateful for your participation and the money raised will be going towards a purpose bigger than me.

This time I wanted to try help even more people with the creation of this record. I have decided to create and launch a charity campaign as well in conjunction with the release of this record. I am giving my song, 'Always Be Here For You' to 12 different charities over the course of a one year period. I have also engaged corporate sponsors to get involved with the charity campaign. Each sponsor has committed to give one of the charities $5000.00 directly. Each month, 100% of donations from everyone who downloads the song will be given to the charity of that month. The charity campaign also required a separate website and design that had to be built to accomodate all of the charities and business's involved. That separate website will be launched January 1st, 2019.  I have spent most of my time working on creating and developing both of these projects this year. I have amazingly talented friends who believe in my vision and have offered their help as well. None of us do this alone.

I believe the gifts I have been given are to serve others. I believe we all have a responsibility to do what we can to take care of each other. Some of us have vision, some of us have time, some of us have resources and money, some of us have talents, some of us just need help. When you support this campaign, you are supporting my ability to create new music as well as my ability to make and raise money and resources for people with Cancer, Juvenile Diabetes, Autism, Alzheimer's, Melanoma, FMD, among other causes that get involved. Just to be clear, the first project, '45 Story', will be released December 28th, 2018. The second project, the 'Always Be Here For You' charity campaign and website will be launched January 1st, 2019.

We all have a story. We all find ourselves at times in life where we need a hand. I make music. The costs of making a good record are expensive. The costs of creating this charity campaign have proven to be expensive as well. I know how important this work is and your support helps beyond measure. Thank You so much! I hope you love the record. I hope you understand that I know I am just a piece of the puzzle. I appreciate your time and your help in order to make all of this happen. I believe if we can...we should.

All my Love,

Keith Pulvermacher

www.keithpulvermachermusic.com

 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

The funding and the costs of the project:

The costs to develop and create the 45 STORY Album alone is already outweighing the projected goal. The charity campaign has also presented additional costs in order to establish the platform and website so that it is transparent. It's important to me to create something to believe in that can potentially be expanded on in the future. If we don't reach the entire goal, I will be supplementing the rest of the project through any additional sales of the record. If we exceed our expectations additional funds will be used to build more outreach, create more music, build the marketing plan, and make a bigger difference.

 

-TRAVEL BETWEEN MILWAUKEE AND NASHVILLE $2000.00
-STUDIO TIME $5000.00
-ENGINEER FEES $1000.00
-PRODUCER FEES $2000.00
-MASTERING FOR CD AND VINYL $2500.00
-MUSICIANS $2000.00
-CD DUPLICATION $2000.00
-VINYL DUPLICATION $1000.00
-POSTAGE $750.00
-T-SHIRTS $750.00
-MARKETING (Unlimited)
-ARTWORK $2000.00
-WEB DESIGN $2000.00
-VIDEO PRODUCTION $2000.00
-PUBLIC RELATIONS $1500.00
-LEGAL RELEASES $1500.00
-CD RELEASE PARTY $3000.00

 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
The Perks, the value, and what you receive in return:
 
I am offering different packages so everybody can get involved and support something good:
 
-DIGITAL DOWNLOADS
-CD's
-VINYL
-T-SHIRTS
-SIGNED GUITARS
-PERSONAL HOUSE CONCERTS
-SONGWRITING PACKAGES
 
and more...
 
Every dollar raised in some way shape or form is getting directly reallocated towards creating new music and creating a new way to give back. This campaign is going to make a much larger impact towards all of these charities. I have plans to continue to grow the outreach for years to come. With your contribution, you will not only be receiving the music but you will supporting every cause I am working to help. Together we will move mountains.

 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Risks and Challenges,

The risks I am taking in making this record and and charity campaign is that I have put it all on the line. I have pulled favors, asked people for help, spent my money and time to create these songs and ideas. I believe in this purpose more than I have believed in anything in my life. Sometimes we only have one chance to act on our ambitions. With the network of people I have established over the years, I will find a way to address and overcome any challenge that may present itself. I'm just excited to see it all come alive.

 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

MAKE SOME NOISE!!

 

If you can't contribute...that's okay. You can help me by spreading the word through the sharing tools on this campaign. You can share it with a charity that may need support. You can share it with music lovers. You can share it with your friends, family, and neighbors and talk about something that is being created to make the world a better place.

story:
I've been in a creative slump, but.... I love to write again! The reason? I believe it is because I'm writing for myself once again, as I did when I started this musical journey so many years ago. If I like it I write it, without contemplating if it's a hit, or what genre it fits, or what label will like it, or who do I sound like. I write because it's in me. 

I hope you enjoy my pledge options.

story:
Short Summary

To celebrate the 45th anniversary of the album that launched Virgin Records, join Phil Toms and his Tubular Band as they faithfully recreate Mike Oldfield's Tubular Bells in its entirety along with hit singles including Moonlight Shadow, Five Miles Out and To France and a selection of instrumental works from Hergest Ridge to Return to Ommadawn.

Previous performances sold out to an international audience and were supported by Richard Branson, producer Tom Newman and, via social media, by Mike Oldfield himself. Check out an "utterly brilliant" review here. 

Check out official Tour Website www.tubularbellslive.com for all tour dates

Here's our facebook page and Phil's website with 5 pages of colour features from the press!

First 5 dates booked:

Mon 7th May 2018 - The Stag Theatre, Sevenoaks

Sun 13th May 2018 - New Theatre Royal, Portsmouth

Sun 27th May 2018 - The Stables, Milton Keynes

Sun 3rd June 2018 - Civic Theatre, Chelmsford

Sun 17th June 2018 - The Apex, Bury St Edmunds

About the band

Phil Toms is one of the UK's leading Mike Oldfield experts, performing note-for-note transcriptions with his 13-piece band. Phil has dedicated 5 years of detailed work on the music (in addition to some 30+ years of enjoyment listening and playing). 

The glorious band features Jay Stapley (Tubular Bells II tour), Steve Smith and James Stirling on guitars, Mike McGibney (Bass for ELO Again), Rich Nolan on drums, Adam Morris on percussion, a host of other professional musicians on keys, wind, brass and even the spoons! Our singers are Hungarian hearthrob Matyas Bacsó and Matilda Bourne who will be our "Maggie Reilly".

In order to go on tour we need to book theatres (starting with a dozen around the UK), transport for the large instruments (including Tubular Bells and percussion) and a minibus for the band with substantial hotel fees up front for long-range gigs in the north of England, Scotland and Wales. Whilst each gig should pay for itself in the long run, we can't get going without the vital start up funds.

What We Need & What You Get

For the theatres that require an upfront deposit this will be between £500-£1500 per theatre and the initial rehearsal venue costs £350. Just one night in a hotel for 13 musicians, our roadie and two drivers will cost c. £1500 with £1000 to hire a minibus and Luton van for a weekend. Publicity materials and merchandise will cost c. £1000.

Perks will include access to the tour vlog on YouTube, not-for-sale merchandise such as tour posters, tour t-shirts, plus signed programmes, VIP tickets, opportunities to watch private rehearsals and meet the band after the gig. You could also end up being the Master of Ceremonies for one of the concerts on stage! Ring out the bells!

The initial funds will pay for merchandise, travel costs, hotel costs and some theatres. Any profits from ticket sales will eventually be paid back to paying for more of the same later in the year as well as the band and crew fees.

The Impact

The music of Mike Oldfield is rarely heard live in its original full version. Tubular Brass and Tubular Bells For Two are performing great adaptations of the music but we are the only current band in the UK performing the album, Mike's hit songs, famous instrumental works and even new material such as Return to Ommadawn and more! 

Our previous concerts in 2015 and 2017 sold out to an international audience with dedicated fans flying from Brazil, Denmark, Germany, France and the Netherlands - as well as across the UK. Now we want to bring the music to you! 

In 2015, Richard Branson recorded a special message and the MC announcements on video and we were privileged to welcome record produce Tom Newman to our stage - performing the Caveman and much more! We also featured Jay Stapley (a regular in the band) from Tubular Bells II tour era and the legendary Phil Spalding on bass. Phil played for Mike throughout the 1980s on tour, recordings and music videos - even playing the same fretless bass from the Moonlight Shadow track and video in our 2015 gig. At this original gig we had a 25-piece rock ensemble covering every single multitrack layer note for note. Our MC was the great Roger Eno.

In 2017, we raised over £8500 for charity at the Mercury Theatre, again with a sold out audience and this proved that a 12-strong band can work well and the fans and press love it!

Here are some quotes:

Tom Newman (Tubular Bells Producer) “This has been a wonderful event and bless you, Phil Toms, because without him, nothing would have happened. Phil Toms! Yeah!… Well done Phil Toms! Well done!”

From the Mercury Theatre team: “Fantastic! Thanks to Phil and the team and of course to our lovely audience for their support! #MercuryRising” Fundraising over £8500 for charity.

Quotes from the audience:

“Saw TB Live on Sat, absolutely brilliant! Never thought I would hear MO’s music live. Return to O was superb! You must tour!”

“Congratulations, it was a fabulous performance!”

“You’re an inspiration mate!”

“The excerpt of Return to Ommadawn was exceptionally well done”

“What a great weekend in Colchester. So much Mike Oldfield. So many great friends. Hope we can do it all again soon.”

“What a fab show by the most excellent Phil Toms and band. Great set list too!”

“Superb evening so much enthusiasm and hard work paid off”

“What an incredible experience your concert was – it was amazing. My brothers were big Oldfield fans but I wasn’t so hadn’t a clue as to what I was letting myself in for! I’m hooked now. Congratulations”

Risks & Challenges

Once we have performed a few concerts, the income from ticket sales should pay for the band, crew and help cover future hire costs but the initial funding will be vital to this campaign. We are also looking for sponsorship from other companies to contribute to the fundraising. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every penny helps so if you can contribute a little (or more!) that's great. If not, then please do help us by sharing this campaign page, LIKE and SHARE the Facebook page and follow the website posts and retweet Phil's Twitter feed (@Phil_Toms) so that others can enjoy the tour music and help out. Check out the gig list information on the websites to check your nearest venue and bring your friends - and we look forward to performing for you! Thanks so much!

story:
Short Summary

We are Bicurious, a heavy instrumental rock duo hailing from Dublin, Ireland. We have been playing together as a band since September 2016. We've released 2 singles and played many sweaty rock shows all over Ireland, including Electric Picnic Festival. We strongly believe in the power of originality, and we want to make music that no-one has ever heard before!

We have gotten to a stage where we need to make a big statement to the world, and we believe a high quality EP is going to achieve that.  We are going over to the UK to record this EP, with Producer/Engineer Tom Peters of Alpha Male Tea Party (a band we love and admire!). We know that he is just the right person to produce a record that will take us to the next level and help us progress as a band, as well as attracting the right attention to us. We have been growing very fast since we started this band a year ago, gotten a good buzz going around Dublin and Ireland, and we want to keep the momentum going as we believe in this band and our music so much. 

Your contribution will mean the absolute world to us. We need as much help as we can on this project, as every step of the release needs to be done to a very high standard if we want it to be successful. Recording, artwork, duplication and promotion are all very expensive things, and we don't want to take a cheap and lazy approach to it. Our goal is to make this the best work of art we have aver taken part in, and we know you can help us achieve that. 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We are asking for 1000 euros to go towards the recording of our EP. This is not the entirety of the cost, but we want to pay for some of the project ourselves with the money the band has made over the last year. Unfortunately, we have not made enough, hence why we need your help. Recording costs 1700 euros altogether, and if we add artwork, duplication and promotion to that we come up to around 2500 euros. So we are not resting on our laurels, because even if you guys help us reach the 1000 euro target, we will still be working on our side to raise the rest of the money. It's a big, scary and expensive project but we believe in it.

 

  • We know that a lot of our friends/fans are musicians themselves. We can guarantee that we will return the favour if your band ever needs a hand raising money or doing anything else. There is a great sense of community among musicians in the Irish music scene, and we want to keep that brotherly attitude going, helping each other out.

 

  • We have set rewards for each donation over 5 euro: 

- 5 euro gets you a copy of the EP

- 10 euro gets you a copy of the EP and free entry to the EP launch gig in Dublin

- 20 euro gets you all of the above  and a thank you goodie-bag 

- 50 euro gets you all of the above and 5 guestlists to our upcoming shows

- 100 euro gets you all of the above and FREE entry to our headline shows FOREVER

- 200 euro gets you all of the above and we'll play a gig in your house

  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still keep whatever we make but we will struggle to pay for this project, which is why we really need your help to reach the target. 100 people donating 10 euro gets us there!

The Impact

  • By donating, you'll be contributing to the Irish independent music scene, and to the instrumental rock scene worldwide. If you love music, or even just listen to music sometimes, you can relate to the importance of good music in your life. We are trying to change music, to produce original content to keep things going forward, instead of reproducing music that has already been done before! There is nothing better, in our opinion, than refreshing and innovative music. 
  • Donating will build a real connection between us, and we will owe each and every single donor a solid. Every single person will be remembered and thanked, because we have a huge respect for anyone we can call a fan. Everyday, new people get to hear our music and we are incredibly grateful and humbled whenever anyone says they're a fan of our music... And fans make bands real. 

Risks & Challenges

We could run the risk of not reaching our target, and therefore having to struggle to pay for either the recording, duplicating or promotion of the EP. 

  • We know that we have enough fans, friends and family that will hopefully be willing to donate and help us. We strongly believe that it will be achieved.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, or want to contribute more:

  • Please tell people and share our story on social media as much as you can. It's just as important as donating.
  • We will be holding a Fundraiser Concert on the 11th of November in Sin E in Dublin. 

We know that it's easy to just think that someone else will donate, that you don't have to worry about it... But we need every single person's help on this. No donation is too small, and like Tesco would say: Every little helps. 

Thank you so much.

We need as much help as we can on this project, as every step of the release needs to be done to a very high standard if we want it to be successful. Recording, artwork, duplication and promotion are all very expensive things, and we don't want to take a cheap and lazy approach to it. Our goal is to make this the best work of art we have aver taken part in, and we know you can help us achieve that. 

What We Need & What You Get
 
We are asking for 1000 euros to go towards the recording of our EP. This is not the entirety of the cost, but we want to pay for some of the project ourselves with the money the band has made over the last year. Unfortunately, we have not made enough, hence why we need your help. Recording costs 1700 euros altogether, and if we add artwork, duplication and promotion to that we come up to around 2500 euros. So we are not resting on our laurels, because even if you guys help us reach the 1000 euro target, we will still be working on our side to raise the rest of the money. It's a big, scary and expensive project but we believe in it.
 
We know that a lot of our friends/fans are musicians themselves. We can guarantee that we will return the favour if your band ever needs a hand raising money or doing anything else. There is a great sense of community among musicians in the Irish music scene, and we want to keep that brotherly attitude going, helping each other out.
 
We have set rewards for each donation over 5 euro: 
- 5 euro gets you a copy of the EP
- 10 euro gets you a copy of the EP and free entry to the EP launch gig in Dublin
- 20 euro gets you all of the above  and a thank you goodie-bag 
- 50 euro gets you all of the above and 5 guestlists to our upcoming shows
- 100 euro gets you all of the above and FREE entry to our headline shows FOREVER
- 200 euro gets you all of the above and we'll play a gig in your house
If we don't reach our goal, we will still keep whatever we make but we will struggle to pay for this project, which is why we really need your help to reach the target. 100 people donating 10 euro gets us there!

The Impact

By donating, you'll be contributing to the Irish independent music scene, and to the instrumental rock scene worldwide. If you love music, or even just listen to music sometimes, you can relate to the importance of good music in your life. We are trying to change music, to produce original content to keep things going forward, instead of reproducing music that has already been done before! There is nothing better, in our opinion, than refreshing and innovative music. 
Donating will build a real connection between us, and we will owe each and every single donor a solid. Every single person will be remembered and thanked, because we have a huge respect for anyone we can call a fan. Everyday, new people get to hear our music and we are incredibly grateful and humbled whenever anyone says they're a fan of our music... And fans make bands real. 


Risks & Challenges
We could run the risk of not reaching our target, and therefore having to struggle to pay for either the recording, duplicating or promotion of the EP. 
We know that we have enough fans, friends and family that will hopefully be willing to donate and help us. We strongly believe that it will be achieved.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, or want to contribute more:

Please tell people and share our story on social media as much as you can. It's just as important as donating.
We will be holding a Fundraiser Concert on the 11th of November in Sin E in Dublin. 

We know that it's easy to just think that someone else will donate, that you don't have to worry about it... But we need every single person's help on this. No donation is too small, and like Tesco would say: Every little helps. 
Thank you so much.

story:
Story

We’re a touring duo featuring prolific & influential musician & artist, PALEFACE (aka “PF”), and drummer, Monica Samalot (aka “Mo”). We make original music & art, and enjoy sharing our work with the many people we meet as we tour.  We're launching our first-ever crowdfunding campaign to help us finish & release PALEFACE’s first-ever  “self produced” full-length album. Little by little, we’ve been purchasing basic recording gear, and PF has been learning audio recording & production. It's all been influencing his songwriting, composition, and art...leading to a new creative phase in our artistic development.  We’re very excited about the many possibilities and look forward to sharing it all with you. 

Goals

In order to finish this record and get it officially released, we need to cover many expenses, including:

  • Album & tour promo campaigns including online ads & promotional services.  Promo campaigns easily add up to thousands of dollars, and can only run for as long as an artist is able to afford them. The more we can promote, the more we'll be able to reach new audiences, and hopefully land new opportunities that will help us keep growing. 
  • Manufacturing, shipping & handling fees of perks /merch for our campaign backers.
  • Cover expenses involved in recording gear (software, hardware, instrumentation, microphones, speakers)
  • Professional album mixing and mastering services
  • Indiegogo fees + credit card processing fees, taxes, etc

Stretch Goals

  • Replace older recording gear and add new recording components to our studio
  • Extended album promo campaigns 

Dream Goals

  • Help cover touring expenses to help promote this new album, including the purchase of a passenger or cargo/conversion van.

How You Can Help

  • You can "back us” here on Indiegogo, by selecting from the list of exclusive perks that we’ve put together, including copies of our music (digital & physical), original art, t-shirts, stickers... and even private performances.
  • And you can also send donations via Paypal as "family & friends" to our email account: soulifiedmusic@gmail.com  or via VENMO to @Paleface

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, you can still help us by spreading the word...

  • Sharing this campaign on social media
  • Emailing your friends and family
  • Word-of-mouth

.................................................................................................

ORIGINAL PAINTINGS BY PALEFACE

Paleface is also a prolific artist, and his bold, musical, and inspirational paintings are collected by fans worldwide. PF first started painting when living in New York City, and established-artist-friends encouraged him to paint, giving him canvas, brushes & paints. They were very happy with the results, and included Paleface's first collection in one of their group art shows in NYC, which lead to Paleface's first art sales. This inspired Paleface to keep painting and bring new paintings with him on the road, to see if others would be interested in his art. Since then, he's sold countless original paintings & prints. By purchasing one of these art perks, you're investing in Paleface, both as a musician & artist, and as we keep growing & selling more art, your new painting will hopefully also keep growing in value. 

Selected art pieces by PALEFACE are available for sale at our concerts, and online via: www.PalefaceOnline.com

FEATURED DRUMHEADS

"One-of-a-kind" paintings by PALEFACE on Mo's used drumheads which already have a light aluminum rim that allows for easy hanging on any wall, (with a tack or nail), These paintings are our top selling art pieces, collected by fans of all ages.

Thank You

Your support means the world to us and keep us going. Thanks so much for joining us on this journey and helping us grow. Sending everlasting love and gratitude your way,

PALEFACE  (PF and Mo) 

www.PalefaceOnline.com

...................................................................................................................................................

story:
Mon nom est Sola Nkani, je suis artiste multi-disciplinaire, diplômée en musique (UdeMontréal) et en enseignement (UOttawa).  Mon parcours musical est éclectique.  Formée en classique, active en jazz, je chante avec une signature soul. 

Avec ces Berceuses, j'ai réussi à créer de la musique  réconfortante, non infantilisante.  Les multiples superpositions vocales forment un univers content et chaleureux.  C'est un projet d'une très grande importance pour moi, car je le dédie aux nouveaux-nés de ma famille.  

Mon objectif est d'atteindre le montant de 1 500 dollars, ce qui comblera les coûts des 2 tiers du projets.

Les Berceuses de Sola sont déjà attendues par tout mon entourage.  Grâce à une précédente campagne de socio-financement, l'album peace music (2016) a vu le jour.  Je reprend le travail avec Thierry Gauthier du studio de Castelnau (Audiosculpture) avec joie.  Nous enregistrons et mixons dans la semaine du 15 au 21 avril 2018.  

Que vous soyez ici par curiosité ou par intérêt, je vous remercie vraiment d'être présent.  S'il-vous-plait, faites circuler cette campagne, passez le mot!  Votre argent sera bien investi. 

Tous les donateurs recevront un code pour télécharger l'album après sa mise en ligne.  

MERCI!!

story:
Mini Album Tracklisting

1. Hot City ft. Bilal Hassani

 

2. SXW ft. Kotic Couture

3. Princess

4. Forgotten Natives

**Bonus Track**

 

These are just a few of the amazing people featured on this project as of now

- Bilal Hassani (Featured on Hot City)

- Kotic Couture (Featured on SXW)

- Jeff Hue (Arrangement & Production)

- Mervyn (Guitarist & Partner)

- Phillip Poon (Keyboardist & 2nd Partner in crime)

- SyazMakeup (Make Up Artist)

*More to come 


WHAT: A brand new batch of songs I'm immensely proud of... 

WHERE: This album has been recorded at home and abroad—in jeff's apartment mostly. the songs were written in my trips to hong kong, taiwan, korea and when i was living in a one room apartment with my family when i was 18.

WHEN: The current timeline should see all production wrapped by the end of June, post-production wrapped by July and if we managed to raise more funds than expected, the manufacturing of physical copies should be wrapped by the end of september, and going out into the world some time in October. (of course, if we managed to print physical copies, those who pledged 30 and above will recieve a physical copy of the album as well as what is already included in the bundle)

 

Risks and challenges
well, the risk is that we might not be able to raise enough funds and that the entire record might need to be scratched. which i hope not cause im literally shaking with anxiety as i type this

story:
Hello Everyone! I am Kelsey Nakaji Kwong and I have been training in classical voice since I was 12 years old. As a 4th generation Japanese-American, I have been volunteering and singing in the Japanese-American Community for the past 10 years. Some of my favorite memories are performing for the older generations. Whether it was putting on a Holiday Concert at Keiro Nursing Home or singing the National Anthem for the WWII veterans at Go For Broke, singing in the community has always brought me so much joy.

 

Over the years, when I have been asked if I have a CD, I would always say “maybe someday.” But after seeing more and more people of that older generation passing on, especially those who are near and dear to me, I feel it is the right time to do this. This project is not only an homage to those who have shaped and inspired me, but a thank you to those who have helped and supported me along the way.

 

Your generous contributions will not only help cover the costs for the Recording Studio ($600), Sound Engineer ($600), Musicians ($1000), Videographer ($500), and CD Design & Manufacturing ($800), but also support the Performing Arts Program at Rancho Los Amigos Foundation.

 

I wanted to add a component to this project that gives back to the community and has real impact on people’s lives. As both music and medicine play important roles in my life, I wanted to partner with an arts medicine non-profit organization. I chose Rancho Los Amigos Foundation because I really connected and believed in their mission, which is to provide comprehensive rehabilitation services to individuals with physical disabilities due to illness or injury. Half of the proceeds from this IndieGoGo Campaign will be donated to the Rancho Los Amigos Foundation, in order to support and develop their Performing Arts Program.

 

I would like to invite you to be a part of this project and join me on this journey!

story: My name is Kylie Jenkins and I perform under the title, “Wonderwench.” I was born and raised in the Coachella Valley, California, surrounded by music, and always found solace in self-expression. Music means the world to me and so do listeners, fellow musicians, collaborators, and contributors. I am deeply rooted in my passion for writing, singing, playing piano, guitar, and whatever the hell I can get my hands on. In the words of Conor Oberst, “I like to feel the burn of the audience's eyes when I'm whispering all my darkest secrets into the microphone.” This is my debut EP and I need all the help I can get to make it happen. I need contributions so I can do what I love and you can love what I do. I want to share my music with passionate like-minded people like you! I need $500 so I can make physical copies of the EP, and some rad merch for you good people. Think of your favorite artist and all the shite they got you through in high school. Think of the times you were sobbing in your bed to Evanescence and My Chemical Romance, that later matured into Death Cab for Cutie, Bright Eyes, Elliott Smith, Brand New, or Bob Dylan. All those artists had to start somewhere, and so do I. I’ve gotten some exciting and encouraging reviews from my teaser track “Earthbound”, my favorite of which was “I’m sitting in a cafe listening to you sing and crying in public because you and your music are beautiful.” If I don’t reach my goal, the money will go to as many copies of the EP the resulting budget allows, and continue to raise funds in my community. This is my first major project and I’m bound to make some mistakes, but I’m excited about the learning process they will afford me on the journey to becoming the artist I aspire to be. Learning to overcome stage fright has empowered me already, and I know that with your help my dream of alternately comforting and challenging the world with my words and music can become a reality. Please share this campaign and my teaser track with your friends/family/cats.

story:
Summary

I've been making music independently for about ten years now and in that time I've managed to record three full length albums on a shoestring budget... but the time has come for me to take a shot at something more, it's time for me to make a world class record that'll be heard around the world. I'm going in a bit of a new direction on this record (It's much more dynamic, cinematic, and engaging, with programmed beats, grand piano, strings, synth pop textures, and plenty of vocals). These new songs are the best songs I've ever written and producer Elisa Pangsaeng is blowing my mind on the production side of things, I can't wait to share em with you, but I'm definitely gonna need your help to bring them to life!



What I Need & What You Get:
The cost of professionally recording, mixing, mastering, manufacturing, promoting, and distributing an album is quite high, so I've come up with a modest $35,000 dollar budget to get the job done right. Your generous contribution will go toward:

. Studio Rental/Engineer - $6,000
. Producer - $5,000
. Mixing - $7,000
. Mastering - $1,000
. Manufacturing - $5,000
. Music Video - $5,000
. Radio Promoter - $5000
. Publicist - $1,000

I've also come up with some great little perks as a small thank you for your generous contribution to my art. You can check em all out in the "Perks" section on the right!


The Impact

By contributing to this project you'll be giving life to something new and exciting, and together we'll be bringing more music and beauty into the world. My hope is that these new songs will uplift and inspire people everywhere, to not only overcome their current struggles but to grow and flourish because of them.
10% of all online sales will also be donated to the Psychiatric Ward at Vancouver General Hospital through the Make Mental Health Matter Campaign. (which to date I've raised nearly $30,000 dollars for) 


Risks and Challenges

$35,000 won't be an easy goal to attain but I believe in magic, and music, and the generosity of others, so I'm all in. I'm 100 percent dedicated to making this dream of sharing my music with the world a reality, and I'd love for you to join me on the journey. I'll be posting daily audio/video updates documenting every step of the way, and I think it's gonna be a lot-a-fun to share this adventure with you!



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute don't worry, You can still be a huge help to the campaign by getting the word out to everyone you know on the interwebz, and in real life too! Thank you so much for taking the time to check out my campaign, it means the world.

Sincerely yours,

Bodhi Jones

story:
More Like You - EP

I'm so excited to share this music with you! Over the past couple of years I have been writing in expectation that God would give me some songs for the church. I believe that these songs are a product of that. I hope, and believe that they are just the beginning. 

Three songs will be on the EP-
  1. More Like You
  2. Beyond What I Can See
  3. What King

Here's the Deal...

 I have been working on this album for over a year, tracking, editing, re-tracking, etc.. Up to this point, God has provided me with every means of production along the way! I'm so amazed by his providence. Now, its crunch time, and the album is ready for mixing and mastering, the final piece in the process of recording where the songs are made "radio ready." It just so happens to be the most expensive part of the process thus-far. One song has already been mixed and mastered. But the last two are still on hold.  Now, I do not have the financial means to complete this on my own. God has provided for the album completely up to this point, and I know that He will not abandon His work! This is where you come in! I know that God works through people as a way of provision for His family.I believe that you are supposed to be one of the most crucial parts of this process.

Here's the breakdown of needs:

  • $1000.00 for mixing (2 songs @ $500)
  • $300 for mastering (2 songs @ $150)
  • $200 for distribution costs
If you notice, the goal for the project is only $1500.  any additional funds will go towards hiring a professional graphic design artist, hiring a photographer, and paying the musicians that played for on the album for free! 


THANK YOU for being a part of this album!


The Songs!!
story_txt:
More Like You - EP
I'm so excited to share this music with you! Over the past couple of years I have been writing in expectation that God would give me some songs for the church. I believe that these songs are a product of that. I hope, and believe that they are just the beginning. 

Three songs will be on the EP-


More Like You


Beyond What I Can See


What King


   Here's the Deal...  I have been working on this album for over a year, tracking, editing, re-tracking, etc.. Up to this point, God has provided me with every means of production along the way! I'm so amazed by his providence. Now, its crunch time, and the album is ready for mixing and mastering, the final piece in the process of recording where the songs are made "radio ready." It just so happens to be the most expensive part of the process thus-far. One song has already been mixed and mastered. But the last two are still on hold.  Now, I do not have the financial means to complete this on my own. God has provided for the album completely up to this point, and I know that He will not abandon His work! This is where you come in! I know that God works through people as a way of provision for His family.I believe that you are supposed to be one of the most crucial parts of this process.
Here's the breakdown of needs:


$1000.00 for mixing (2 songs @ $500)
$300 for mastering (2 songs @ $150)
$200 for distribution costs

If you notice, the goal for the project is only $1500.  any additional funds will go towards hiring a professional graphic design artist, hiring a photographer, and paying the musicians that played for on the album for free! 
   
THANK YOU for being a part of this album!


The Songs!!

story:
Ciao

Siamo Lorenzo e Nadia, sposati con tre figli.Abbiamo fondato una casa di produzione cinematografica, brunchCinema.

Ormai sono alcuni anni che realizziamo prodotti cinematografici: cortometraggi, videoclip, spot pubblicitari, eventi, documentari.

Proprio quest’ultima tipologia di prodotto ha scaturito nelle nostre menti il progetto “360 MUSIC”.

Hello! We are Lorenzo and Nadia: we are married and  have three children. We created a film production company, called BrunchCinema. During the past years we have been producing short films, music videos, commercials, events and documentaries; it's thanks to this just mentioned kind of production that we came up to what we call "360MUSIC".


Cos'è "360 MUSIC"?

E’ una rubrica musicale, caricata sul nostro canale youtube, che cerca, tramite piccoli documentari, di far conoscere i talenti musicali del nostro territorio.

Questo progetto ci sta appassionando moltissimo e riscuote un grande interesse sia tra chi produce musica sia da chi ne usufruisce. Il nostro territorio, come del resto tutto il mondo, è ricchissimo di talenti musicali.

Ma perché 360? 360 perché la nostra rubrica tratta la musica a 360 gradi ovvero vuole parlare di tutti coloro che fanno musica, senza barriere, chi fa spettacolo tramite musical, solisti o band, di qualsiasi genere musicale.

What's "360MUSIC"? It's our online music programme on our youtube channel. We make short documentaries, aiming to let people get to know with our local talents. We are very passionate about this project and both musicians and mucic lovers seem to be very interested in it. And our area, as well as the all world, is full of people who want to make or just listen to good music. 
Why 360? Because we explore every kind of music at 360°. In fact we give space to all people making music, such as groups, solo singers, musical actors, with no boundaries.


Il nostro progetto 

Il nostro progetto è molto ambizioso: uscire dai confini territoriali e, cosa più interessante, creare il più grande archivio di talenti musicali che contenga non soltanto informazioni, ma veri e propri servizi documentaristici.
Our project is very ambitious: we want to step out the local borders and create the biggest talents' music library. It would not only provide more information but also proper documentaries.



Cosa chiediamo

Per realizzare questo progetto serve l’aiuto di tutti per l’acquisto di nuova attrezzatura e per consentirci di dedicare le nostre risorse a questo progetto.
Speriamo che il nostro progetto col tempo si diffonda in tutto il mondo perché la musica unisce, al di la di ogni barriera fisica e sociale, tutta l’umanità. E’ la lingua che accomuna tutti i popoli, fa sognare e rende liberi.
What we desire. In order to make it true, every help is precious to buy new equipment and to allow ourselves to be fully dedicated to this project.
We hope that time will allow our project to spread all over the world because we believe that, beyond any physical or social boundary, music does connect people. It's the global language for dreams and freedom.

story:
Hello friends and family!

Over the past year of being a band we've gotten to accomplish numerous goals and milestones that many bands as young as us don't come by. Overall, it has been an amazing year and we absolutely couldn't have done it without your support.

We are reaching out for your help to raise money for our 2nd EP that we plan on recording in January with Producers Zack and Kenneth from ZK Productions.( http://www.zkproductions.com/discography) 

We are asking for $3,000 but in total our next record will cost us around $15,000 which includes mastering, physical copies, music videos, and marketing budget. Every bit helps us and anything that we make beyond $3000 allows us to get new merchandise, tour beyond the west coast, and film more music videos. 

Everyone who donates will also receive various perks based on the donation amount. 

Thank you for your support. We love you!

Seth, Devon, Anna, Tracy, Nullin

story:
Update on 10/28/15 - Final countdown and less than halfway to go!  Thank you for all your generosity and please keep spreading the word! 

I wanted to share a little bit more about me and what my goals are for the upcoming year:

I've been spending the last two years developing my image and networking among business owners, artists of all sorts, charities, as well as online media outlets.  This past year I successfully managed and performed in a three hour showcase for our community's Pride Festival, as well as the 26th annual Ohio Lesbian Festival, and am hopeful for an even more successful 2016.  I want to travel and play my music in all of the places where I've been wanting to go (Nashville, Florida, California, England). Because in the end, I bring all of that home with me. That success will feed back into my community through acts of charity, as I have already performed in several charity events and am interested in organizing some of my own. 

Thank you again for your continued support!!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hello! My name is Sarah Cooperider and I am a singer/songwriter based out of Columbus, Ohio. I have been playing regularly at my monthly show 'Chicks with Picks' and at a multitude of shows around town for over a year, and have found it to be my passion. After the success of my showcase at Pride as well as the other festivals, contests and shows I played this summer (Pride, Ohio Lesbian Festival, Femmefest, O'Toole's Live Music Competition, etc) I have decided to stop denying my calling and devote the next year of my life to becoming a full time musician! To help this dream become a reality I have decided to release my very first album! 

These campaigns are designed to help "kickstart" these dreams to life (or make them indie-go-go?), so here is what I present to you:

By contributing to this campaign, you are helping me fund a professionally produced studio album. Every dollar you donate will be spent in the pursuit of making the best quality album for everyone to hear. The majority of the funds will go toward the actual studio recording/mastering, etc and the rest will be going toward getting the content to you via CD and download! I am providing a variety of "perks" including preordering my CD! 

I have set a date to begin recording in the next two weeks so that I can finish the album and get it to you as soon as possible! I can assure you it will be out in plenty of time for the Holidays! (It makes a great gift! ::wink::) I also plan on giving you regular updates as things move along!

I am poised for even greater success in the coming year - bigger shows and festivals, requests for booking from local venues, travel opportunities, etc - and I would love for all of you to be a part of making this dream come true! 

THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!! I AM SO EXCITED TO SHARE THIS EXPERIENCE WITH ALL OF YOU!!!!

story:
Shadow is cast by the light. 

We are here to help Creature Speak self-produce their first full length album. 

Straight from St. Catharines Ontario to the heart of the matter. 

Who is Creature Speak?

Beginning in 2010, under the name Howler, Brittany Brooks on nylon guitar and Nick Arseneau  on upright bass began creating music in a basement in Grimsby, Ontario. Together they created songs with humble melodies and rumbling bass. Soon after, the duo made a makeshift recording at an apple orchard and their sound started to spread throughout the Niagara region. Howler quickly became recognized as one of Niagara's most promising emerging talents. Throughout the next four years the duo worked with local recording artists and released three EPS:

Howler (Self Released)

For Your Own Sake (Indoor Shoes Records)

Creature Speak (Greenbelt Arts)

After a few shifts to the lineup, Brooks has stepped into the light with a more mature sound (and a name change). “Shadow Songs” is the first full-length album by Brooks, set for release on 30 October 2015 under the pseudonym Creature Speak. 

“Shadow Songs” is a complete narrative and acts as an homage to Brook’s father, who passed in October 2013. With a haunting and wise sound, she weaves personal experiences into larger narratives through stories of loss, loneliness and abuse. Buried beneath rich imagery, there are references to the paranormal and practices of communication with the afterlife. A few of the songs (“Olly Oxen Free”, “Phantom Apartment”, “Outro (Home)”) reference ghostly encounters that occurred during hospital visits to her father and in her home.  “I cry Olly Olly Oxen Free, can I make the sickness leave?” invokes child-like imagery to reface the struggle of watching someone consumed by sickness.

Joe Lapinski of WOW! Recording and Creative Music (St. Catharines) has come on as a producer and musical director to help to create an intimate record that explores solitary reflection. Brook’s haunting voice has been complemented with an arrangement of banjo, accordion, guitar, bass, pedal steel (Joe Lapinski), drums (Dave Clark) and more surprises. The full length record showcases a more mature writing style and is a true accomplishment for Creature Speak.



About the Goal

This campaign is to get the album "Shadow Songs"  out into the physical world where people can enjoy the music on  CD and LP.

  • I am seeking to raise $2,500 (CAD) to cover the anticipated expenses related to manufacturing and distributing a limited run of CDs and LPs as well as the studio time required to make the album. Since the album is self-released there is no financial support from a label, so I am reaching out to you for your help! 
  • The remaining balance of funds will be used to pay artist fees for collaborators and performers at the "Shadow Songs" release show, October 30th, 2015 at The Odd Fellows Hall (36 James St, Floor Two) in St. Catharines. Working with Suitcase in Point Theatre Company, the release show will feature musical performances from LUKA (Toronto) and Creature Speak with supporting band and will include installations from local artists. This fundraiser will help pay all of the artists and performers, and hopefully recoup the hall rental fees. 

Local Love

This album was written, recorded, produced, mixed and mastered all in St. Catharines, ON and features the talents of local musicians. The release show will be the official launch of the album but also a celebration of the St. Catharines community and the love that you have shown this music throughout the last five years. 

Risky Challenges

If the campaign is unsuccessful the album will not be created in a physical form and will only live online. This will also limit the ability for Creature Speak to travel and share as there will be no financial support from merchandise. Also, without these funds, it will be a struggle to pay the contributing artists and performers at the release show. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate personally to this campaign, please spread the word to your friends, family and co-workers. Any bit will help.  Thank you for your support and love.

story:
Who We Are

We are Faintheart and we are an indie rock band from the Sunflower State of Kansas and we are asking for YOUR help to record our next album! This album, ‘The Overview Effect’ is an album about being connected and our shared humanity. In a time of disconnectedness, and confusion we took those feelings and rather than harboring cynicism we decided to create something to help us better understand ourselves, and better understand the world around us. This album is important to us, and we would not be able to do it without your help. By helping us, you are contributing to art that aims to heal and restore.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for your help to raise $6,000 for our next EP. Here’s the thing, we have already written the record and it is ready to go, so we aren’t asking for your help to fund something that doesn’t exist. In turn, we want to give you this new album early by helping to fund this project. We want to get to know you, and our campaign updates are going to include our Listening Club and we are going to share albums that mean a lot to us and we want to know what means a lot to you! We are partnering with a coffee roaster to bring you custom Faintheart Coffee (you should know we live on coffee) and we are even recording a ‘Hushed’ EP with acoustic/reimagining of some of our current songs and maybe a few new ones! So yes, you’re going to get even more music by helping us.

Okay. So What?

We believe in these songs. It’s as simple as that. We have managed to do the past release of songs by ourselves, but we think that these songs are so important that we want to spend as much time on them to bring you the best music that we possibly can. What does that look like? It looks like us spending more time with the team at Shadow Scape Records to dive into each song and squeeze out the marrow of art. Again, we have already finished writing this record, so think of this like a preorder, because we are not asking you to fund something that does not exist. We believe that art is powerful, and that art can heal, and we are asking for your help to create something that we think matters.

Risks & Challenges

Recording an album is expensive. We are asking for $6,000 to help cover the bare minimum that we have done the math for to cover the creation of this record. Your generosity, will obviously be going to help us buy iPads, lots of candy, a sports car and pay our rent. Just kidding. Your money will actually be going to the costs of:

Studio Time

Engineer Time

Producer Time

Mixing Time

Mastering Time

CD Production Costs

We are asking for your help to record The Overview Effect and help bring these songs to life!

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it 100%. You might not be able to help out financially, but just telling your friends and families and all of your weird uncles about this album, and about this Crowdfund Campaign will help tremendously. Honestly, anytime you tell someone about our band it helps, and we are not sure if we have ever found a proper way to thank everyone, but we think that continuing to create music is a great start to that. Follow us on social media, and Indiegogo has great share tools built in. We would love your support in whatever way that looks like to you.

story:
Sypnopsis

  • Having been playing the local scene in Ontario and Quebec for the last five years we've seen the ups and down that being a musician can bring. 
  • This campaign, simply put, is a means for us to feasibly record our new album on a well balanced budget. 
  • Only with your help can hope to reach the intended goal of recording this album along with the music videos we're going to shoot for it. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • With a budget of 3000 dollars we've been able to plan for all the costs that go with recording and printing this album as well as the music videos that will go with it. 
  • Our perks will be ranging from a download of our EP all the way up to a chance to play on the album yourself.
  • Should we fail in reaching our goal, all the funds raised will still be used on this project, so do not hesitate to donate, every bit helps. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are aware some of you are unable to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share on facebook and other various social medias to spread the word.
  • Word of mouth sharing is equally important and just as helpful to us.
story_txt:
Sypnopsis  Having been playing the local scene in Ontario and Quebec for the last five years we've seen the ups and down that being a musician can bring.  This campaign, simply put, is a means for us to feasibly record our new album on a well balanced budget.  Only with your help can hope to reach the intended goal of recording this album along with the music videos we're going to shoot for it. 
   What We Need & What You Get  With a budget of 3000 dollars we've been able to plan for all the costs that go with recording and printing this album as well as the music videos that will go with it.  Our perks will be ranging from a download of our EP all the way up to a chance to play on the album yourself. Should we fail in reaching our goal, all the funds raised will still be used on this project, so do not hesitate to donate, every bit helps. 


    Other Ways You Can Help We are aware some of you are unable to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Share on facebook and other various social medias to spread the word.
Word of mouth sharing is equally important and just as helpful to us.

story:
Welcome to Kleine Kammermusik’s crowdfunding webpage. We are very excited to launch our fundraising campaign in order to generate funds for our first CD recording. KKM is a unique group comprising some of the country's leading players of Baroque chamber music. With our line up of two oboes, bassoon and continuo, Flights of Fancy: From Paris to Dresden promises to delight all lovers of baroque music. It will focus on dazzling virtuosic works from composers who worked in two cities known for their baroque flair.  If you are new to our group, please visit our website to learn more about us.


Geoffrey Burgess, oboe and recorder
Meg Owens, oboe and recorder
Stephanie Corwin, bassoon
Rebecca Humphrey, cello and viola da gamba
Leon Schelhase, harpsichord

Visit our website


What We Need & What You Get

Many people are surprised to find out how much it costs to make a recording. The costs of hiring an engineer, a producer, manufacturing and marketing the CD and commissioning cover art all add up very quickly. We have some extremely talented people on board with this project and we believe it will result in a very special product.
We want to be very transparent with our supporters. The graph below illustrates our projected budget, showing how the money we hope to raise will be spent. 



Of course, every investment has some return. We have many different gifts available to you in appreciation for your support. Our perks range from free CD's to tote bags, and house concerts!

Check them out:

In addition to online contributions, we also welcome check donations!
Checks should be made out to "Fractured Atlas" and mailed to the following address:

Kleine Kammermusik c/o Stephanie Corwin
37-20 87th Street, Apt. 6B
Jackson Heights, NY 11372

Please indicate "Kleine Kammermusik" on the memo line.



Risks & Challenges

One of our biggest challenges in bringing our music to you has been managing our schedules as busy musicians. As a result, we have put enormous time and effort into working on the music we will be sharing with you. Even when it involves juggling emails, Skype meetings and rehearsals in different parts of the country, our energy has been focused on improving our craft and bringing the best we have to give. We have made all the arrangements for the recording, which will take place at the Gould Recital Hall at the Curtis Institute of Music. We also have a wonderfully talented production and engineering team lined up. We have devoted countless hours of rehearsal and planning towards this project and we are ready to see our dream come to fruition.

The biggest challenge of all, of course, is having the means to pay for it. This is where you come in. We are ready, but we do need your help to push us through to the next step. By supporting our drive, whether through pledging, donating or sharing our campaign on social media, you will help us to reach our goal in no time. Only then can we bring you the music both you and we love. Together we can make it possible.




Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn’t the only way you can help us. By using Indiegogo’s “share” tools, or spreading the word on Facebook and Twitter, the word will get out and maybe make contact with other people that can contribute. Every little bit helps in a drive to raise funds, and you have our deepest thanks for that little bit. Help us make the goal so we may continue to inspire and delight you through the power of music. 


Thank You

Thank you for your interest and your support. This project is possible only with the participation of people like you and for that we are truly grateful. 

Sincerely,

Kleine Kammermusik


Kleine Kammermusik is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Kleine Kammermusik must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
To donate after this campaign is closed, go to our Fractured Atlas Page. 

Who are we?

Act Too Studio Opera Workshop is an ongoing, student-driven educational arts project with performances throughout the year, including a fully-staged opera each summer.

Our growing workshop includes students between the ages of 13-19 at varying levels of vocal development, musical skill, and experience. Works are chosen with those factors in mind, and though this work is intended to be performed for the community, the focus of the workshop itself is very process-heavy. In order to bring their work to performance level, students are guided through deep musical and theatrical analysis of everything they do, along with study of the work’s cultural and historical context.

Why does this matter?

Though we went into this project with the goal of improving our students’ musical skills, the real understanding that came out of it for all of us is that opera is for everyone. As our students discovered themselves and their own truths in the music and in their characters, their driving motivation became to share this discovery with everyone they know. And then they did, with remarkable success. 

Tickets for last summer’s full opera production (Gian Carlo Menotti’s The Medium) were mostly gone well before opening night, and we found ourselves scrambling to cram in extra seats as other teens begged to be able to get in—some for a repeat performance. Just as our students surprised us with their initial interest in this project, they’ve also been the ones to show us that our conventional ideas about what most people will like or accept are just plain wrong.

What are we doing?

Act Too Studio Opera Workshop presents the works of 17th-century composer Claudio Monteverdi in Il sogno d'Arianna, a full-length, original narrative woven from excerpts from his operas, madrigals, and other works.

Drawing on the framework of Monteverdi’s “Lamento d’Arianna,” the sole surviving fragment of his opera L’Arianna, Il sogno d’Arianna begins with the tale of Ariadne, princess of Crete, and her abandonment by Athenian hero Theseus on the island of Naxos. Joined by an assembly of women hailing from Monteverdi’s many sources, including Greek myth and Torquato Tasso’s epic 16th-century poem La Gerusalemme liberata (Jerusalem Delivered), Ariadne seeks comfort and meaning in their shared stories, told through both music dance.

In addition to L’Arianna, the piece includes excerpts from Monteverdi’s L’Orfeo, as well as pieces from his 8th book of madrigals and selected Scherzi Musicali (“Lamento della ninfa,” “Il combattimento di Tancredi e Clorinda,” “Zefiro torna e di soavi accenti,” “Chiome d’oro“and many more). For this project, the Workshop has created its own new editions of these works, including new English translations and arrangements adapted specifically for its teen singers.

This project does not stop at our production, however, We will also publish our new English libretto and newly-edited score for licensed use by other educational institutions, to help share our love for this work for years to come. With its accessible libretto, scored for flexible voice types, it is an ideal vehicle for production by young classical singers. 

Why do we need your help?

In an era when the arts have become increasingly a luxury item, we at Act Too Studio Opera Workshop are dedicated to making our programming accessible to all our teens and to the community as a whole. To that end, we ask for your help.

This is by far the most ambitious project our workshop has undertaken–twice the length of our previous endeavors, with more than twice the number of cast members. More significantly, however, it is the depth and complexity of Monteverdi's music that calls for special attention. To help our teens get the most out of this experience, we've sought the expertise of cellist and composer James David Jacobs, whose deep knowledge of Monteverdi's work has allowed us to create our own new editions of this music for the workshop, which he is currently guiding them through in rehearsal, with a focus on both emotional and intellectual understanding of the music and text, as well as historical performance practice.  

This piece will be truly special, incorporating theater, ballet, and stage combat to bring Monteverdi's beautiful work to life,  in English (some for the very first time), for a new audience.  To help give this project the visibility it deserves, we've chosen to perform in the Pioneer Valley’s own beautiful, historic opera house, The Academy of Music. 

We've been fundraising all year for this project, and only have a short ways left to go! Your donations help us pay for this production's artistic needs, specifically the early music expertise, musical direction, and both ballet and fight choreography, as well as musicians to play for rehearsals and performances, our wonderful rehearsal space at Lighthouse Holyoke, set pieces, costumes, and, of course, our time at the Academy with its highly-trained technical staff. 

How else can you help?

We believe that this project is something extraordinary, and we're proud to be creating it, both for our students, and for the community that has nurtured them and opened their hearts (and ears!) to the beauty of opera. If you're unable to contribute, you can still help spread the word!  If you think our teen opera program is something special, make some noise about it! Use Indiegogo's share tools to tell your friends and family about what we're doing, and encourage them to support us!   In return, we will make you the most beautiful piece we can. We will make you proud. 


Act Too Studio Opera Workshop is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non‐profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Act Too Studio Opera Workshop must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” and are tax‐deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Dear Fans and Readers alike,

Thank you for checking out our campaign page.  We hope that you have stashed away some cash because we need your help.  Please pick a PERK that works best for you and support us in providing you NEW music in 2017.   

Our goal is to raise $10,000.  This funding will allow us to create TWO high-quality sounding EP's, support the PERKS for the campaign, and to advertise and push the records as needed.  To be quite honest, the success of our endeavors rests entirely in your hands. 

We have the songs. 

We just need your help with the funding. 

We want to thank you for all you've done in the past and for your support in the future.  This is a new chapter and a new journey.  We couldn't be more excited than we already are. 

We hope to see you all soon.

Sincerely,

K I D S .  

kids@kidsofficialmusic.com

story:
Dear Friends, 

SHUFFLE Concert is creating an exciting, new project titled "1933," a unique concert experience dedicated to music composed and premiered during this pivotal year in human history. Scheduled to premiere in January of 2018 at the Dell E. Webb Center in Wickenburg, Arizona, the SHUFFLE team hopes to perform "1933", a fascinating, all-engrossing, multi-media, concert experience, throughout the United States. In addition to the usual, spectacular playing and singing that SHUFFLE Concert fans have grown accustomed to, "1933" will feature archival and original video footage, as well as historic images of the art and architecture of the day, all illuminated by an original lighting design.

"1933" allows SHUFFLE Concert to step outside the box by creating a unique experience in which music, art, and history intersect. We need your help to bring this innovative concept to the concert stage! This is an opportunity for you to have a front row seat during the creation of an original concert production that celebrates the life and music of some of the greatest musicians, composers, and writers of the 20th Century.

What & What?

Your generous donation will help us in several important ways:

  • Commission unique arrangements by composers Jonathan Keren and Dan Kaufman
  • Commission of an original David Bruce composition to be based on Lorca's "Blood Wedding" (written in 1933) 
  • Create original video interludes using archival footage
  • Hire a director and lighting designer
  • Video documentation of "1933"
  • Public relations
  • Purchase performing rights for music that is not in public domain
  • And ensure that we have enough gas to get to Wickenburg! 

Check out the perks menu to see what you get in return for your donation (not to mention our undying gratitude)! 

        

Why is this project important?

1933, a pivotal year in world history, saw the advent of political figures, sociological movements, and historic events that influenced the remainder of the 20th Century as well as the world we live in today. From the reign of George V to the dictatorship of Stalin, from Gandhi's hunger strike to the Ukranian genocide, and from FDR's New Deal to the end of Prohibition in the United States, 1933 marked the beginning of an era rife with political turmoil and human suffering. SHUFFLE Concert's "1933" illuminates the historical, sociological and political impact of this period by exploring the music and art of this remarkable era in human history. During this thought-provoking and moving concert experience, you will be enlightened and inspired by the indomitable strength and spirit of the writers, composers, musicians, and artists who absorbed the turbulence of the era, resonated it in their souls, and reflected it in their art.

We look forward to partnering with you on this exciting, new venture. Thank you, in advance, for your generosity and interest in SHUFFLE Concert's "1933". Please share the invitation to join this campaign with your friends and families. We need you all.

The SHUFFLE Team

Ensemble: Hassan Anderson, Eliran Avni, Ariadne Greif, Moran Katz, Sofia Nowik and Brendan Speltz

Board Of Directors: Michael Ostroff, Chair, Deborah Broder, Mimi Hyman, Richard Lissemore, Dr. Octavio Pajaro and Dominique van de Stadt

                                                

What's on the program

Scene 1: Overture to the Silbersee / K. Weill arr. J. Keren

Scene 2: Prologue to the Seven Deadly Sins / K. Weill arr. J. Keren

Scene 3: Piano Trio No. 2, Op. 67 / J. Turina

Scene 4: Interlude for Oboe and Piano / G. Finzi

Scene 5: "Hey! Young Fella" / Fields & McHugh arr. D. Kaufman

Scene 6: Cello Sonata Op. 6 / S. Barber

Scene 7: "Sophisticated Lady"/ D. Ellington arr. D. Kaufman

Scene 8: Preludes Op. 34 / D. Shostakovich arr. U. Vachenstein 

Scene 9: Tango: "Mia" / A. Vardaro arr. J. Keren

Scene 10: French Chanson: "La Femme est Faite pour l'Homme" / C. Oberfeld arr. J. Keren

Scene 11: "Lulu's Aria" / A. Berg arr. J. Keren

Scene 12: Two Piano Pieces / A. Roussel & F. Poulenc

Scene 13: Violin Sonata / J. Jezek

Scene 14: "Smoke Gets in Your Eyes" / Kern & Harbach arr. Dan Kaufman

Scene 15: Five pieces from Mikrokosmos / B. Bartok arr. J. Keren

Scene 17: Commissioned Work: "Lullabye" from Lorca’s "Blood Wedding" / D. Bruce

Finale 18: Cabaret / Kander & Ebb arr. J. Keren

                                                    

From the Ensemble:

Eliran Avni: "I was always interested in 1933. My entire family history is shaped by what happened that year and I always wondered what were the people of that time thinking about? What were they doing, writing, listening to? Were they aware of the clouds gathering around them? Did they realize that what happened that year would shape history forever?

I was also curious to see what would happen if we, as a chamber music ensemble, would limit ourselves to only one time period, one year. What would the playlist sound like?

This is a musical retrospective, spanning the gamut of an entire year. Almost all of the pieces were either written or performed in 1933 by great composers such as: Weill, Barber, Shostakovich, Ellington, Bartok, and Finzi. Alongside these classical masterpieces, we will be playing hit tunes such as “Smoke Gets In Your Eyes” and “Sophisticated Lady” as well as a new work by David Bruce based on Lorca’s “Blood Wedding”, which was also written in 1933.

I think we have created a fascinating playlist for this concert. We will go from Cabaret to 12-tone, from Post-Romantic to Broadway all in one evening. You will hear the joy in the music as well as signs of the darkness looming.

This project means the world to me: I really love this music, it’s a tour-de-force for us in terms of the musical challenges it poses, and it’s a tribute to my grandparents and family who were so deeply affected by what happened that year. Most importantly, I hope it will open our eyes to the world around us and maybe make us aware of issues we may not have previously considered.

I hope people are going to come out of this show moved by these composers and this music, by the richness of the scores and different genres. I hope that audiences leave thinking about the times we are living in and whether or not our times are being reflected in the music and the arts of today.

With this project, I envision designing a cohesive concert that runs as a multi-media production. This is an exercise in creating a new musical experience both in content and presentation. Think of it as your YouTube playlist coming to life in front of you and taking you on a crazy journey back in time to 1933."
