Weill arr. J. KerenScene 2: Prologue to the Seven Deadly Sins / K. Weill arr. J. KerenScene 3: Piano Trio No. 2, Op. 67 / J. TurinaScene 4: Interlude for Oboe and Piano / G. FinziScene 5: "Hey! Young Fella" / Fields & McHugh arr. D. KaufmanScene 6: Cello Sonata Op. 6 / S. BarberScene 7: "Sophisticated Lady"/ D. Ellington arr. D. KaufmanScene 8: Preludes Op. 34 / D. Shostakovich arr. U. Vachenstein Scene 9: Tango: "Mia" / A. Vardaro arr. J. KerenScene 10: French Chanson: "La Femme est Faite pour l'Homme" / C. Oberfeld arr. J. KerenScene 11: "Lulu's Aria" / A. Berg arr. J. KerenScene 12: Two Piano Pieces / A. Roussel & F. PoulencScene 13: Violin Sonata / J. JezekScene 14: "Smoke Gets in Your Eyes" / Kern & Harbach arr. Dan KaufmanScene 15: Five pieces from Mikrokosmos / B. Bartok arr. J. KerenScene 17: Commissioned Work: "Lullabye" from Lorca’s "Blood Wedding" / D. BruceFinale 18: Cabaret / Kander & Ebb arr. J. Keren                                                    From the Ensemble:Eliran Avni: "I was always interested in 1933. My entire family history is shaped by what happened that year and I always wondered what were the people of that time thinking about? What were they doing, writing, listening to? Were they aware of the clouds gathering around them? Did they realize that what happened that year would shape history forever?I was also curious to see what would happen if we, as a chamber music ensemble, would limit ourselves to only one time period, one year. What would the playlist sound like?This is a musical retrospective, spanning the gamut of an entire year. Almost all of the pieces were either written or performed in 1933 by great composers such as: Weill, Barber, Shostakovich, Ellington, Bartok, and Finzi. Alongside these classical masterpieces, we will be playing hit tunes such as “Smoke Gets In Your Eyes” and “Sophisticated Lady” as well as a new work by David Bruce based on Lorca’s “Blood Wedding”, which was also written in 1933.I think we have created a fascinating playlist for this concert. We will go from Cabaret to 12-tone, from Post-Romantic to Broadway all in one evening. You will hear the joy in the music as well as signs of the darkness looming.This project means the world to me: I really love this music, it’s a tour-de-force for us in terms of the musical challenges it poses, and it’s a tribute to my grandparents and family who were so deeply affected by what happened that year. Most importantly, I hope it will open our eyes to the world around us and maybe make us aware of issues we may not have previously considered.I hope people are going to come out of this show moved by these composers and this music, by the richness of the scores and different genres. I hope that audiences leave thinking about the times we are living in and whether or not our times are being reflected in the music and the arts of today.With this project, I envision designing a cohesive concert that runs as a multi-media production. This is an exercise in creating a new musical experience both in content and presentation. Think of it as your YouTube playlist coming to life in front of you and taking you on a crazy journey back in time to 1933."

story:
English version see below

“La musica deve far sprizzare il fuoco dallo spirito degli uomini.” 

Beethoven

Sarasvati ha scelto come evento speciale del 2017 l’esecuzione integrale delle 32 Sonate di Beethoven attraverso una maratona di concerti che si svilupperanno in 5 giornate. Il suono e la progressione delle sonate può essere vista come un’allegoria sulla ricerca e sulla vita che va al di là di quanto i nostri occhi possono vedere e si spinge fino ai limiti che l'essere umano è capace di percepire. Beethoven interpreta questa illimitatezza come perfezione, trasformazione e coraggio di essere fedele alle proprie intuizioni.  Partendo da questi presupposti vogliamo proporre l'esperienza delle Sonate non solo come ascolto musicale ma come percorso interiore che può guidare chi partecipa verso una comprensione maggiore del senso della vita e della sua evoluzione: un inno alla libertà.  I concerti saranno eseguiti ed introdotti a cura del Maestro M. Campanella e dalla sua scuola pianistica. L’evento si terrà in una splendida sala concerti nel verde dell’Umbria e della campagna di Città della Pieve.
Supportando la realizzazione di questo evento contribuirai non solo alla realizzazione di un evento musicale raro nel suo genere ma anche a risvegliare nell’animo di chi parteciperà la visione di un potere della trasformazione che l'uomo ha e che tende alla costruzione di un Mondo migliore.

Altri modi di aiutare:
Potete contribuire anche diffondendo l’evento tra i vostri amici e conoscenti e usando  il tool di condivisione di Indiegogo.
Un’alternativa può anche essere quella  di  partecipare all'evento in prima persona acquistando o regalaando ai vostri amici dei biglietti per l'intera maratona o per uno dei concerti. I biglietti sono disponibili all'indirizzo 32sonate.eventbrite.it
 

"Music should strike fire from the heart of man."

Beethoven

As special event 2017 Sarasvati presents the integral execution of the 32 Beethoven Sonatas through a marathon of concerts that will develop in 5 days. We propose the sonatas as an allegory of human life characterized by a continuous search for new dimensions and expressions. Beethoven is an extraordinary example of this striving for perfection and transformation combined with the courage of feeling always free to follow his insights. Thus, the experience of the sonatas will not only be a music listening but an “Anthem of Freedom”, an inner path that can lead participants to a deeper understanding of the meaning of life and its evolution. The execution of the concerts will be curated and introduced by Michele Campanella and his students, who for years studied the compositions of Beethoven. A seminar will deepen further the understanding. The performances will take place in a beautiful concert hall on the Umbrian countryside nearby Città della Pieve.

Support the 32 Sonatas and you will not only contribute to the realization of a rare musical event but also to spreading the power of transformation that leads us to build a better world.

Alternative ways to help the project
You can also help by spreading the event among your friends and using the Indiegogo sharing tool.

An alternative may be to buy for yourself or your friends the tickets for all , some or even one of the concerts as a gift, which can be purchased through 32sonate.eventbrite.it (website in Italian, click on "Biglietti" and you will see the translations)

Di cosa abbiamo bisogno e cosa avrai in cambio

Il budget dell’iniziativa prevede un costo totale di € 21.000 di cui di seguito sono indicati i dettagli. Sarasvati intende finanziarne attraverso il crowd-funding una parte pari ad almeno  € 7.000.

A copertura del budget sono inoltre previste delle sponsorizzazioni dirette che al momento hanno già portato € 2.500€, dei concerti di fund-raising e i ricavi derivanti dalla partecipazione all’evento. Doni speciali che consentiranno un contatto con l’iniziativa saranno messi a disposizione per i donatori che attraverso il  crowd-funding sosterranno l’evento.

 

What we need and what you get
The budget of the initiative provides a total cost of € 21.000, detailed above. We finance this cost through the crowd-funding to an amount of min. € 7,000. Furthermore, the costs will be covered by direct sponsorship, fund-raising concerts and the revenue from the participation in the event.

 

We provide special rewards that allow you a contact with the beauty of the 32 Sonatas even if you don’t participate personally.

 

Perché partecipare

E’ provato che la musica ha il potere di arrivare direttamente al cuore, dare coraggio, gioia e attivare un processo di trasformazione in chi l’ascolta. Se anche per te è così sostieni il progetto e se vuoi partecipa all'iniziativa. Ascoltare le appassionate 32 Sonate e comprendere il loro messaggio è un’opportunità per contattare se stessi, aprirsi ad un nuovo sguardo verso il mondo  ed incantarsi di fronte alla visione di un umanità libera che il suono di Beethoven fa immaginare.

Why join the project? 
It is proved that music has the power to get directly to the heart, give courage, joy and activates a process of transformation in the listeners. If for share this vision support the project donating and/or participating in the initiative. Listen to the passionate 32 Sonatas and understand their message is an opportunity to contact ourselves, open to a new view of the world and be enchanted in front of the vision of a free humanity that makes the sound of Beethoven imagine.

Rischi e Sfide

Il maggior rischio dell’iniziativa delle 32 Sonate riguarda la possibilità di non riuscire a raggiungere le risorse necessarie per coprire i costi. Anche per questo stiamo organizzando questa campagna di raccolta fondi e la vendita dei biglietti in Italia e all’estero. Un altro rischio può essere rappresentato da una scarsa partecipazione all’evento, e anche in questo caso stiamo provando a contenere il rischio attraverso un' ampia pubblicità della maratona musicale e la scelta di svolgerla all’inizio di agosto, un momento in cui diversi turisti italiani e stranieri frequentano l’Umbria e Città della Pieve.
 

Risks and challenges
The major risk of the initiative of the 32 Sonatas lies in not collecting the necessary funds to cover the costs. For this we are organizing this campaign of fundraising and ticket sales in Italy and abroad. Another risk represents a low participation in the event. We limit this risk through a wide publicity of the musical marathon and the decision to carry it out in early August, a period when many tourists from Italy and foreign countries come to Umbria and Città della Pieve.
 

Chi è Sarasvati? 

Come la dea indù “Sarasvati”, “colei che scorre”, l’associazione, costituita nel 2014, mira a “scorrere” in campi di conoscenza più profondi, grazie a “viaggi nell’arte” e all' “arte del viaggio”. Nata da un’esperienza più che decennale nel campo culturale artistico Sarasvati promuove ogni forma di arte attraverso varie manifestazioni (concerti, mostre, spettacoli), sostegno di giovani talenti e viaggi di ricerca e di esperienza in luoghi di particolare significato culturale e naturale.

Who is Sarasvati?  
As the Hindu goddess 'Sarasvati' ("the flowing one") the association (founded in 2014) aims to "scroll" in the deepest fields of knowledge through "travelling into art" and "the art of travelling”. Born from over ten years experience in art and culture Sarasvati promotes art events (concerts, exhibitions, performances), promotes young talents and undertakes journeys to particular places of cultural and natural significance.

story:
Short Summary

This is my very first album outside of the classroom!  I have been teaching music for 22 years. My passion is inspiring kids with a love for music. Often the classroom and teaching schedule can leave you without the time or energy for your own music...but despite that, over the years I have written songs inspired by my love for kids, the classroom, and full of silly frivolous lyrics with the occasional deeper life lesson.    

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • My goal is to raise as close to what I need a possible.  My album will cost another $3,500 to finish.
  • If I don't reach my goal, I will be cutting some corners on production and editing.

 

The Impact

 

  • Excellent albums in the recording studio typically take tens of thousands of dollars due to the use of high-end equipment, time on the clock with a skilled engineer, etc.  These funds give my album/songs that little bit of polish to not sound like I recorded into a mic in my living room.
  • I have recorded and finished several albums through teaching companies I work for!  I have grown quite a bit in the time since then.  Have figured out a lot more tricks on Garage Band!
  • This is music I hope to take to live performances.

Short Summary
This is my very first album outside of the classroom!  I have been teaching music for 22 years. My passion is inspiring kids with a love for music. Often the classroom and teaching schedule can leave you without the time or energy for your own music...but despite that, over the years I have written songs inspired by my love for kids, the classroom, and full of silly frivolous lyrics with the occasional deeper life lesson.    

What We Need & What You Get
 

My goal is to raise as close to what I need a possible.  My album will cost another $3,500 to finish.
If I don't reach my goal, I will be cutting some corners on production and editing.


 
The Impact
 

Excellent albums in the recording studio typically take tens of thousands of dollars due to the use of high-end equipment, time on the clock with a skilled engineer, etc.  These funds give my album/songs that little bit of polish to not sound like I recorded into a mic in my living room.
I have recorded and finished several albums through teaching companies I work for!  I have grown quite a bit in the time since then.  Have figured out a lot more tricks on Garage Band!
This is music I hope to take to live performances.

story:
OUR PROJECT

This music video will be a chance to further the message of “Truth” through a visual experience that will put the song in perspective and context. It’s a chance to expose more people to the music and create a connection between the viewers, listeners, and the message of the song. The choice between accepting life as it truly is or blocking out the dark parts as best you can is something we all have to make and this video will help to show people that you’re not alone and that whatever you decide, there are people living in your world, whichever one you choose. 

Julia is incredibly excited to collaborate with Jake on the visual expression “Truth.” She connected strongly to the themes expressed in Jakes song - the fact that growing up means growing to see people as whole and imperfect and realizing that theres a beauty in that. Its a blessing to find good music and Julia is incredibly excited to create something with Jake to help bring exposure to his talents. 

OUR TEAM 

Jake Tavill (Artist): 

If the soulful, empathetic lyrics and melodies of Marvin Gaye, Isaac Hayes, and Bill Withers had an illegitimate child with the complex, moving instrumentation of Parliament Funkadelic, it would result in the music of Jake Tavill. He voices his messages through honest, introspective lyrics working in tandem with an accompaniment that illustrates the deep emotions of the stories he tells.

     At 21, he has studied music at Berklee College of Music, the Village East Conservatory, and is currently studying at NYU Tisch’s Clive Davis Institute of Recorded Music. Jake plays frequently with his backing band, The Indigo Child Blues Band, in NYC and NJ, along with popular and classic venues all across the U.S. Jake loves writing and performing his music, but nothing makes him happier than having a personal connection with his audience. 

To see more about Jake check out his website: http://www.jaketavill.com/

Julia Kupiec (Director):

Julia is a director and cinematographer from Santa Barbara, California. During Julia's time at NYU, she has worked on dozens of productions across many departments. She has served professionally as a cinematographer, gaffer, editor and assistant camera and is very excited to bring her experience to the directing table on the music video for “Truth.” She has assembled a dream team of talented filmmakers to collaborate with her and Jake on this music video and can’t wait to start production.

Ace Buckley (Director of Photography):

Ace Buckley is a senior in NYU’s film and television program. Originating from Los Angeles, Ace has grown up on set. His entire family is in the film business and he would talk about lighting setups with his father over dinner. He has shot many a film and gaffed even more, from thesis films to professional productions. He’s not afraid to crack a joke or a lens. Just kidding. He is extremely excited and feels privileged to be part of this project.

Claire Stacy (Producer): 

Claire Stacy is a senior in NYU’s film and television program, and she is most commonly found producing films and other projects. Originally from San Francisco, Claire has worked on a number of sets in many different roles and has interned at companies like RSA, Pomp&Clout, and the Daily Show. She claims to enjoy the stress of producing, but we’ll let you be the judge of that.

Madeleine Wall (Producer):

Madeleine is from Santa Barbara, California, and is a senior at NYU Tisch. Madeleine has been a producer and artistic director on multiple student films and has done several internships within film production and television. Originally an acting major, she has brought her acting background to her producing work and has a particular love for comedy. She is very excited to be a part of this project, and looks forward to working with such a fantastic crew.

THE NECESSITIES

While our goal is to create a low-budget film, the more money we are able to raise, the more we will be able to fully realize the vision for this song. Your money goes towards covering the production costs of this music video. We want to use the best equipment possible and, with your help, we can get there! To add to the excitement of funding our project (apart from the excitement of supporting our awesome group), we have included multiple "perks". Jake and his band are incredibly talented and we are looking forward to seeing this project take off!

Below is a visual to demonstrate how your money will be allocated:

OTHER WAYS TO GIVE

Again, with this being a low-budget project, every dollar is absolutely necessary and will be put towards the project. If you are not able to contribute financially, please share our page - spreading the word is a huge help to us!

Jake and his band are incredibly talented and we are looking forward to seeing this project take off!

story:
Established by band members of The OSYX, This Could Go Boom! anticipates a world where music informed by—and created from—gender diverse perspectives is normalized. TCGB! envisions equal representation over airwaves, online, at music festivals, and in positions of power and influence throughout the music landscape. TCGB! will achieve this through:

  • Representing Cis and Trans Women, Women of Color, Indigenous Women, Immigrant Women, Women of Size, Female Identifying, Femme, Non-Binary, Two Spirit, and other marginalized persons to amplify their voices and increase their visibility.

  • Curating, creating, publishing, promoting, and distributing the musical work of under-represented, gender diverse people.  

  • Intentionally using our expertise to collaborate with members of the music community in support of producers, engineers, publicity experts, videographers, stylists, journalists, visual artists, and other creative professionals

What is the $10k goal for then? Glad you asked!

    If you're good at math our goal suddenly makes sense. Of course there's lots more we'd like do to ensure the success of the label—and ultimately those we represent—including label branding, national promotion, running a proper PR campaign, advertising, and more!

    In short, This Could Go Boom! wants to redefine the industry. This is where you come in!

     

     

    An ambitious mission demands an ambitious goal. There are lots of nifty ways you can support TCGB! and advance equality in the music industry. Donations in excess of reward values are fully tax-deductable. And remember, nearly 100% of the funds raised will be poured right back into the community that we represent! Take that capitalism!

    This Could Go Boom! will launch with the release of The OSYX's debut album. The OSYX has  already funded incorporation of the label, obtaining nonprofit status, and recording & mixing  for the album. All initial proceeds from the record release will be donated to getting TCGB! off the ground and jump-starting future projects.    

     

     

    Don’t feel paralyzed when searching for ways to empower women and marginalized communities in 2018. Support This Could Go Boom! and be part the revolution now. Together we can affect change, one track at a time!

     

     

    Changing the world for the better is an investment in all of us - but not all of us are excited about change. Challenges we're up for include:

    Societal Forces: Some people equate lifting specific groups UP to putting other groups down. That's not our style. We're gearing up to combat resistance to new perspectives by listening, educating and producing some damn fine music to drive it all home.

    Viability: TCGB! is mission driven with founding members that reflect the community we represent! Established as a nonprofit organization and armed with a wealth of expertise, TCGB! will measure success through both conventional means (such as record sales) and holistic achievements (such as awards and critical recognition, societal impact, and artistic innovation).

     

    ​

    • Donate! Buy merch! Join the record club!
    • Tell people about This Could Go Boom!, our mission and our campaign. Share us!
    • Join our team of volunteers!
    • Seek out and actively encourage diversity in the music that you listen to!

    Still have questions? Reach out to us at info@thiscouldgoboom.org. Now let's blow it up!

    With gratitude,

    This Could Go Boom! Records

Established by band members of The OSYX, This Could Go Boom! anticipates a world where music informed by—and created from—gender diverse perspectives is normalized. TCGB! envisions equal representation over airwaves, online, at music festivals, and in positions of power and influence throughout the music landscape. TCGB! will achieve this through:

Representing Cis and Trans Women, Women of Color, Indigenous Women, Immigrant Women, Women of Size, Female Identifying, Femme, Non-Binary, Two Spirit, and other marginalized persons to amplify their voices and increase their visibility.
Curating, creating, publishing, promoting, and distributing the musical work of under-represented, gender diverse people.

story:
Quick Summary

Kia ora koutou!

Welcome to our crowdfunding campaign, aimed at helping us finance the production and distribution of our debut album!

In exchange for the boundless kindness and generosity you may show by participating in this campaign, we have prepared a whole bunch of awesome prizes at a range of prizes to match your budget.

Just in case you have any questions about how this all works, or why you should even care, we’ve prepared an FAQ below. Please don’t hesitate to get in touch with us if you have any further questions though!

Who the hell is Dillastrate?

We are a two-piece hip-hop and soul band from Christchurch, New Zealand with a deep passion for music. We also work our arses off for it, to the point whereby over our two short years of existence, we have managed to complete nine tours of New Zealand, playing staple music festival stages including Northern Bass, Rhythm & Vines and Electric Avenue. Our music is a hearty mix of soul, hip-hop and electronica, with heavy hat tips to soul legends Stevie Wonder and Marvin Gaye. Our prior releases include Black Diamond EP (November 2019) and follow-up single "I Don't Care" (recorded at Neil Finn's Roundhead Studios in Auckland), which are available on all good music platforms now.

Why should I care?

Much to the disappointment of all recording artists the world over, gone are the heady days of musicians being discovered by record label representatives and subsequently being given all the resources required to produce their recordings. In the music industry nowadays, the musicians themselves are often self-funded, scrimping and saving and emptying out the piggy bank to pay for the opportunity to record their music and release it out into the world. With the help of some kind, generous and presumably attractive benefactors, musicians have the opportunity to produce some of the music that we all love without the fear of going either bankrupt or having a mental breakdown trying to put it all together.

Until now, we have been very privileged to be able to finance our recordings ourselves from playing shows around New Zealand. Unfortunately, we have reached the limit of what we can achieve financially in producing our debut album and are in need of a little help – this is where you guys come in!

If you love the music that we make, love music in general, to support arts in the community, or are just a bloody lovely person, donating to this campaign provides an opportunity to do so. We couldn’t continue to do what we do without the loving support of our families, friends and communities – every little bit helps and is deeply appreciated.

What do I get out of it?

Well – beyond the invaluable gift of being able to help people achieve their dreams – we have prepared a range of awesome rewards to compensate your generosity, at a range of prices for every budget. These include the opportunity to force us to cover a song of your choice on our YouTube channel, to booking us to perform live at your private event, to receiving a copy of our album on a format of your choice before its official release date! Check out the rewards listed on this page for more details.

When do I get my stuff?

After the end of the campaign on March 31st, we will begin the process of administrating all of your donations and get to work on distributing your stuff! This all relies on our ability to produce the physical copies of the album which, without an official release date as of yet, is difficult to say at present. However, rest assured that as soon as we are happy with the album and are in a position to duplicate it, we will rush your well-deserved copy right to you. If you have any issues around the timeliness of your delivery or any other questions/queries about this process, please get in touch via one of our platforms listed on this page.

story:
Who We Are

globalFEST (gF) is the most dynamic global music platform in N. America. Every Jan. we bring 12 of the world's most interesting artists to 3 stages in NYC and introduce them to the performing arts community. gF serves as a springboard that puts international voices on stages across the U.S. gF is committed to keeping the borders of music open in the face of rising xenophobia. Your ticket is guaranteed through your contribution of $65 or more. Thank you for your support!

Artists who have performed at globalFEST have gone on to perform at some of the most important performing arts centers, festivals and nightclubs in the world. As they tour, they bring their own cultural perspectives to communities across the US, Canada, and elsewhere at a time where creating opportunities for cultural exchange and diverse perspectives is more important than ever. 
 

globalFEST 2020 Lineup

Ak Dan Gwang Chil (South Korea): Korean shamanic funk
Bohemian Betyars (Hungary) NY Debut: Radical speed-folk punk revelers 
Cheikh Lô (Senegal): Spiritual musical maverick
La Chica (Venezuela/France) USA Debut: Introspective electro pop
Les Amazones d'Afrique (France) USA Debut: West African feminist supergroup 
Meklit (Ethiopia/USA): Cutting-edge Ethio-jazz
Nathan & the Zydeco Cha Chas (Louisiana/USA): Irresistible accordion-driven Creole dance music
San Salvador (France) USA Debut: Fierce French polyphonies and percussion 
Sofiane Saidi & Mazalda (Algeria/France) USA Debut: Psychedelic grooves from the Prince of Raï 2.0 
Tufan Derince (Turkey/Netherlands) USA Debut: Wild electric Kurdish wedding songs 
Xenia França (Brazil): Afrofuturistic Bahian soul 
Yungchen Lhamo (Tibet/USA): Songs, chants and prayers by legendary songstress

Orquesta Akokan from Cuba at globalFEST 2019

Your $65+ contribution guarantees you a ticket to the annually sold-out festival. As our only annual fundraiser, your support via Indiegogo plays a crucial role in our success. globalFEST takes a full year of planning, and donations and ticket sales cover only a fraction of ever-rising costs.

 

17 Years of Advancing Artists

globalFEST believes that music can be a driving force toward a society that values cultural diversity as a source of unity rather than division and our supporters make this work possible! globalFEST is one of today’s most pioneering music festivals and the most important platform for global artists in North America. Hundreds of bands have made their marks on the US touring scene because of globalFEST. Through gF’s programs like the gF Touring Fund and gF On The Road, bands have reached tens of thousands of new audiences, creating and helping fulfill an ever growing demand for world music in all venue types.

 

gF's Venue

We return to The Copacabana, the iconic Latin music hub with decades of culture-shaping history to its credit. The Copacabana has inspired countless musicians over the years (not to mention one particular song which is probably earworming you right now), and proved a source of inspiration for globalFEST in programming this year’s edition. globalFEST sells out in advance each year and we expect this year to be no different - this Indiegogo campaign is the best way to secure your ticket.

 

Your Support

Your contribution directly supports cultural understanding through music by helping to launch global artists into the touring market via globalFEST, an artist-centric organization dedicated to projects that help international artists develop sustainable careers. Find out about all the work we do here at www.globalfest.org.

 

gF started as an antidote to xenophobic sentiments in the U.S. and around the world in 2002; the first globalFEST took place in 2003. Through the support of our colleagues, forward-thinking funders, and engaged fans, we have grown to become an internationally recognized, agile, and responsive organization. gF invests its limited resources and leverages partnerships strategically in tireless pursuit of our mission to serve artists, the performing arts field, and the general public. Thank you for supporting our work--none of this is possible without you.

THANK YOU!

Shanta Thake, Isabel Soffer and Bill Bragin
Co-Directors

 

What you get back when you give

Ticket sales cover only a fraction of what it costs to produce the event and worldwide fan support is critical--to the artists and to globalFEST!  Campaign funds help globalFEST to cover ever-increasing costs and a modest ticket price encourages audiences to take a chance on new and revelatory artists. Your contributions are more important than ever in our ability to make the event happen.

 

Every contribution to this campaign comes with a perk-- social media shout outs, the Official globalFEST 2020 Digital Mix, exclusive t-shirt, concert tickets and VIP access. What's the best part? A $65+ donation is also your ticket to globalFEST on January 12, 2020.

 

Become a gF insider! For $125, you'll be in-the-know on the full lineup before it hits the press or the general public! What's even better? We want you to bring a new friend to globalFEST this year and so we've included an extra ticket at the $200 level.

 

The more you give, the better it gets--check out the $275 and up benefits for extra special perks, VIP access, and a globalFEST exclusive t-shirt just for donors. At $315, you will have access to the creative landscape of New York with tickets from our JanArtsNYC partners through our Music Lover perks. Donors of $1,015 will expedited access to the festival and avoid the lines.  For $2,500, you will be side by side with us throughout the night with access to soundchecks and reserved seating at the after party.

 

Your Support Will...

Ensure this year’s festival maintains its standard of excellence and our move to a new home--the stellar reputation of globalFEST over the last 17 years has supported the careers of hundreds of musicians that we've presented. 

 

In 2018, globalFEST was proud to launch a series of awards highlighting artists and members of the field who have made significant contributions to the performing arts landscape. These awards will be presented again in 2020 and nominations are open now. These awards celebrate those that excel in the small but crucial global music field in the USA, too often with little recognition. 

 

gF is the 2018 recipient of the Association of Performing Arts Presenters William Dawson Award for Programmatic Excellence and sustained achievement in programming--a significant testament to the importance and impact of globalFEST throughout its history.

 

As gF continues to reach new heights, and as we continue to promote cultural understanding and exchange through music, the importance of our annual crowdfunding campaign has grown. We thank you for your past and present generosity--we know that for many of you, your donation to globalFEST is a gift from one friend to another. Support from this campaign goes directly to gF programs that support artists.

 

About globalFEST

Over the last decade, globalFEST (gF) has become the most dynamic global music platform in North America, growing from an acclaimed festival/showcase into a catalytic non-profit service organization for curators, artists, and the performing arts field.  Through its work, gF encourages networking and cultural diplomacy; deepens cultural understanding among its constituents; builds audiences for international music and creates new opportunities for artists leading to a more robust and sustainable ecosystem for world music in the United States. Artists that participate in gF programs represent diverse musical styles from all corners of the globe, ranging from traditional to contemporary, and everything in between.  

 

gF's Programs Include:

  • globalFEST Flagship/Showcase

  • globalFEST Awards

  • globalFEST Touring Fund (small grants that get artists to new cities on tour in N. America!)

  • globalFEST On The Road including customized event curation and national tours  

  • globalFEST Hangouts, a series giving world music audiences in NYC access to artists and global music events

  • Co-producing the Wavelengths: APAP World Music Pre-Conference (open to the community at no cost!)

  • Cross-over curation at major festivals such as SXSW, Bonnaroo, and more!

  • Providing advice and technical assistance to artists seeking to navigate the US performing arts market.

story:
ÆPEX Contemporary Performance

What we are:

  • ÆPEX Contemporary Performance is Southeast Michigan’s only professional concert presenter dedicated solely to new music

Who we are:

  • ÆPEX Contemporary Performance is led by Music Director Kevin Fitzgerald, Artistic Director Garrett Schumann, and Development and Engagement Manager Spencer Arias
  • ÆPEX Contemporary Performance hires local musicians for our concerts and presents renowned soloists and ensembles from around the country

Where we are:

  • ÆPEX Contemporary Performance’s first season includes concerts in Ann Arbor, Ypsilanti, and Detroit, Michigan
  • ÆPEX Contemporary Performance’s flexible model enables us to present concerts in traditional venues, intimate spaces, and uncommon places

Why we are important:

  • ÆPEX Contemporary Performance presents more new music than any other concert presenter in Southeast Michigan
  • ÆPEX Contemporary Performance’s visionary programming makes the world’s best, most compelling, and most important new music accessible to concertgoers across Southeast Michigan
  • ÆPEX Contemporary Performance is committed to expanding the reach of new music, and designs programs to connect with unlikely and unexpected audiences
  • ÆPEX Contemporary Performance believes presenting the world’s best new music should include valuing the work of underrepresented composers

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking to raise at least $1500 to make our next season possible. This season we have spent approximately that amount. This is the minimal amount we need to operate. Money we raise after that will help to make our next season even better. 
  • Supporting us comes with perks, from a shout out to dinner with the Directors to a full fledged commission. 

The Breakdown

Your support will help to cover the following expenses:

- Music Fees (including any future commissions we may undertake)

- Performer Fees (we pay all musicians who work with us)

- Recording Costs (engineering fees, space rental, mixing, mastering)

- Other Costs (travel, piano tuning, distribution, instrument rentals, Space etc.) 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to financially contribute. If you can share this campaign, it would go a long way.

Your support will help to cover the following expenses:
- Music Fees (including any future commissions we may undertake)
- Performer Fees (we pay all musicians who work with us)
- Recording Costs (engineering fees, space rental, mixing, mastering)
- Other Costs (travel, piano tuning, distribution, instrument rentals, Space etc.)    Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is able to financially contribute. If you can share this campaign, it would go a long way.

story:
Tuff Slang LP

We are Tuff Slang (Justin Frederick, Cody Messick, Aaron Vincel), a band from Chicago, IL and we're putting the finishing touches on our debut record to be released in the spring. This album has been a big part of our lives for the past two years and we're excited to finally share this labor of love with you. 
Your contribution goes towards helping us cover the cost of CDs, Vinyl, and recording. Every contribution you make helps us continue our cause. 

What do you get for your donation?

All Contributions - A Tuff Slang button
$7 - Digital Download of the Record
$10 -  A copy of the new record on CD
$18 - A copy of the new record on Vinyl
$20 - A copy of the new record on CD and a Tuff Slang T-Shirt
$30 - A copy of the new record on Vinyl and a Tuff Slang T-Shirt
$45 - A copy of the new record on Vinyl or CD and 2 Tuff Slang T-Shirts (One to share with a loved one)
$100 - A special test pressing of the album with limited edition artwork by Patrick Burnell, A copy of the new record on CD or Vinyl, and a Tuff Slang T-Shirt (Limit 5)
$200 - A copy of the new record on CD or Vinyl, a Tuff Slang T-Shirt, and the band will take you out for a nice Taco Dinner and Drinks
$400 - A copy of the new record on CD or Vinyl, a Tuff Slang T-Shirt, and the band will DJ a party for you and your friends (final details can be discussed upon completion of the campaign)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a donation at this time we get it. Money is a cruel mistress. Any support is deeply appreciated. Feel free to like us on Facebook or follow us on Instagram or come to a show. We appreciate all of you so much.

story:
Who are we? 

The Playground Ensemble is a group of professional musicians and composers. We are  dedicated to presenting chamber music as a living art form. We are in our 11th year, proud to be Colorado’s only ensemble with the sole focus on modern music.

Why this project?

New chamber music doesn’t easily find its way to the listening public, but if you agree with us that new music deserves to be heard, you’ll appreciate what this project means to us: Co-commissioning a new work from a Pulitzer prize-winning composer and performing it, together with Roomful of Teeth, on a prestigious concert stage.

What is it about?

Composer Caroline Shaw wrote a new piece, This Might Also Be a Form of Dreaming; The Playground co-commissioned it and will perform it in concert in January of 2017. We look for funding to help with the costs associated with this project.

The work is based on text taken from poet Claudia Rankine's Don't Let Me Be Lonely. The composer writes:

"The work begins with the final words and the beautifully dangling preposition,of, which is the book’s final cadence.

Each of the seven movements takes up a slightly different mode of musical writing, or a slightly different task vis-à-vis the excerpts of Rankine’s text. I tried to preserve the intimacy and clarity of succinct phrases such as “I am here” and “ Here you are” while amplifying the complexity of the book’s project as a whole (alluded to in her observation,“ The world moves through words”).

Ultimately, the heart of the piece is a reflection of one of the most beautiful passages: “Sometimes you read something and a thought that was floating around in your veins organizes itself into the sentence that reflects it. This might also be a form of dreaming.”

Why should you support us?

New chamber music is not a profitable business, but new music is our mission. We have a long track record of supporting new music and bringing it to life, in schools, in concerts, and in collaboration with other artists. The Playground is in a unique and important position when it comes to programming, educational outreach, and the mutually beneficial relationship with area composers.

We now hold approximately 100 events each season, including performances, community music-making events, music creation programs for students in K-12 schools and regional colleges, and special events for senior citizens. 

What’s special about this project?

The commission and concert performance of This Might Also Be a Form of Dreaming goes beyond the regional scope and puts us on the national map in terms of recognition. If we recoup the associated expenses, we will look to more collaborations with composers and artists from beyond our immediate area. Your contribution will allow us to do just that.

How can you help?

Contribute right here on indiegogo. By contributing to this campaign you invest in an art form that flies below the radar of the commercial music industry. Composers need performers to bring their new music to life, and this project is a big step in this ongoing mission of ours.

You can also help by spreading the word about us (use the indiegogo share tools for example), by sharing our website with others  - http://playgroundensemble.org.

We thank you!

story:
Short Summary

We're making our second album, hoping that it will raise awareness for "Pure O" OCD and anxiety. 1 in 40 people suffer from OCD - most sufferers grow up thinking they are crazy pre diagnosis, not knowing what is "wrong" with them. 

This whole EP will be fundamentally sharing the things we "Pure O" OCD sufferers least want to expose to peers, in hopes of putting light on the darkness of obsessive compulsive embarrassment that causes shame. 

Shame is a silent disease, and "Pure O" OCD fosters so much shame in its sufferers. We want to create awareness for the advancement of the psychological world in Pure O treatment, and slowly exterminate shame in the minds of 1 in every 40 people. 

What We Need

2k to be able to pay the producer so we can record the album

2k to pay for two months of service from a publicist we are in contact that will do a "PR Blast" that releases and promotes the material through psychology and music blogs, magazines, radio. 

1k to pay for the studio "mastering" that will be done by a sound engineer we know in New Mexico 

2k to make a music video for our latest single 'Ivory Black', which has been broadcast nationally on KCRW radio - this will cover the director, camera, operator, editing, shooting/set fees

2k to make a music video for our upcoming single, exposing phobias in obsessive compulsive disorder - this will cover the director, operator, editing, shooting/set fees

500 to buy a microphone (alex has been singing into a microphone that he bought when he was 16 for 99 bucks - sadly its dying!)

500 to buy a Roland SPDSX percussion kit

What You Get

$10 - Poster made by Ben!

$25 - Official finished album and poster!

$35 - Official finished album and poster (poster with ben and alex lipstick kisses)!

$50 - Here's a fun one, all lyrics handwritten except anytime "you" is said, it will be supplemented with your name :) +Poster & Album

$100 - Free entrance to a show of your choice! +Everything stated above

$250 - Oliver Riot shirt! +Everything stated above

$300 - We will sing you a song personally via video! +Everything stated above

$500 - Oliver Riot will perform a show for you/your event personally at a place of your choosing in Los Angeles County. 

$1,000+ Alex will get your name tattooed on his body! +Everything above

story:
After releasing my previous CDs independently, I invite you to hear my story, and become part of this exciting new project. 

Passions will be all original music, my best ever.  Your generous donations will help fund production and studio time, graphic design, manufacturing and spreading the word to get the music heard.

We have lots of rewards to get you personally involved, like your name in the CD  credits or a private concert in your home.  Thank you for viewing my video. It would be an honor to hear from you and welcome you in.

Gratefully,
George Skaroulis

story:
Indiegogo and Kickstarter are serious business for bands. 

And Heroes For Hire are a serious band. From Sydney, Australia, the band have spent all their money to get to the UK for their first tour here with Allister, as well as festival dates on Slam Dunk 2013.

To that end, they all want to drink a beer. It costs £5 for a 4 pack of Red Stripe tins at the corner grocery store down the street. Will you help make their dream come true?

 

 

*Indiegogo is making us ask for at £500. How rude.

story:
Every since I've started recording my own music I've dreamed of one day releasing it on vinyl. Now that The Solar System is a full and we've recorded a excellent EP entitled GREAT SONG! The time to make this dream a reality has never been more right. So after doing a ton of research we've found a pressing plant that is known for their quality and decent prices. 

We will need 1,500 dollars to press up 100 copies on green 180 gram vinyl.

I would love to experience putting the needle down on our EP and I hope you feel the same. Every little bit counts and we've come up with some very interesting perks for those who contribute because without you, None of this is possible.

For those who aren't sure if they want to donate their money for whatever reason. Here are two songs from the EP for you to hear and if you dig what you hear, please donate. Just imagine dropping the needle down and hearing these songs!

Thanks for your support and GREAT SONG!

https://soundcloud.com/the-solar-system/watch-the-fall

http://theactivelistener.bandcamp.com/track/the...

story:
For those who know me, you might be thinking, “awesome Anthony came out with a new project finally,” and for those who don’t, you might be thinking, “this sounds like it’s gonna be another one of those cliché inspirational projects that won’t catch any wind.”

Whether you click away out of boredom or keep watching due to curiosity, I’m not really swayed by either decision. I guess what I’m trying to say is, “I don’t care if you care about me or not, this is something I feel like I need to be doing.”

When I was little I was always told that my life would be a set course of going to school, graduating college, getting married with an impressive degree, and then retiring when I got old. I was never told that I could be famous rock star, or be a famous actor or anything because those things were just too impossible. Was college and working a career my only choice? Is that all my life would be? Is that all anybody’s life would be? If that was true then that meant that everybody was the same. If that was true then, I wasn’t really important at all. And that after I worked really hard and lived my whole life that I would still be insignificant.

The only thing I’ve ever found significance in was well, my music. I’ve played music since I was five years old, and began to play the guitar when I started junior high. I wrote a lot of songs but I was just always too poor to get them recorded. So, I said “what the hell” and created this project. I have a lot of good things to say and I feel like I have a lot of talent too, and if you want to help some kid take a crazy gamble in chasing his dream, well I couldn’t thank you enough. If I’m going to die one day regardless of what I do, then I may as well be dying chasing after what I love.

story:
For the past year and a half I have been working on this album with Alexander Robinson, and at long last it is almost HERE!! 

I'm starting this campaign to raise money for mastering and packaging costs. This will also serve as a way to pre-order the album!

Every little bit counts! If you can't contribute (which we can definitely understand) but you still wanna help, send this link to anyone and everyone! We could use all the help we can get!

I have put so much time and effort into this album, and with the amazing talents of Alexander Robinson, we are nearly there! This is my baby, and I'm so proud of it. This album is very personal, and I have pour my soul into the music. To those who have been following me through this crazy journey, thank you so much! I don't think you quite understand the immense gratitude and pure love I have for all of you.


To the FUTURE!!

story:
Short Summary

Hi there, we are the Jason Eaton Band. There are 3 members to our band: Jason, Mark and Randy (Doc). We started this ministry back in 2009. Since then we have seen many young people come to know Christ through His work in our concerts and through His leading through our music. We are passionate about Christ, so much so we make every song about Him. We are not doing what we do to be rock stars, Jesus is the rock star. We merely long to be a reflection of Him. 

We have established this IndieGoGo project to help us fund our new project. It's a 10 song CD of our original music. We believe that these songs will help people to draw closer to Christ. Production these days cost a lot of money. We simply do not have the funds on our own to produce an entire album. We have been able to produce a few songs and Jason has a few solo CD's, but we don't have a full project as the Jason Eaton Band. That's where you can help. 

What We Need & What You Get

The project we propose will take $20,000. This includes engineering, producing, and creating masters plus about 1000 CD's we can actually sell at shows. Here is the breakdown:

Engineering/recording: $10000

Producers: $5000

Mastering: $1100

Artwork/Photography: $2000

Duplication: $1900

We have levels of contributions that will give you prizes in return for your generosity including a free concert in your back yard or wherever you wish, backstage passes to a years worth of shows, producer credits in the CD jacket and much, much more!

Even if we don;t reach our goal, we stil will receive the funds generated. We will apply what is given to the costs listed above and if need be, do one or two songs at a time. 

The Impact

We have seen with our latest single, "Satellites" a mjor impact to people all over the world. This single has literally crossed the globe and has generated hope to people who need it most. Most notably we received communication from a soldier fighting in Afghanistan who heard the song on radio there and he felt compelled to contact us and let us know how the song impacted him right there on the battlefield. Many others have come forward sawying how much the song had helped them as well. How much more will we be able to help these and others with a full length project. We have so much to share. We want to continue to make a positive difference in this world. With your help we can do just that!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand you may not be able to help financially, but there are still ways you can help. First and foremost, please pray for us and the financial fulfillment of this project. Secondly, please share this project with all your friends, maybe they can help financially. Thanks so much for taking the time to find our the details of this project. May God bless you!

story:
Since 2011, Desert Relay Fever Dream (DRFD) has been rockin' San Francisco – playing art galleries and small music venues with the support of amazing friends, old and new. We DIY-ed our way through recording, mixing, and mastering an album with the help of a few friends. Now, with our songs honed and a few new ones under our belts, we’re ready to embark on an amazing adventure – finishing our album and touring the Pacific Northwest! It has been our collective dream to take DRFD to the next level. Help us make that dream a reality!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Releasing our LP through Pirates Press costs $1,800.
  • Renting a van for two weeks is $1700 plus the cost of gas will come out to $2,000.
  • Printing merch and paying for housing and food for tour will cost an additional $800.
  • We are hoping to break even on this project!

Our perks are pretty awesome:

  • Your $10 donation will buy us 3 gallons of gas as we putter up the I-5. You, in return, will receive 3 super creative DRFD buttons, designed by our very own Stephen Shearer!
  • Your $20 or $25 donation will buy us lunch on the road. You will receive the official DRFD Album on Vinyl and MP3.
  • Your $50 donation will buy us dinner right before we play one of our shows. You'll get our LP and we'll put you on the guest list for our album release show in SF!
  • Your $100 or $150 donation will help us pay for one night in a hotel room when we are unable to crash with friends. You can have an LP and tote bag shipped to you, join us for bowling in Pacifica, or get the 411 on a super secret party!
  • Your $250 and above donations will ensure that we love you forever!

Join us on this adventure by supporting DRFD!

The Impact

How would you describe Desert Relay Fever Dream (DRFD)? Well…

The dizzying sonic sandstorm of Desert Relay Fever Dream envelopes your body and penetrates your mind, laying waste to your consciousness and leaving you sprawled across the cracked ground, like so much carrion for the vultures on stage. An existential crisis? That cannot begin to describe the totalizing disorientation induced by DRFD's live set, an apotheosis of destruction and rebirth, or perhaps rebirth and destruction, in any case etched and unforgettable.

Desert Relay Fever Dream is Robin Griswold (vocals and drums), Stephen Shearer (vocals, bass, and drums), and Whitney Watts (vocals and guitar). Our band is something that we enjoy immensely. We have been practicing consistently every week for over 3 years. We do this because we love music and performing so much.  

Our friends, family, and fans have been so supportive by attending our live shows and now we hope to take our project to the next level with a tour and an album. Join us in this process, help us build and contribute positively to the Bay Area and West Coast music scene, and together let's realize the dream of DRFD.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us financially, here are some other things you can do:

  1. Spread the word! Tell your friends via Facebook, Twitter, and email about this project! You can even tell them in real life! Every bit helps.
  2. Use the Indiegogo share tools below to let others in on our campaign! You never know who might be down to support a hard-working, independent band.
  3. Come see us on tour! We’ll post our tour dates as we update this page.

Thank you for taking the time to read all the way through! We really appreciate your support!
story_txt:
Since 2011, Desert
Relay Fever Dream (DRFD) has been rockin' San Francisco – playing art galleries
and small music venues with the support of amazing friends, old and new. We
DIY-ed our way through recording, mixing, and mastering an album with the help
of a few friends. Now, with our songs honed and a few new ones under our belts,
we’re ready to embark on an amazing adventure – finishing our album and touring
the Pacific Northwest! It has been our collective dream to take DRFD to the
next level. Help us make that dream a reality!
What We Need & What
You Get


Releasing our LP through
Pirates Press costs $1,800.


Renting a van for two weeks is $1700 plus the cost of gas will
come out to $2,000.


Printing merch and paying for housing and food for tour will
cost an additional $800.


We are hoping to break even on this project!


Our perks are pretty awesome:


Your $10 donation
will buy us 3 gallons of gas as we putter up the I-5.
You, in return, will receive 3 super creative DRFD buttons, designed by our
very own Stephen Shearer!


Your $20 or $25 donation
will buy us lunch on the road. You will receive the
official DRFD Album on Vinyl and MP3.


Your $50 donation will buy us dinner right before we play one of our
shows. You'll get our LP and we'll put you on the guest list for our album release show in SF!


Your $100 or $150 donation will
help us pay for one night in a hotel room when we are unable to crash with
friends. You can have an LP and tote bag shipped to you, join us for bowling in Pacifica, or get the 411 on a super secret party!

Your $250 and above donations will ensure that we love you forever! 

Join us on this
adventure by supporting DRFD!
The Impact
How would you
describe Desert Relay Fever Dream (DRFD)? Well… 
The dizzying sonic
sandstorm of Desert Relay Fever Dream envelopes your body and penetrates your
mind, laying waste to your consciousness and leaving you sprawled across the
cracked ground, like so much carrion for the vultures on stage. An existential
crisis? That cannot begin to describe the totalizing disorientation induced by
DRFD's live set, an apotheosis of destruction and rebirth, or perhaps rebirth and
destruction, in any case etched and unforgettable.
Desert Relay Fever Dream is Robin Griswold (vocals and drums), Stephen Shearer (vocals, bass, and drums), and Whitney Watts (vocals and guitar). Our band is something that we enjoy immensely. We have been practicing consistently every week for
over 3 years. We do this because we love music and performing so much.  
Our friends, family, and fans
have been so supportive by attending our live shows and now we hope to take our
project to the next level with a tour and an album. Join us in this process,
help us build and contribute positively to the Bay Area and West Coast music
scene, and together let's realize the dream of DRFD. 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help us financially, here are some other things you can do:


Spread the word! Tell
your friends via Facebook, Twitter, and email about this
project! You can even tell them in real life! Every bit helps.

Use the Indiegogo
share tools below to let others in on our campaign! You never know who might be
down to support a hard-working, independent band.


Come see us on tour! We’ll
post our tour dates as we update this page.


Thank you for taking the time to read all the way through! We really appreciate your support!

story:
Kids ACHIEVING EXCELLENCE Through the Arts.

My name is Eric Hubbell and I am the Percussion Director and Assistant Band Director at Central Crossing High School in Grove City, Ohio.  Central Crossing High School is a public high school in the South-Western City School district that serves 19,336 students in grades K-12.  The percussion students at CCHS approached me this school year expressing their strong desire to re-form the Central Crossing High School Indoor Percussion Ensemble with the hope of having the opportunity to perform at the internationally recognized WGI World Championships in Dayton, Ohio.

There are 26 students that range in age from 14-18 years old.  They have made a commitment to participate in an arts activity where they will not only learn to develop their performance skills, but learn about setting high expectations, how to set and work toward achieving individual and common goals, understand the value of hard work, develop a sense of optimism in their abilities, the importance of following through on commitments made to others, and learning the responsibilities of properly representing themselves and their community as they travel to different communities.  Students are committed to staying after school, on average, 9 additional evening hours a week (additional time on weekends) with a desire to create something truly special at their school by creating a culture of excellence within the ensemble that will make their teachers, parents, and community proud.

Funds for additional educational opportunities outside of the school day are not always readily available resulting in the necessity for fundraising to make opportunities such as this a possibility for students.  The students are required to pay a fee to participate in this activity along with a requirement for individual fundraising, but this still does not cover the entire cost of developing a world class show, related entry fees for competitions, as well as travel costs to competitions including the WGI World Championships.  Your financial assistance will help make this opportunity possible for these dedicated young adults.

What We Need & What You Get

The total budget for this activity is $21,000.  This includes instructional staff, show design, entry fees, uniform costs, and travel costs.  I have humbly asked for $6,000 to try and help reduce costs and help these students make an appearance at the WGI World Championships a reality.  Gaining additional funds in our community has been difficult based on many factors including the effects of the recession in a community where 35% of the CCHS high school student population is on free or reduced lunch.  Any funds we receive will go directly to the costs mentioned above in direct support of our students even if our overall goal is not reached. 

Donors:

$25    Bronze level:  Your individual name or company name will be listed as a Bronze Sponsor in all band related publications for the current school year (concert programs, event programs).  

$100  Silver Level:  Your individual name or company name will be listed as a Silver Sponsor in all band related publications including the band's website for the current school year (concert programs, event programs, AND band webpage at centralcrossingband.org).

$1,000 Gold Level:  Place your individual name or company name on the back of our band's tractor-trailer for the current and one additional school year.  This trailer travels to all of the band's performances throughout Ohio and surrounding states and is seen regularly in our community.  Your individual name or company name will be also listed as a Gold Sponsor in all band related publications and on the band's website for two school years (concert programs, event programs, AND band webpage at centralcrossingbands.org).

The Impact

Participation in the arts not only benefits students by becoming better musicians but they also learn transferable skills that can help them be successful in life (several mentioned above).  With many influences on high school students today, keeping students on a positive path and away from negative influences is sometimes a challenging endeavor. Providing opportunities for high school students where they can safely push the limits of their perceived abilities while being surrounded by positive influences during their evening "free time", I believe, is invaluable to our community and country.  Music in South-Western City Schools is an important part of the curriculum but can only provide so many opportunities for students on a school district's budget alone.  

On behalf of the student's, I would like to sincerely thank you for taking the time to read our story and consider helping us reach our goal.

Best Wishes,

Eric Hubbell and the Central Crossing HS Percussion Section 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't assist us at this time, please consider using the share tools on this website to pass our story along to others!  Thank you!

story:
Dear Friends, Family, Strangers and Animals,

We, Rural Ghosts, are proud to announce the release of our debut full-length album. A year and a half in the making, this record has it all; chills, thrills and cello trills. It has been cleverly entitled "City of Elms."

From start to finish, "City of Elms" has very much been a project driven by the intention of handling all aspects of the process ourselves. Over a period of 8 months, we recorded, mixed, and mastered the entire album in a variety of rooms throughout the Portland, ME area and at the Oak and the Ax in Biddeford, ME.

The music and artwork for "City of Elms" is finished. It is with great sincerity that we hope to release this little bundle of joy on October 1st, 2013, but we're going to need your help. 

Why We Need Your Help

It's pretty simple, really. All we have left to do in order to release this record is duplication. Duplication refers to the printing of the actual CD and packaging.

Unfortunately, printing a run of CDs/packaging costs a fair amount of money. Even more expensive is Vinyl (we would love to press vinyl if we exceed our goal substantially), which is why we're asking for your help. 

We're setting our starting goal at $600 in order to cover CD/Packaging duplication, but our hopes are to extend this goal even further. Additional funds will help us to cover the costs of a potential vinyl release, t-shirts/merchandaise, travel and promotion - all of which are necessities for releasing a full-length album. 

Why We Have the Nerve to Ask You

Without getting too sappy here, we really, really love Portland; specifically the music community here. This band has gone through a series of changes ever since the beginning, and our friends/fans have always been supportive the entire way. 

We also really love our friends and family who live outside of Portland. Without you guys, we would never have been able to make this record.

In closing, we wish to inform you that our appreciation knows no bounds, and every little bit helps. We're extremely proud of the product we have in our hands right now, and desperately want to get it into yours. 

Love always,

--

Rural Ghosts

story:
Short Summary

This campaign is a big step for me in fully embracing my life's purpose.  It's also about 2 brand new cds coming out at the same time and a full 2014 year of touring.  I would love your support and will be eternally grateful.  

2 new cds:

PUTALITTLEMORELOVEINTHEWORLD (full length studio cd)

BELIEVE THE BIRD (an introspective all acoustic cd)<< AT $70 level>>

I knew years ago that I am supposed to sing to as many people as I can reach with the full intention of opening hearts and raising consciousness in the world.  I was doing this part-time - enjoying it as a hobby - for many years.  And I most recently took that slightly scary transition into doing this full-time.  Yes!  A full-time transformational musician on a mission!  I would be honored to have you join me.  We need your help to get this music into the daily lives and consciousness of this world in transition.  My music mission states it best...

I come to you with crystal clear divine purpose. With utmost and sacred devotion, I encapsulate in song my interpretations of the ancient and timeless wisdom of the ascended masters and the contemporary teachers I meet in this life. Each and every song I channel begins as my personal conversation with Source delivered as life lessons of spiritual growth and transformation. Just as these conversations birth expansion, awakening, and remembrance in me, I share my gift to soften the hardest of hearts, widen the narrowest of smiles, loosen the tightest of grips, lighten the heaviest of loads, and thin the thickest of walls of as many souls as I can possibly reach. With passion, conviction and enthusiasm, it is my highest honor to sing from my heart to yours.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is not just to fund a new album (or two albums in this scenario!).  This goes beyond 10-20 songs and will put feet to so many activities that are on the Bob Sima Music to-do list.  It is so exciting to see them come to life - becoming more than just a conceptual thought in my mind, intentional words on a piece of paper, or a beautiful riff from my guitar.  I want to know that I can get more of these messages by integrating this music into more corporate events; scheduling more holistic retreats; partnering with change agents who use this music to compliment their public speeches and raise consciousness in the corporate world. I want to continue my "gratitude concerts", these are concerts I perform for free in places where the music is needed the most, like prison's, homeless shelters, and mental health facilities. 

Your support will help give life to all these goals and:

  • production, manufacturing and recording of: PUTALITTLEMORELOVEINTHEWORLD (full length studio CD) and BELIEVE THE BIRD (an introspective all-acoustic CD)
  • fuel and maintain the touring VW van so we can visit more and more of you LIVE and IN PERSON
  • continue "gratitude concerts", free concerts in prisons, homeless shelters, and mental health facilities
  • execute a media marketing plan to spread this music to hearts that are waiting for a transformational, healing, inspirational, and empowering message
  • compensate a team of dedicated staff (who have been graciously volunteering the time they can freely give) who will support this musical mission
  • add a social media support person to the team so you get all the notices and updates to our happenings
  • create a real online store with discounts, coupons, and other perks that would better serve you
  • assist with flights, lodging, and expenses associated with the life of a traveling musician
  • increase the potential for reaching hearts and souls at events in other countries
  • finance more retreats and workshop curriculum which allow you to journey more deeply and activate your heart more fully
  • allow me to sit in my creative space and WRITE MORE SONGS!

The Impact

Here is the reality...this music lives in me and I CAN'T NOT SHARE IT!  I know there is a higher purpose that I don't believe words can accurately describe.  I have a mission and a vision, but I also know that even more will happen when I release and surrender to the unknown and not yet identified opportunities that clearly align with my purpose.  Now that this is my full-time mission, I would be most grateful for your support.  Knowing that you believe this music can truly make a difference and help shift consciousness to make the world a more bountiful and connected experience for all is the fuel that keeps that spark alive in me.  I have never asked for financial support, sponsorship, or backing in the past.  But the time is now.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that you may not be able to financially donate as much as you would like, but I would be most grateful for your help to spread the word.  I know there are angels among us and all it takes is you clicking a share button, posting on social media, sending personal emails to introduce my music or my website or this campaign to all your friends and family.  THANK YOU.

Two Perk Items

There are two items in the perks that deserve a photo moment here.  The first is a bracelet at the $125 - Ubuntu Love level.  The second is a poster at the $175 - Be The Love level.

Two Perk Items
There are two items in the perks that deserve a photo moment here.  The first is a bracelet at the $125 - Ubuntu Love level.  The second is a poster at the $175 - Be The Love level.

story:
Im WaterFlame!

And this is my story:

Im a self taught Videogame music composer from norway, and ive been making music for almost 9 years now.
Ive made music to games like "Castlecrashers", "mecha pumble" upcomming XBox360, wii and ps3 title "Castle storm", and over 80 indie online game titles. Ive released one album called "Green", won the musician of the year NG award 2008, and still make music every day, as work and for fun! its my passion. i love it, and hope i dont ever have to stop.

My music is a mix between Upbeat breakbeats and Classical instruments, but people seem to have a hard time placing my music in a genre. its unique in that sense!

Ive reached more professional heights in my music career now, and i want to take it to the next step. I have 2 new albums near completion, and offers on playing at live events here and there. And recently i got a offer playing at a festival, late summer 2012! thats what made me realise,
sadly, without propper gear, and fundings ill have to turn it all down!
I currently have 2 jobs and school, and little money left for anything out of the ordinary.

Ive been giving my music out free online, and shared with the creative comunities for videos and games since 2003, and i intend ot keep everything in the future 90% free aswell!


I want everyone to feel as overly exited about happy videogame music as i do!
That is why i now turn to you, guys, this time i really need your help!

Help me share the music!

The Impact

My goal is to play live at the festival late this summer, with my 2 new albums released and behind me!
music means the world to me, and my fans mean even more. without you guys i wouldnt be here at all,
let alone be so confident in what i do! i want to fulfill the many requests i get of playing live, and releasing
more albums.




















What I Need & What You Get

The money goes strictly to music gear and album releases.
I aim for getting a responsive, soild drumpad for live performance, A Laptop built for live preformance and music ONLY, and funds to release my new albums.

My goal is to reach 2200 dollars in 105 days.

If i dont reach my goal, ill try my best to save up and fill in the gaps myself. this thing is going to happen, either way, its just a matter of when, so your money wont go to waste!

Any amount is highly appreciated! So please, help a struggeling indie VG composer trying to make a future in the music industry!

Ill give out 50 copies ea. of the new albums to the highest contributors over 40 dollars!
(its important that you give the correct mail as i will be sending it there when this is over)

Aswell as update along the way how the concert process is comming along. There might be VIP tickets avaiable later for the largest donations!



Other ways you can help

Any type of promotion of my songs, or tips to how i can go about saving up for this would be awesome.


Pages if you want to hear more about me,
or more of my music! check 'em out!
-----------------------------------------------------
Waterflame Youtube

Waterflame Facebook

Waterflame Newgrounds

Waterflame Tumblr

I aim for getting a responsive, soild drumpad for live performance, A Laptop built for live preformance and music ONLY, and funds to release my new albums.My goal is to reach 2200 dollars in 105 days.If i dont reach my goal, ill try my best to save up and fill in the gaps myself. this thing is going to happen, either way, its just a matter of when, so your money wont go to waste!Any amount is highly appreciated! So please, help a struggeling indie VG composer trying to make a future in the music industry!Ill give out 50 copies ea. of the new albums to the highest contributors over 40 dollars!(its important that you give the correct mail as i will be sending it there when this is over)Aswell as update along the way how the concert process is comming along. There might be VIP tickets avaiable later for the largest donations!

 Other ways you can help

Any type of promotion of my songs, or tips to how i can go about saving up for this would be awesome.Pages if you want to hear more about me,or more of my music! check 'em out!-----------------------------------------------------Waterflame YoutubeWaterflame FacebookWaterflame NewgroundsWaterflame Tumblr

story:
Who is Risky Biz?

Robi(mc),Risk(mc),Atomic(mc),Pat (bass),Dave(guitar),John(drums),Shred Bundy (guitar),Plank (wood)

We are an original band out of New Bedford, MA.  We started over ten years ago, just three Emcee's trying to make it in the rap game. My how things have changed.  What once started as a hobby has now grown into an audience.  With 3 albums and 4 or 5 mixtapes under our belts Robi, Risk, and Atomic decided they needed to grow as artists and take this rap thing to a new level.  We always wanted to play with a live band but could never find a group of artists as committed and passionate about the music as we are. Until.....2013. Last year we started working with a band, recreating some of our favorite songs and also making some new hits in the process.  The band has been a great success! We'll be updating this page constantly to give you an opportunity to meet each member.  We pack every venue we play at and really put on a show that is unlike any other.  There are two things you're going to get with us good music and good fun.

What We Need & What You Get

We need Exposure!

The main thing this campaign will do for us is increase our fan base.  With your help we will be able to record our first album with the band and cover some expenses for our trip to Philadelphia on April 19th.  We will be filming our little trip to the city of brotherly love, which will undoubtedly be entertaining.

So where is that money going?

  • Professional Mastering ($1,100)
  • Gas and Lodging for a concert (off campus) at Temple University ($1,100)
  • The Merchandise (T-shirts, Sweatshirts, stickers, CD's) ($1,300)
  • Any thing over the goal will go towards more merchandise for the fans and/or more studio time.  

What if we don't hit our goal?

  1. We get up and try again (no pouting)
  2. Use what money we raised  and purchase the merchandise we need to fill our end of the bargain.
  3. We settle for a lesser quality recording by doing it in our practice space.
  4. Use some money for gas and sleep in our cars after the gig in Philadelphia.

Wow! That's a nice package you got there.

The packages are awesome! We are offering tons of digital downloads as well as some great merchandise.  The T-shirts and hoodies are both super comfortable. We are working on a NEW logo (stay tuned) so even if you already have Risky Biz gear, you don't have this shit stuff. Yet...

You want Risky Biz at your next house party??? We can make that happen!

You want to hang out with us at the studio??? We can make that happen!

You want a picture with Plank Rizzo our Mascot??? (Yeah, I don't I get it either. It's Shred's thing.) But Fuck It  forget it. We can make it happen!

Bizzers are the Best

Our fans are awesome!  You guys have always been there for us. Hyping up the crowd, singing our lyrics, and making sure we're not the only ones dancing like idiots when the music comes on.  We need you now more than ever.  The CD's we will be producing with the money you help raise will really take us to the next level.  It will help us complete a professional press kit, have a product to give to our fans and new listeners, and give us the road experience we are going to need when booking future shows.  Every little bit helps us take another step towards being successful independent artists. If you've always wanted to show support but haven't been able to make our shows this is a great opportunity to help out

Other Ways You Can Help

Soooo your broke? Being struggling artists we can relate.

  • YOU CAN STILL HELP
  • By sharing this page on any social media you will be doing us a great service.

THANK YOU!!!
