story:
Hey guys we are Why They Fight!

We are a pop-punk/powerpop band from Colorado Springs and are currently trying to raise funds for our second EP, "Empathy". We released our first EP "Just Listen" at the beginning of this summer and have since written a few more songs in a different style. What we're trying to do is be able to pay to put out four new songs as well as two full band acoustic versions of two songs off "Just Listen". However, we're broke and being in a band is expensive! So what better way than to ask our fans to help us if they wanted to hear what we've been working on! 


We really believe this EP is going to show you guys a different side of our music that we couldn't really cover in "Just Listen". We plan on giving you guys a more creative and unique sound while still retaining the sound you have come to enjoy from us. So we really hope that you guys will love what we've come up with! But we do need your help. 

We are asking for your assistance to raise a fraction of the actual costs to make this EP happen and release it digitally onto iTunes and Spotify. In return, we will be giving you guys previews of how the work on the EP is going (studio videos and such), some goodies for those who would like to donate through our IndieGoGo campaign, a cover specifically for those who help us out, and more surprises we have brewing up! 

Because we're asking for your help, we would like to include you on the whole process of producing "Empathy" and make sure that we can show you guys how much your donations mean to us and are helping us as we try to launch our band into the next step.

We love you guys so much and we want to make you proud. 

~WTF

story:
Short Summary

What do you get when you mix faith, art and community development in a bowl, add a dash of acousitical ambiance and shake really hard? Well, we would like to think you get us - February Birds - our musical adventure. 

We are Sean and Julie Hall.  We are church planters, artists and activists within the new parish movement. We are married and have two children and make our home in lovely Bellingham, WA. We currently pastor-sojourn with Fountain Parish, a creative and lively new church experimenting with innovative and contextual expressions in the Fountain District of downtown. We have been pastors in both large and small communities and have traveled extensively with our music, but what we are really excited about is creative expression that propels the church into living out God’s dream for our neighborhoods. Many of our songs are used in churches around the world, including the song "Water" - a top charting contemporary worship song.

But this batch of songs is different...

These are backyard songs. They are living room songs. Songs that give voice to the new community we have been sojourning with in our neighborhood. These are songs with personalities and faces. Songs with stories attached to them. 

And we think they will move you. And maybe even help you dream with God about what he may be doing in your neck of the woods. 

By supporting us in this campaign you will help us get imaginative and earthy music into the ears and hearts of many other current pioneers - leaders with imagination who are dreaming with God. Dreaming of what might be on their block. What might be in their work places. What might be in their city centers. What might be in their own homes.

Perhaps you are one of these dreamers? 

 
 

What We Need & What You Get

So this is where you come in! We need your support to make this project happen! We are working with an up and coming producer here in Seattle named Cam Nicklaus. He works at at Avast Recording Studio and has engineered Band of Horses and other talent. Studio costs, production, mastering, artwork and replication are all expensive processes.  

Our Budget:

2k: writing parts/arrangement

4k: recording and mix down (Avast studio and in home recording)

2k: additional production and mastering process

2k: Art and replication expenses

 

You Get Perks!

We have created some great perks to check out! Be sure to check out the Stocking Stuffer - a wonderful deal to take care of your christmas shopping now! Also, considering becoming an executive producer on this project and joining us for an exclusive wine and cheese kick off house party/concert! See our perks on this page!

 

The Impact

- Help get organic and creative art out there. Art with personality, faces and stories attached! 

- Join with February Birds - proven artists with hearts to partner with God's dreams in the world! Sean has written several radio hits, been a #1 artist on Hear It First, and February Birds has been featured at events with Donald Miller, Michael Frost, Shane Claiborne, Tony Campolo, The Afters, Brandon Heath, Delirious, Starfield and others. 

- Help create this resource for the New Parish Movement!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

- Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!

story:
Short Summary

So you've heard of "A Betta Tomorrow", but want to know more about what it is really?

A Betta Tomorrow was started out of a God-given vision, and has grown into a powerful movement. Its ultimate goal is to see the eradication of evil and this present "darkness" that is plaguing our land we love. While you will be able to easily recognize many of the faces on the frontline for the movement, A Betta Tomorrow is really made up of you... the every day citizen who knows, who believes deep down in your heart, that our country CAN be delivered from its present oppression of evil, restored to what a Godly nation should look like and transformed to put on top and at the forefront those things which are righteous, just, lovely, honest and worthy of good report.

Throughout this nation, there have always been those stalwarts and "good-thinking" nationalists among us, who like us have always believed that our beloved country is capable of rising out of the gutters in which it has slumped. These individual voices of reason for years have formed the resistance to the darkness that has crept in. We are in a spiritual and moral warfare, and as silent campaigners for good we have been losing the battle.

A Betta Tomorrow intends to change that!

This movement aims to bring the good and Godly together to take the deranged and destructive mindset by storm, and bring transformation to this nation by the power of the Almighty God... without whom our individual and even collective efforts count for naught.

A Betta Tomorrow is far more than a concert, it's more than the outreach activities and missions that we undertake. We intend to make this an unmistakable lifestyle and mentality brand that galvanizes those that desire the triumph of good over evil to humbly surrender to God while aggressively resisting every advance of that which is evil in this world.

We invite you to join with us, stand with us... be afraid no more, be silent no more, step out with us in Faith and watch God transform this nation and usher its people into A Betta Tomorrow.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's a quick breakdown of what we are in need of:

  • First and foremost your support.
  • Our major event is usually held in November at "Dump Up Beach" in Montego Bay, Jamaica.
  • We also have mini-events in different towns across Jamaica where we stage concerts and meet the needs of people living at the brink or in the depths of poverty.
  • The total cost of the annual activities are in the region of JA$8 Million or US$80,000.  Most of this is usually donated by the team of persons who believe in the cause.  Our source of funds are for the most part from our own pockets and our own jobs.  We see where the movement has the potential to really have a powerful and lasting positive effect on persons' lives yet, it has become increasingly more difficult to finance this project on our own.  We need your help.
  • In return for your help we will demonstrate our gratitude with the fruits of our labour - T-Shirts, Albums, Partnerships, etc.

The Impact

Every single dollar that you donate has a definite and lasting impact on the lives of many underprivileged persons and communities.  Please take a look at some of what we have been able to accomplish in the past, and imagine what (with your help) we could accomplish in the future -

  • A Betta Tomorrow in 2010
  • Our Official Music Video (2011)
  • Montego Bay Concert coverage - Part 1 | Part 2 | Part 3
  • A Betta Tomorrow in 2011
  • A Betta Tomorrow in 2012

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Although we have tried to make this as easy as possible for everyone to contribute, we know that not everyone will be able to donate to this campaign here, so here are some other ways you can help us out:

  • Check out our Sponsorship page
  • Get the word out.  Get the word out. Get the word out.
  • Share it on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, the highways and bi-ways!

From our hearts to yours... thank you... and welcome aboard!

www.ABettaTomorrow.com

story:
Short Summary

The Dead Whale Ramblers, a DIY folk band from Baltimore, Maryland, have finished recording our second album, entitled Eight of Swords. We've recorded this album entirely on a shoestring budget of $0.00 and with the much appreciated help of our friend Ian Jones. However, there's more to be done! Now we need your help to put the finishing touches on the album and get it professionally mastered so that we can release it for the world to enjoy!

We appreciate all contributions to the completion of our album. Thanks so much for supporting us in what we love to do! 

The Dead Whale Ramblers started in 2009 on Assateague Island, where the wild ponies run free. In the beginning we were just two friends playing music together, but we quickly acquired more members and have been slowly evolving ever since. The Dead Whale Ramblers are:

Madi Shapiro: guitar, accordion, vocals

Sam Kipnes: mandolin, double bass, glockenspiel, percussion, backup vocals

Jon Lipscomb: guitar, mandolin, trumpet, backup vocals

Meg Haight: cello

Ian Espey: double bass, accordion, percussion

Allison Guitard: violin

Doug McConnell: banjo

What We Need & What You Get

Any money you contribute to our campaign will go towards mastering the album, which can cost upwards of $500, packaging, creating and printing album artwork, and more. If we recieve more funding than we need for this album, rest assured that all funds will go towards future Dead Whale Ramblers releases and merchandise, including the possibility of pressing the album to vinyl!

The biggest perk for contributing to this campaign is getting to see our album come to fruition, but if you contribute a certain amount of money you can receive perks such as DWR t-shirts, posters, a finished, signed copy of our album, and more! If you opt for a digital or physical copy of the album, you will receive an advance copy before it's released to the general public!

The Impact

Contributing to DIY artists helps get their music out in the world even if they are not backed by a record label. This is an invaluable resource for talented musicians and artists all over the world! You get to hear our music, and we get to share it with you; an entirely win-win situation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can help us out by spreading the word! If you want to see us get our album out there, sharing our campaign with your friends on social networking sites or by word of mouth is a huge help. 

And as always, continue supporting us by attending our shows and listening to our previous recordings at deadwhaleramblers,bandcamp.com!

story:
Hey everyone!

    Much time has passed since my last musical endeavor or official release for that matter (Field Trip, No Rules, RCA), but that time has finally come!  I am about to embark on the journey of recording my first solo record right here in beautiful Ojai, CA..  I have over the years continued to be very active both musically and creatively and have amassed a body of work that I feel is ready to be heard by you, my adoring public. lol For those of you who don't know who I am, I was the lead singer in the rock band Kik Tracee on RCA back in the early 90's.  I have obviously grown not only as a person but as an artist since then and what you'll be hearing on this debut is a direct result of the experiences, trials, tribulations, good, bad, the ugly and beautiful of the last decade or so.  For the ever loyal KT fans who are still out there and I know you are because of your endless, weekly facebook messages and friendings, this record will in some way be a field trip down memory lane of sorts or an experience entirely new I'm sure.  EIther way I think all will be pleasantly surprised as well as myself!  lol  Recording has already begun on this project as I was able to come up with the down payment so as to get started which there in leaves the balance.  I'm going it alone on this one, no major label, or budget to work with which is why I'm turning to this incredible resource of indiegogo for some of the financing of this project. The objective here is to raise funds to help in the production, recording, mixing, and mastering of this record!  So whether you are a new fan or one of the many loyal old, a family member or friend, any support or contribution to this indiegogo campaign for my art and sanity's sake would be forever greatly appreciated.  

    I will be offering some perks as incentive which are essentially pre-order single and full length album downloads and some signed items such as artwork etc... so please check those out!  Otherwise, many thanks to those who have championed my cause in the past and thanks to those who will help propel my musical future!  I look forward to seeing you all in the near future out on the road at a venue near you!

Cheers, 

Stephen Shareaux

 

Breakdown of costs:

 

The goal of $15,000 we are trying to reach here breaks down as this:

$10,000 for Producer, studio time, and mixing (package deal)

$1150.00 for mastering

$2250.00 for album artwork, printing, promotion, and marketing of LP

$1200.00 to indiegogo for running this campaign

story:
Project Summary

Hey everyone. We're Brooklyn-based band Time Travelers, and you're our new best friend.  Our band, consisting of Edward Sturtevant, Andrew Wilcox, Alex Koster, and Ben Latham, has been playing in and around the 5 boroughs for the last year and a half, and we're finally ready to record our next EP.  

This is where you come in.  While we have some funds to get this process started, we could really use your help to complete it the right way.  We've teamed up with Fraser McCulloch, who will be working with us for the month of February (read more about it here: http://frasermcculloch.tumblr.com/), and we'll be recording in a few different spaces around Brooklyn, most notably at The End studio (http://www.theendnyc.com/).  Once we've tracked and mastered all the songs, we'll be making physical copies of the CD (yes, ones you can hold in your hand!), complete with color artwork, liner notes, and the sturdiest jewel case money can buy! While we've recorded two previous EPs (timetravelers.bandcamp.com, if you're interested), this will be the first professionally executed one.  This is a huge step for us as a band, and we want you to be a part of it. 

Nitty Gritty Details, Nitty Gritty Perks

Here's how the $3,500 breaks down, in the order that they will be funded:

  • $1,500 for Fraser
  • $1,000 for recording space
  • $1,000 for post production, consisting of:
    • Mastering
    • Commission for album artwork
    • Physical CD copies

 

Here's what you get:

  • A $10 contribution gets you an advance digital copy of the EP. Be the first one on your block to hear it! Very cool!
  • A $25 contribution will put a physical album of our EP in your hand, plus the advance digital download. Great for CD players!
  • A $50 contribution will get you a producer credit on the EP, accompanied by a handwritten letter expressing our extreme gratitude for your generosity.  A great converstion piece! Plus, you get the CD and the digital download
  • A $75 contribution will get you all of the above, plus a professionally framed copy of our album artwork. You can hang it on the wall, or in the bathroom!
  • A $100 contribution will get you all the mouth-watering gifts you just read, plus we'll record a message on your voicemail or home answering machine. Way better than that female robot voice you currently have!
  • A $500 contribution will make us so psyched that we'll write you a song! Just let us know what you want the song to say about you, and we'll say it, with an acoustic recording to play for your friends, or to remix for the next great club anthem!
  • A $1000 contribution will find you at your favorite NYC bar with the four members of Time Travelers, buying you drinks and talking about whatever you want to talk about. Too much fun.
  • A $2500 contribution will get you a private show at a time and place of your choice, which ideally is within the greater Tri-State area, although if you're interested in this option, please contact us. We love to hang out. 
  • Finally, if you're willing to help us to the fullest extent by funding our entire project ($3500), we will feature your beautiful and generous self on the album cover. You will also receive appropriate mention in the liner notes, along with a copy of the cd and framed artwork. It is necessary that you either live in or travel to New York for this perk. Email us if you would like more details. 

What This Means To Us

First of all, thank you so much for taking the time to read this.  Whether you contribute or not, we love you, and hopefully we've at least piqued your interest enough that we might see you at our next show.  While we all have full time jobs in this wonderful city, music is our true passion, and we've been putting all our energy into making this project as successful as possible, and hope that you'll feel similarly inspired.  We're hoping to make a serious impact on the local and hopefully national music scene with this EP, and we hope that's something you want to be a part of.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone has money to give away, let alone to pay rent. That's ok, there's lots of other ways you can help:

  • Tell your friends, your family, your coworkers and your pets! Word of mouth is still the most powerful tool around, and it's free! 
  • Got a big empty space with good acoustics that you wouldn't mind letting us record in? We're always looking for rooms with great sound.
  • Got a real nice acoustic guitar or bass amp that you would be willing to let us borrow? Nice equiment always sounds better!
  • Know anyone who makes beautiful art, or is a mastering master? Introduce us!
  • We'll be playing a lot this spring/summer- we'd love to see you at one of our shows!

Thank you again for your interest, feel free to send us an email if you want to know more, or just say hi: time.travelers.beat@gmail.com

Rock n Roll 4 ever,

Time Travelers

story:
About us.

My name is Teevi Zeemann and my twin sister is Teesi Zeemann. We are both currently studying photography in Tallinn Polytechnic school and have huge passion for that particular type of art. The reason why we are here writing to you guys is our dad.

Our dad has had the vision of this photographic project for quite some time now. But he told me and my sister about this idea almost 3 years ago. It sounded extremely fascinating and at that moment his vision became our dream. We decided to put our knowledge, skills and passion to this project and make it happen.

It is going to be a moment, when people around the world take out their cameras and capture THE moment, wherever they happen to be. I am sure that lot of us have been wondering what is happening on the other side of the world at the same exact time and even a moment. Our world is very interesting and controversial – somewhere the sun is shining, elswhere is darkness of the night, someone has joy, someone else sorrow.

It is our goal to bring this information  to every corner on this earth and receive as many different photos as possible. This is a nonprofit event and our goal is to join the world and notify mankind – the world we live in is so different, but also the same for all of us!

The one moment will be on 14th of September at 13:00 o’clock UTC/GMT.

Find out what time you need to take the photo in your country:

http://goo.gl/HVsohk

So everyone has the opportunity to register until the 14th of Septmeber on our website. Registration is important so we can see in which countries we have enough participants and which countries need more attention.

http://onemomentworld.com/

 

What We Need & What You Get

Now the part why we need Your financial help.

We collect the most soulful and fascinating pictures from every country and open the exhibition.

The big exhibition will be first opened in Tallinn, Estonia. 

That requires:

  • ·         Printing about 500 photos on PVC board
  • ·         Photo screens
  • ·         Giant earth globe that rotates – this is going to be center piece of the exhibiton where people can see by the marks where the certain picture was taken.

So it is going to be expensive event because this big earth globe itself is going to be about $5500

 

Also we need funding for printing and publishing the book with all the pictures inside. So you would be able to order and see the whole world in one book!

 

Every single one of You, who helps us to raise the money will be acknowledged by the name on our facebook account, on exhibitions or in the book! Depending on the leve of your contribution.


The Impact

The goal is to see, how controversial, exciting and different the world is on the exact same time but in different places. And what better way to visualize it than through the pictures.

By now we have a confirmational that one of the pictures is even coming from out of space!


Other Ways You Can Help

Some of You just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean You can’t help:

  •     We would love if you participate anyway! Join us on our website and take the picture on this ONE MOMENT
  •     Don't forget to share this information on facebook and get your friends to participate.

Remember, we need all of You to take this photo so we can see how the world looks like through Your eyes! :)

 http://onemomentworld.com/

https://www.facebook.com/onemomentworld

story:
Short Summary

After experiencing countless obstacles hindering their ability to fund their project, A Tragic Setback has turned to YOU, the beautiful face sitting behind this computer/smartphone screen, for help.

We are an unsigned rock/metal band from San Antonio, Texas, and have decided to do our first album, videos, and other promotion, entirely out-of-pocket, without the support of a record label.

Though "it's a long way to the top", we care only about music. We could care less about large profits because we are truly passionate about the music we make, the crowd our music captures, and the lives our music inspires.

 

BUT MOST OF ALL, we are dedicating this album to little Elena Hope Arenas, our singer's young daughter who had just passed away last year.

We want to do every thing possible to make our album "Chasing the Light" special, in her memory.

 

With your support, WE WILL make this dream come true, and then some!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $6,150 to cover expenses that are currently unaccounted for.


Here's a breakdown of our TOTAL album expenses:

 

Studio 


Travel ---------------------------------------- $1000 (PAID)

Tracking ------------------------------------- $2500 (PAID)

Mix/master ---------------------------------- $2500 (PAID)

 

 

Video/other promotional items


Travel ---------------------------------------- $1250 (UNPAID)**

1st installment on music video ------------- $1250 (PAID)

2nd installment on music video ------------ $2500 (UNPAID)**

3rd installment on music video ------------- $1250 (UNPAID)**

Lyric Video ------------------------------------ $600 (UNPAID)**

CD printing ----------------------------------- $550 (UNPAID)**

 

Total

Studio ----------------------------------------- $6000 (PAID)

 

Video/other promotional items -------------- $1250/7400 (PAID)

"                                     "    -------------- $6150/7400 (UNPAID)**

 

Now that you see where our money is going, you can see that we are not trying to make a profit off of you.

 

Most of the items listed in the perks are exclusive, limited print items that will only be available during this campaign.

 

 

The Impact

YOU are the ones in charge of our future. YOU can help us progress into something greater. YOU are the sole reason for our blood, sweat, and tears.

With our drive to feed the masses with our music, we have self-funded and released an EP, traveled to Georgia and back, and have played countless shows across the region to captivate our audiences.

But that is not enough.

We need you to help us grow, and every single cent of your hard-earned cash will be reflected in the finished package.

YOU are the ones we live for, and YOU are our drive to make our first album amazing.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every one is a winner! If you don't have the financial means or aren't sure you want to invest in us, simply spreading the word to your family, friends, and co-workers is more than we can ask for! 

Spreading the word will help us out in many more ways than you think. A single post on a social media site goes a long way, so don't be shy!

LASTLY, we love you all, no matter what.

Keep supporting music no matter what you do, and you will live a rich, vibrant, and colorful life, because music is the ultimate force that keeps us going every day.

story:
Namaste :)

   We are so very grateful for your arrival on our fundraising page, and for your love and support!  Whatever level you are able to donate at, or even if you're just coming here to grab this page's link to share with friends, we thank you from the bottom of our hearts.  Deep Stirrings will be able to put our music out into the world because of your generosity!  If you are making a donation at one of the suggested amounts and wish to choose a Perk, I look forward to getting your Perk to you, and hearing how you enjoyed it!

   Deep Stirrings has been playing for festivals, causes, charities, public venues, bars, etc. around SoCal for years, and a few years ago we started going to a recording studio to get our first full length album done.  By throwing in what band members could afford, along with some generous donations from a few friends, we were able to get 3 tracks finished, which appear on our cd single "El Viaje".  We also produced our music video (seen above), thanks to friends volunteering their talents, to promote the single.  After countless hours in the studio, and thousands of dollars already spent, we have a little done on every song, but MUCH more recording left to do, followed by mixing and mastering.  With 7 people in a band, recording takes a lot of time and resources.

   $3000 will help a great deal with recording our album.  It will probably cost twice that amount, but I wanted to set a reachable goal.  Having said that, please know that if you have landed on this page and we have been blessed to hit our first goal, we are still very much in need of donations, and will be eternally grateful for any amount you choose to donate!
   If you would like to write a check, just email or call Alec and let him know which Perk you'd like.  If you'd prefer to Paypal, send directly using aleccm@earthlink.net (Alec's email addy), and let him know  which Perk you'd like :)

   As you know if you've seen our live shows, especially our charity related gigs, we are out to make a difference.  Some of our songs are about love and relationships, while others are about human rights, environment, animal rights, peace, and consciousness.  By helping enable us to finish our album, you are helping us fulfill our callings both to entertain, and to inspire/raise awareness/reach out to our fellow humans who want to collaborate on making this world a more loving place.  We certainly like to have a good time with our audiences.  We also like to contribute what we can to building concsiousness in our local and global communities!

   As expressions of our gratitude, there is probably really something for everyone in our Perks menu.  From Bands & Bellies tickets to baked goods to lessons to private shows, you have 20 Perks to choose from.  It's flexible too, because you can donate at any amount of your choosing, even greater or smaller than listed amounts, and then choose whichever Perks you qualify for.  To those of you who live too far away for most of our Perks, or who simply wish to donate without choosing one, we send you an extra special hug and thank you :)
 
   Please do use the Indigogo share tools, and/or pass this page's link around to your contacts.  If nothing else, they'll probably enjoy the music video, but maybe they'll join you and Deep Stirrings in this campaign!

With SOOOOO much love and gratitude,
THANK YOU :) <3 :)
   ~Alec Marken, singer/songwriter/rhythm guitarist of Deep Stirrings
www.facebook.com/deepstirrings
www.twitter.com/deepstirrings
www.deepstirrings.com
www.youtube.com/deepstirrings
www.reverbnation.com/deepstirrings
story_txt:
Namaste :)
   We are so very grateful for your arrival on our fundraising page, and for your love and support!  Whatever level you are able to donate at, or even if you're just coming here to grab this page's link to share with friends, we thank you from the bottom of our hearts.  Deep Stirrings will be able to put our music out into the world because of your generosity!  If you are making a donation at one of the suggested amounts and wish to choose a Perk, I look forward to getting your Perk to you, and hearing how you enjoyed it!   Deep Stirrings has been playing for festivals, causes, charities, public venues, bars, etc. around SoCal for years, and a few years ago we started going to a recording studio to get our first full length album done.  By throwing in what band members could afford, along with some generous donations from a few friends, we were able to get 3 tracks finished, which appear on our cd single "El Viaje".  We also produced our music video (seen above), thanks to friends volunteering their talents, to promote the single.  After countless hours in the studio, and thousands of dollars already spent, we have a little done on every song, but MUCH more recording left to do, followed by mixing and mastering.  With 7 people in a band, recording takes a lot of time and resources.
   $3000 will help a great deal with recording our album.  It will probably cost twice that amount, but I wanted to set a reachable goal.  Having said that, please know that if you have landed on this page and we have been blessed to hit our first goal, we are still very much in need of donations, and will be eternally grateful for any amount you choose to donate!   If you would like to write a check, just email or call Alec and let him know which Perk you'd like.  If you'd prefer to Paypal, send directly using aleccm@earthlink.net (Alec's email addy), and let him know  which Perk you'd like :)
   As you know if you've seen our live shows, especially our charity related gigs, we are out to make a difference.  Some of our songs are about love and relationships, while others are about human rights, environment, animal rights, peace, and consciousness.  By helping enable us to finish our album, you are helping us fulfill our callings both to entertain, and to inspire/raise awareness/reach out to our fellow humans who want to collaborate on making this world a more loving place.  We certainly like to have a good time with our audiences.  We also like to contribute what we can to building concsiousness in our local and global communities!
   As expressions of our gratitude, there is probably really something for everyone in our Perks menu.  From Bands & Bellies tickets to baked goods to lessons to private shows, you have 20 Perks to choose from.  It's flexible too, because you can donate at any amount of your choosing, even greater or smaller than listed amounts, and then choose whichever Perks you qualify for.  To those of you who live too far away for most of our Perks, or who simply wish to donate without choosing one, we send you an extra special hug and thank you :)
 
   Please do use the Indigogo share tools, and/or pass this page's link around to your contacts.  If nothing else, they'll probably enjoy the music video, but maybe they'll join you and Deep Stirrings in this campaign!

With SOOOOO much love and gratitude,
THANK YOU :) <3 :)
   ~Alec Marken, singer/songwriter/rhythm guitarist of Deep Stirrings
www.facebook.com/deepstirrings
www.twitter.com/deepstirrings
www.deepstirrings.com
www.youtube.com/deepstirrings
www.reverbnation.com/deepstirrings

story:
The  R U N A W A Y album and the  P R O D I G A L heart

Vagabond Diaries is an album encompassing man's constant yearning to find hope, love, joy and above all else, himself. This journey of life where we sometimes find ourselves trying to escape the very things that define us.

Vagabond Diaries is set to release this Summer, 2013 but NEEDS YOUR HELP to get there. Enough people join the journey, we can get this quest started!

Become a  V A G A B O N D

Taking the leap and going out on your own is great and all but it's always better if done with new and old friends.

  • if a thousand people just buy the physical copy alone, we'll have made our goal and though we know thousands of people, it's better when everyone gets the word out.
  • We want to make it as accessible as possible; both the music AND the physical products that go along with it.
  • Give out of L O V E.  That's been a motto for our music to live by and we wouldn't want anyone contributing out of obligation.

Should we not make our goal, we will figure out some way to get this album up and running and out to you as well as figure out how to fulfill every one of the guarenteed perks.  It may end up that the time-frame is pushed back and that we are foreced to push your receiving of the perks back as well so PLEASE, Get us to that goal!

The  F O O T P R I N T S

We believe that the content on this album is very accessible to any and everyone, both from a genre and music standpoint all the way to the lyrical and theme content.  Everything from the music to the artwork and packaging is designed to leave an impact on the observer.

 

P E A K S  &  V A L L E Y S

We understand completely how hard it is to give financially to something.  Some of us haven't even had a suitcase to live out of and by some grace, stayed on couches and not by choice.  If you are reading this though, it is because something peaked your interest and you probably have the internet.  There are other ways of helping other than financially contributing:

  • Share the video on your facebook, twitter, instagram, pinterest, myspace, friendster, livejournal or any other social media outlet that you use.  You may not be able to contribute but someone who sees your post might be able to and then you have given just as much, if not more than currency could ever supply.
  • Just paste the link: http://youtu.be/KxJVkC2InS8 and a short blurb about why this interests you or even just say; Check out what my friends are creating and JOIN THEIR JOURNEY!
  • You can use the IdieGoGo Share tool and easily get this out there as well. it makes everything that much easier.

story:
Greetings family,

As many of you know, music is a integral part of my life and I have worked in the field for some time. With time comes experience and change, I realize the industry of music has changed dramatically. I strive to spread a positive message in every one of my recordings and stage shows. As a rehabilitated "gangster rapper" as Nutmeg http://www.amazon.com/Ghettos-Child-Nutmeg/dp/B000008Q3R I know I have something special to share. I believe that if you find purpose for your life , you should definately follow the path in that purpose. That is what this campaign is about, having the opportunity to follow that path.

 I currently help other artists to follow thier path as well , locally, by way of a monthly all-women showcase, The Feminine Project https://www.facebook.com/TheFeminineProjectMusicShowcase?ref=hl this has been an enjoyable venture. However, I have to grow my own career as well. That is where you come in.

  Being an independent artist, and without a record deal, it means I must do everything out of my pocket, or with sponsorship. I know the challenges and I am happy to say that due to some good internet marketing on our part, I have a growing following around the country. The problem is, I miss many engagements because I live in Arizona and cannot yet afford to travel back and forth to the East Coast (where I am invited frequently). With your gifts of support, I can make it to these events, perform and build my fanbase!


  Some may ask why promoters don't pay for travel arrangements, that is a good question. However, due to the changing industry of indie music, that is a rare occurance. Most promoters will be glad to put smaller acts on the bill with major artists, but will not pay for travel arragements. Also, I work in the conscious music platform and many who invite me to perform are organizers with non-profit groups and the budget does not support such. Below are some engagements I have been blessed to attend and perform live.

.Blacks Womens Arts festival, Philedelphia(July 2010)

.Saviors Day Jazz Concert,Chicago,Il (Feb 2010)

.Million Family march Anniversary,Memphis,Tn (Oct
2011)

 

Some of the upcoming events I have been invited to perform live.

.Do For Self Music Conference(Feat.Kam,Jasiri.X),Atlanta,Ga(Aug 2013)

.Million Youth March (Feat.K-rino and more TBA), Harlem, N.Y,(Sept 7 2013)

 

 More bookings will be made if I can show a budget to support travel. You can help make this possible!

 

I do not have an entourage of people to travel with, so the budget I need is moderately small. Anything you can give is appreciated from the depths of my heart. I have gifts for donation levels that reflect my thanks to donors as well as a pre-order of my upcoming digital cd "Sound Doctrine 2" for your listening pleasure! All of the proceeds will be used to secure travel and lodging at upcoming events nationwide!

 If you have further questions, please fell free to contact me personally at SacrificeRecords2@gmail.com and I will be glad to answer them for you!

Once again, your gift, no matter the size, will be appreciated!
 Thanks in advance for your support!

 

Connie Muhammad

Artist

Sacrifice Life Records

http://www.reverbnation.com/conniemuhammad

story:
It's not very often that you get together with a group of people and really create an art form that you are extremely proud of. 

We are Good Morning Grizzly, and we feel like we have hit one of those rare times.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We have been shaping new sounds together and fleshing out ideas for what we feel like is the most honest, genuine, and dilligent work any of us have ever done musically. 

We think now is the time to get it out there. 

"Dirty", to us, is what life is all about. It's a party, it's a lonely night on your back porch, it's a road trip, and it's even a little bit of heartbreak.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is what we're asking help for:


We would like to be able to record with Kendall Osborne in March of this year at the Closet Studios. 

We're simply giving you the opportunity to get your hands on the record, some really cool merch, and some really rare moments with us before anyone else. 

All of the donated money will go to funding the record, packaging and promotion, and then to make sure all of the incentives are as cool as can possibly be. 

 

If you could help us, we would be so grateful. If you can donate, that is awesome! If you can't, would you consider sharing this page with everyone you know? Every donation, whether it be $1 or $1,000,000 will help. Every donor, big or small, will be asked to take part in the record as well. 

 

Seriously, Thank you for taking the time to read this.

 

Love, 

The Grizzly Boys

story:
Hey Everyone!!

Thank you so much for checking out my campaign! My name is Rachel Adams. I am an urban pop recording artist from South Florida. In the spring of 2013 I will be graduating from Berklee College of Music. Emerald Heart is a reflection of my life and I can't wait to share it with you guys. My team and I have poured our hearts and souls into this. We can't wait to get in the studio to start recording, but... we need your help!!!

I am inviting all of my friends, family and fans to help play an important role in this project by joining my team and I to help spread the word and raise funds.

Your financial support is extremely important to me. It will help pay for production costs such as producers, engineers, world class musicians, and videographers as well as pay for studio time, manufacturing, and distribution. If by some miracle, we raise more money than asked for, those funds will go towards touring, radio/promotion, merchandise, copyrights and a kickass release party where I can invite all of you to hear my album live for the first time!! :)

If you cant afford to donate, I would be equally as appreciative if you would pass the word along to anyone you know who might be interested. Any amount of money makes the biggest difference.

 

Thank you!!

Rachel Adams

www.racheladamsmusic.com

www.twitter.com/rachelsadams

www.youtube.com/racheladamsmusic

www.facebook.com/racheladamsmusic23

story:
10/3 Update!
Less than 12 hours left!  Here are a couple of special last minute perks available until midnight!
Play with the Band.....$1000
Get on stage with UL and play one song with us.  You have to prove yourself at soundcheck.
Band Photo(shop)....$50
Have your face superimposed on the member of your choice in a band pic.  Check out the example on this page.

9/23 update!
We are less than two weeks from our deadline and have decided to offer some new perks to sweeten the deal.  Here's the first one: 
The New Arrangements
We have finished recording in the studio and were able to lay down 12 new tracks. Our fearless bass player Nigel has notated all of the music on staff paper just the way we recorded them.  All of these tunes may not make the final cut, but one lucky fan can get this piece of Uncle Lucius history, autographed by the band and our esteemed producer, George Reiff.  Check out the perks section to claim this one.

This is it folks! We are ready to begin the process of recording and promoting our Fourth studio album and have decided to cut out the middle man and go directly to our fans for support. We are excited about the new material, the producer, the studio and the possibilities when the music is released in early 2015. Take a moment to watch the video and look at all of the wonderful perk packages we have put together. Thanks for your time and support! Much Love. Uncle Lucius

Why are we asking for $75000?
Here's the breakdown:
$25000 to record.....this covers:
Producer, engineer, studio time, pay for the band and any guests, food for two weeks, mixing and mastering
$25000 to manufacture and promote.....this covers:
CD and vinyl printing, artwork, national radio promo, videos and consumer advertising
$25000 for publicity campaign.....
You get what you pay for.  If we want to get the word out nationally, we must hire the  best publicists we can.  This amount will cover a 6 month campaign and help broaden the buzz.

story:
Short Summary

Heather Heart in an up and coming artist in the pop music industry who has recently worked with Mike Gonsolin of Trenddef Studios in the L.A. area. Trend Def Studios (www.trenddefstudios.com) is a one-stop shop for pop and Mike has worked with artists such as Lady Gaga, Snoop Dogg, The Veronicas, and Linkin Park. Together they worked on recording six cover songs for her CD, The L.A. Demos. The CD includes the following covers:

- Can't Help Falling in Love by Elvis Presley (Ingrid Michaelson cover)

- Second Hand White Baby Grand, from the TV series 'Smash'

- Gravity by Sara Bareilles

- Glitter in the Air by P!nk

- Unconditionally by Katy Perry

- Skinny Love by Bon Iver (Birdy cover)

Heather Heart wants to continue her work with Trend Def Studios, the next step will be writing and recording 3 original songs that will then be marketed to radio stations around the nation and the world. In order to accomplish this, a total of $12,000 is needed. With this, Trenddef will not stop marketing the music and will continually be pushing it on the airwaves.

By helping Heather Heart Music you will be helping to make dreams become reality. 

What We Need & What You Get

Heather Heart wants to continue her work with Trend Def Studios, the next step will be writing and recording 3 original songs that will then be marketed to radio stations around the nation and the world. In order to accomplish this, a total of $12,000 is needed. With this, Trenddef will not stop marketing the music and will continually be pushing it on the airwaves.

The dedication and work that goes into this will have a big pay off for those involved, as her music career takes off and dreams are realized.

If we do not receive the full amount, we will continue to do fundraisers until the goal is reached. Every dollar accrued will go 100% towards the recording.

What you get for helping out:

$15.00 - Digital copy of The L.A. Demos CD

$25.00 - Personally signed copy of the L.A. Demos CD

The Impact

Heather Heart Music is on the way to becoming a big name in the pop world! Writing and recording music and getting it heard is the first and hardest step in this amazing process. The impact will affect others for good, as people are inspired and uplifted by the music that she and Trenddef Studios will record. Help to make dreams come true and create careers for us by contributing in whatever way you can!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a donation or monetary contribution, there are plenty of other ways you can help! Please get word out via social media and word of mouth! Every little bit helps. 

Another huge help is to follow her on social media! Check out her pics and videos at the following sites:

YouTube: HeatherHeartMusic (https://www.youtube.com/user/HeatherHeartMusic)

Twitter: HeatherHeart22 (https://twitter.com/HeatherHeart22)

Instagram: @HeatherHeartMusic

Vine: HeatherHeart

story:
Gold Drum Corps

DCI's newest national Competitor needs your help!

  • Gold has grown from 84 members to over 120 in just two years.
  • Our growth  has put a huge financial strain on the organization, but you can help!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The truck purchase alone is $7,000.00
  • Painting Costs are estimated at $4-5,000.00
  • Cost of outfitting the interior is estimated at $4,000.00
  • Donate $50 or more & get a Gold T-Shirt!
  • Donate $100 or more & get a T-Shirt & pair of tickets to our home show.
  • Donate $1000 or more and we'll add your name to our trailer, as well as getting the previous level's perks.

The Impact

For Gold to survive long term, we must have the right infrastructure to provide students with a quality experience.

  • You can make a difference in seeing So Cal Drum Corps thrive.
  • In just 9 seasons, Gold has made a huge impact in students lives & in the Drum Corps activity.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can't afford to make a contribution? Make your friends aware!
story_txt:
Gold Drum Corps
DCI's newest national Competitor needs your help!
Gold has grown from 84 members to over 120 in just two years.

Our growth  has put a huge financial strain on the organization, but you can help!

What We Need & What You Get
The truck purchase alone is $7,000.00

Painting Costs are estimated at $4-5,000.00

Cost of outfitting the interior is estimated at $4,000.00
Donate $50 or more & get a Gold T-Shirt!
Donate $100 or more & get a T-Shirt & pair of tickets to our home show.

Donate $1000 or more and we'll add your name to our trailer, as well as getting the previous level's perks.
The ImpactFor Gold to survive long term, we must have the right infrastructure to provide students with a quality experience.
You can make a difference in seeing So Cal Drum Corps thrive.
In just 9 seasons, Gold has made a huge impact in students lives & in the Drum Corps activity.

Other Ways You Can HelpCan't afford to make a contribution? Make your friends aware!

story:
Short Summary

I want to bring awareness, through music, to the alcoholic/addict that still suffers that there is a way out.

5 years ago Drugs and alcohol almost took my life. I was so lost in a sea of addiction and I just couldn't stop. I was completely powerless.

I have dedicated most of my life now to working with other alcoholics/addicts to overcome their addiction as well as my music.

Throughout most of my recovery, I was scared to get back into music because I associated music with my addiction.

In 2013, my fourth year sober, I decided to get back into music.

What a year!

I released a single that described my feelings I was having when I was in my addiction. That single - entitled Feelin', took off like a rocket gaining over 200,000 views on YouTube and placing me in the Top 10 for Rock on the Reverbnation Charts in Los Angeles as well as radio play throughout  college radio stations in the US and Canada.

I also played guitar for the band "Falling For Scarlet" which charted on the Billboards Top 100 in the USA.

In between all that I hosted an internet show "2NR" which interviewed Vancouver bands and music industry professionals and hosted the 2013 Vancouver Music Industry Awards. As well as, starting an artist management company. Currently working with the artist Joharra who was formerly on Warner Bros label.

*** May 30, 2014 will mark my 5 years clean and sober.

  • Help me record and release this song. Even if it saves one life, we have made a difference

What I Need & What You Get

  • I need to raise $3000.00. I have been asked to work with an award winning producer that has worked with me in the past; however, he doesn't come cheap. We work amazingly together and he also supports what I am trying to achieve.
  • By supporting my campaign you will receive some incredible perks! Swag, posters, digital downloads, pre-release, time in the studio with me, custom song for you, etc. More importantly you will be supporting a cause that could possibly change their lives.
  • If I don't reach my full goal. I will still try and get the song done, because its not about me, its about possibly making a difference in this world.

The Impact

Through music, I hope to give the addict that still suffers hope that there is a way out. I want them to think, if Ray Ray can get clean, maybe I can too.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, there's still other ways you can help:

  • Please spread the news that I need help making this a reality on your social networking sites.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

6 ill-fated art school students form The Mother Funk Yas.  What makes us ill-fated you ask? Well, Chris is blind, Morgan's Canadian and has a tendency to look like he's having a stroke while playing his bass, Drake has a severe anxiety disorder, Tony has a broken back and a Pit Bull, Sam has trouble "getting in the pocket," and Alex is always late.  Just kidding, mostly.  

Truth be told, we are 6 kids from all over the world who came together at the CalArts campus in Valencia, California to form a band not formally identifiable as Reggae, Rock, Funk, R&B, Hip Hop or Jazz but with clearly discernible elements from all those genres.  Alex's soulful voice, hard-hitting bass lines, traditional skank guitar and a tight jazz drummer round out the rhythm section. This coupled with tight brass lines and an electric violin played through effects give The Mother Funk Yas a fresh and unique sound.

    

The Impact

How do 6 talented artists not have any money?  That's a great question.  Following the advice of our parents and mentors, we followed our dreams and decided to pursue careers in music. Unfortunately, for musicians fresh out of art school, our dreams, while realizable, happen to be expensive.  With your help, we'll be one step closer to making our dreams a reality.  By donating to The Mother Funk Yas, not only will you help us record and produce our debut album but you'll also be directly responsible for helping to bring some funky, fresh tunes to a music scene dying for some new faces.   


What We Need & What You Get

We, The Mother Funk Yas, need funding for recording, album art, printing, promotion, and digital distribution.  While we have pooled our funds from previous gigs, unfortunately, it's not enough.  To produce a professional, debut album, we need your help.   To entice you to back our project we will be offering digital and physical copies of our CD, signed posters, Executive Producer credits, photo albums, photo shoots by our resident photographer Jessica Pelle and even the opportunity to have The Mother Funk Yas perform at your next event.


Other Ways You Can Help

Not able to donate money, but still looking to promote our cause?  Help out by becoming a "fan" by "liking" our Facebook page, http://www.facebook.com/themotherfunkyas , following us on Twitter @http://twitter.com/#!/MotherFunkYas , and sharing us with your friends.  Tag us in a Facebook post, share our promo video, whatever!  Anything you can do to get The Mother Funk Yas name out there brings us one step closer to our goal of sharing our music with the world.

story:
Our Story

Our names are Troy Hepler and Joe Vergara. We are two college students who grew up in the different parts of the midwest and moved out to Orlando, Florida to go to school where we met. We both have musical backgrounds and a story to tell we thought what better way to share, express, and capture this time of our lives then write it all down in a tune or two. 

Our Goal 

Our goal is simple. Play music, and have fun. Positive music from moments in our life that we can share with others and relate. We hope to record a CD over the next six months and see where it goes. 

Why Do We Need Your Help

So why do we need your help? Well in all honesty making a CD takes money. Your donations will be used to buy equipment, rent equipment , rent studio time, and publication. We will be posting updates on all of our activities and hope you join us to complete our goal.  Disclaimer: unless a minimum of 400 dollars is raised we will not be able to give away an Ipod Touch but we know this won't be an issue but if it is we will make sure to do something special for all those who donate. 


Links

Remembering Sunday Cover : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uAURys0_z_4

First Original Song Blue Eyes, Summer Skys, and Long Distance Lullabies; 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N3VVFcaxhhc 

I'd Rather Be With You Cover: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3GNqJElo1RM

story:
The purpose of this campaign is for me to be able to afford the necessary standard to finish a high quality record. The songs have been recorded and mixed, and the artwork has been created. The whole production process has been done independently and without any corporate funds. All this album needs to be properly completed is audio mastering (the process of enhancing, preparing and transferring recorded audio from a source containing the final mix to a data storage or Master from which all copies will be produced), high quality duplications (CDs with not only high resolution audio but also high resolution printing for the booklet), and a site to launch it.

AMUZIKANTO comes from the words in Esperanto: amuzi: to amuse, to entertain; muziko: music; kanto: song, chant. 

This project is a musical whim of the little girl I still am, and it is also a celebration of all the musical influences that converge in me:

The music of my blood, which tells the history of my ancestors and sings stories of people I’ve never known and places I’ve never been.

The music of my homeland, that tells the stories of those who passed through or stayed for many generations, contributing to the gigantic puzzle that forms the country’s cultural personality.

The music of me, telling the tales of my travels and adventures through this life as I come across new friends, strange places, and foreign sounds that, little by little, become a part of me.

For nearly twenty years, I've dedicated my life to painting, sculpture, illustration, graphic design, craft-making, puppetry, singing, songwriting, and writing both in English and Spanish. I do all this for a living, as a freelancer. I also love doing it.

About five years ago, and after having had the chance to work for other artists and companies in a variety of musical projects, either as a composer, vocal arranger, translator, live performer and/or recording artist including voice-over talent in major movies, I decided it was time for me to start producing a very personal project where I could include my own songs and images, as a crossover between all the areas of my work, and where the characters in the songs would become puppets not just for the album's artwork but also to become alive in animated musical videos. 

As it developed, I could see that this project had to be unrestrained by companies underlines, average classifications, or marketing criteria. Most of all, I wanted it to be fun to make, although as a professional I naturally took the production very seriously. Since it has taken me the past five years of careful work and dedication to create something that entirely reflects my own vision, I'm reaching out to you -existing or potential fans- to help me finalize it with the same level of creative independence with which I began.

The completion of the recording, in the quality and styles that I envisioned, was achievable thanks to Emiliano Almeida who not only recorded all the percussion, but also was in charge of the general production: tracking, mixing, programming, and a substantial contribution to the musical arrangements. The whole production process was done in a studio that he and I share in La Crescenta, California. 

I was also lucky enough to count with the assistance of a handful of talented musicians from distant corners of the globe who helped me greatly with the task of expressing a variety of sounds and rhythms (Mariana Galarza on berimbau, Milen Kirov on accordion & keyboards, Dan Sistos on guitars, Laura Serkin on flute, and the young voices of Naima Corea and Sara Otero Estanga).

The process of recording and mixing all the seventeen tracks, as well as the realization of all the artwork (which includes seventeen pieces of graphic art created digitally from photos of over twenty hand-made puppets), are completed. I also self-produced two musical videos --one where I experimented filming my puppets, and secondly an animation created in collaboration with a small independent production company in South America.

All I need now to make this album come out to the world is to master it properly at a mastering house in LA (US$1,500), to make duplications where the graphics can be appreciated (US$2,000), and to develop an attractive website to launch the album (US$1,500).

Please take a look at all the ways in which I'm saying THANK YOU if you decide to contribute. I hope you'd want to be a part of Amuzikanto, and help it spread throughout the world, so that people everywhere can be a part of it as well.

Patricia Krebs.

story:
We present to you a rare opportunity to hear all of the Sequenzas by Luciano Berio in a series of four free concerts this fall.  These amazing solo pieces will be performed for you by New York's finest contemporary classical musicians.

Luciano Berio (1925-2003) was one of the great composers of the late 20th century.  His solo Sequenza works for fourteen different instruments are some of the most technically and physically demanding pieces written.  They also happen to be wildly entertaining.

This is where you come in!  We are fortunate to have performance spaces provided to us free of charge.  Our musicians are currently donating many hours of their daily schedules to learning this incredibly difficult pieces.  We need to compensate them for their stunning generosity in time, artistry, and hours of -(maybe not blood)-, but definitely sweat and tears.  Our musicians hail from the International Contemporary Ensemble, Ensemble ACJW, the Declassified, Juilliard, Manhattan School, Oberlin Conservatory, and Rice University and many more prestigious organizations, and perform all over the world.  A very special treat to us and you is that our accordionist, Bill Schimmel,  was a long-time friend of the composer himself, and performed the New York premeire of Sequenza XIII !

In addition to compensating our performers, we have a minimal publicity cost of $250.

Your money will go directly to the musicians, where it will have the most impact.  By supporting them, you are showing them that the work they do is highly valuable to all of us!  Once our goal is reached, you are encouraged to keep giving.  Every extra penny will be greatly appreciated!

Concert I: October 11, 7:30pm. Pete's Candy Store (Brooklyn).  Sequenzas I (flute), V (trombone), VI (viola), VIII (violin), XIV (bass)

Concert II: October 25, 7:30pm. Pete's Candy Store.  Sequenzas II (harp) III (voice), IX (clarinet), XI (guitar)

Concert III: November 10, 4pm. Caffe Vivaldi (Manhattan).  Sequenzas I (flute), II (harp), IV (piano), V (trombone), IX (clarinet), XIII (accordion), XIV (double bass)

Concert IV: November 11, 4pm. Caffe Vivaldi.  Sequenzas III (voice), VI (viola), VII (oboe), VIII (violin), X (trumpet), XII (guitar), XII (bassoon)

Performers: Eric Lamb and Erin Lesser, flute; Jacqui Kerrod, harp, Kjersti Kveli, voice, Tor Morten Kjøsnes, piano, William Lang, trombone; Kristina Giles, viola; Clara Lyon, violin; Arthur Sato, oboe; Carlos Cordeiro, clarinet; Gareth Flowers, trumpet; Colin Davin, guitar; Brad Balliett, bassoon; William Schimmel, accordion; Doug Balliett, double bass.

story:
Sub19 lanza un nuevo EP y te necesita

Somos un grupo de música pop-rock que acaba de grabar un pequeño disco con muchísima ilusión y ganas de verlo de forma material, para compartirlo contigo, que nos estás leyendo.

El importante aquí eres TÚ. Y te contamos nuestro plan:

Ya hemos grabado nuestras canciones, acabamos de salir del estudio, y ahora necesitamos un poquito de financiación para hacer realidad esa música. Para que pueda salir del estudio y llegar a los oídos de las personas que nos escuchan.

Vuestra aportación económica irá destinada principalmente a la postproducción del EP y a sacar el formato físico de nuestro disco. No pedimos nada más de lo que necesitamos, simplemente nos ayudáis con un granito de arena a adelantar la financiación. Nosotros confiamos y agradecemos infinitamente vuestra ayuda, y vosotros confiáis en nuestra música.

El pago se hace por Internet, de forma segura, no os preocupéis. Si tienes una cuenta pay-pal puedes utilizarla, y sino con tu cuenta bancaria habitual.

Llevamos 2 años sobre los escenarios y tenemos muchas ganas de mantenernos sobre ellos. Hemos pasado por el Valladolid Latino, la plaza mayor de Valladolid... y hemos compartido escenario con grandes músicos del panorama nacional. Así que no queremos parar.  Con más ganas que nunca y guiados únicamente por la música, hemos decidido grabar 5 de nuestras canciones, para que no solo nos escuches en directo, sino que podamos estar también en tu casa. Este disco saldrá ya con el nuevo NOMBRE de grupo, como explicamos en el vídeo. Dejamos atrás el nombre de Sub19 con muchos grandes momentos atrás, pero con ilusión por cosas nuevas.

En cuanto esté el disco en nuestras manos os lo enviaremos a vuestra DIRECCIÓN, o si preferís os lo damos EN MANO en nuestro concierto de presentación, que será aproximadamente en Abril. Hacédnoslo saber o en el mail, o en la dirección.

Tenemos 60 días para conseguirlo!


¿Qué necesitamos?

  • Nuestro objetivo es conseguir 700€. Para la postproducción, diseño, y copias de nuestro EP.
  • Puedes colaborar de muchas maneras con nosotros. Hay muchos paquetes:     5€= CD; 7€= CD + un single por email antes de que salga el disco;                   10€= CD+camiseta;     18€ 2 cd + 2 camisetas;     35€ 4 cds + 4 camisetas;

  • 150€ concierto acústico para una cena en casa (a 100 kms. desde Valladolid, contactar con el grupo. sub19music@gmail.com)

  • 300€ : Si tienes una empresa o una marca y quieres aparecer en nuestros créditos y carteles de los conciertos durante todo el año también puedes hacerlo.

  • Es importante saber vuestra talla de camiseta, cuando hagáis la contribución dejádnoslo escrito.

  • Si no consiguiéramos nuestro objetivo total, haremos todas las copias necesarias para los que hayáis colaborado con nosotros. Es decir, si colaboras obtendrás tu recompensa.


También puedes ayudarnos:

A través de la difusión de nuestra campaña por la red. Estaríamos muy agradecidos si consiguiéramos el objetivo, entre todos podemos. Somos uno.

Agradecemos su esfuerzo a Marta de la Fuente (diseños) y Luis Vegas (ayudante en management)




Mil gracias.




Síguenos en @sub19music y  Sub19 en Facebook.

mail: sub19music@gmail.com
story_txt:
Sub19 lanza un nuevo EP y te necesitaSomos un grupo de música pop-rock que acaba de grabar un pequeño disco con muchísima ilusión y ganas de verlo de forma material, para compartirlo contigo, que nos estás leyendo.El importante aquí eres TÚ. Y te contamos nuestro plan:Ya hemos grabado nuestras canciones, acabamos de salir del estudio, y ahora necesitamos un poquito de financiación para hacer realidad esa música. Para que pueda salir del estudio y llegar a los oídos de las personas que nos escuchan.Vuestra aportación económica irá destinada principalmente a la postproducción del EP y a sacar el formato físico de nuestro disco. No pedimos nada más de lo que necesitamos, simplemente nos ayudáis con un granito de arena a adelantar la financiación. Nosotros confiamos y agradecemos infinitamente vuestra ayuda, y vosotros confiáis en nuestra música.El pago se hace por Internet, de forma segura, no os preocupéis. Si tienes una cuenta pay-pal puedes utilizarla, y sino con tu cuenta bancaria habitual.Llevamos 2 años sobre los escenarios y tenemos muchas ganas de mantenernos sobre ellos. Hemos pasado por el Valladolid Latino, la plaza mayor de Valladolid... y hemos compartido escenario con grandes músicos del panorama nacional. Así que no queremos parar.  Con más ganas que nunca y guiados únicamente por la música, hemos decidido grabar 5 de nuestras canciones, para que no solo nos escuches en directo, sino que podamos estar también en tu casa. Este disco saldrá ya con el nuevo NOMBRE de grupo, como explicamos en el vídeo. Dejamos atrás el nombre de Sub19 con muchos grandes momentos atrás, pero con ilusión por cosas nuevas.En cuanto esté el disco en nuestras manos os lo enviaremos a vuestra DIRECCIÓN, o si preferís os lo damos EN MANO en nuestro concierto de presentación, que será aproximadamente en Abril. Hacédnoslo saber o en el mail, o en la dirección.Tenemos 60 días para conseguirlo!¿Qué necesitamos?
Nuestro objetivo es conseguir 700€. Para la postproducción, diseño, y copias de nuestro EP.
Puedes colaborar de muchas maneras con nosotros. Hay muchos paquetes:     5€= CD; 7€= CD + un single por email antes de que salga el disco;                   10€= CD+camiseta;     18€ 2 cd + 2 camisetas;     35€ 4 cds + 4 camisetas;


150€ concierto acústico para una cena en casa (a 100 kms. desde Valladolid, contactar con el grupo. sub19music@gmail.com)
300€ : Si tienes una empresa o una marca y quieres aparecer en nuestros créditos y carteles de los conciertos durante todo el año también puedes hacerlo.
Es importante saber vuestra talla de camiseta, cuando hagáis la contribución dejádnoslo escrito.
Si no consiguiéramos nuestro objetivo total, haremos todas las copias necesarias para los que hayáis colaborado con nosotros. Es decir, si colaboras obtendrás tu recompensa.También puedes ayudarnos:A través de la difusión de nuestra campaña por la red. Estaríamos muy agradecidos si consiguiéramos el objetivo, entre todos podemos. Somos uno.Agradecemos su esfuerzo a Marta de la Fuente (diseños) y Luis Vegas (ayudante en management)Mil gracias.Síguenos en @sub19music y  Sub19 en Facebook.mail: sub19music@gmail.com

story:
Who Are The Higgs? 

We are a Jam-Band called The Higgs, a high energy and explosive Improvisational-Rock group.  We are based out of Southern California, and love all the support we get from the local music community.  Our passion for performing and recording music is very important to us, and our goal is to produce a high quality, professional release that makes you get up and start grooving!  With your contributions, we will have the capability to:
-Master Album
-Press/Duplicate Album
-Album Merchandise

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $6,500, and this number is based on our costs for everything involved in the printing of the CD.
-Master Album - $1,000
-Press/Duplicate Album - $3,000
-Album Merchandise - $2,500

Check out the packages unique to the donation you choose!  We can even come play in your living room or backyard!  The Higgs will be giving away plenty of great rewards for your generous contributions!  But most importantly, each donation of at least $25 gets you the brand new FULL LENGTH ALBUM!

The Impact

Many of these tunes have been played live for years but have never been recorded in the studio. We want to make this record accessible to anyone in CD format.  We previously released an EP, therefore have real life experience to complete the tasks at hand.  We know that it takes hard work and time to make sure all the parts of the engine are running smoothly for this album.  But our passion and drive will ensure the finished product. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If a donation is out of the question there are other way you can help!  Share this fundraiser page on your Facebook or Instagram.  Any way you can get the word out about this campaign will be much appreciated by the band.  Be sure to use the Indiegogo Share Tools!

https://www.facebook.com/TheHiggsMusic
http://www.thehiggsmusic.com/
http://instagram.com/thehiggsmusic

story:
Giving families a route to justice

We give victims of serious crime abroad legal advice, representation, access to translation and interpretation and knowledge of the foreign criminal justice system in the country where the crime happened. In short, we give them the best chance they'll have to obtain justice.

In the past two months, out of our ten current cases, we have so far paired up four families with lawyers willing to represent them free of charge. We explain to relatives how processes work in different countries, help them navigate different law systems and understand different ways in which authorities conduct investigations. We want to continue to be able to support families so they understand and take part in proceedings abroad.

Why you won't regret helping us

  • We started life as a political campaign, but have turned to charitable work since October last year. We're waiting for charitable status, which leaves us in a difficult position - third parties can't fundraise for us and many trusts and foundations are not able to give us grants yet. (UPDATE: We're pleased to announce we have been granted charitable status today. Justice Across Borders is now a registered charity [number 1156759]. We can now apply for new grants and the outlook is much better, but we still need your help to survive in the meantime. Please keep donating!)
  • We have done the responsible thing and applied for grants from the ones who can help us but we won't hear from them for a while. We have been lucky enough to have the support of two benefactors but their support alone won't be able to keep us afloat past June. 
  • We do a huge amount with little money. If you help us raise £30,000 we can keep a small office and two dedicated members of staff who are relentlessly supporting families throughout their cases, creating a network of pro bono lawyers, legal experts and translators in the UK and across Europe, and researching foreign justice systems so families and victims can have all the information they need.

The Impact

We currently have 10 cases which we will have to abandon if we close:

  • These include a mother-of three who works part time and can't afford legal fees
  • A widow who hasn't been able to bury her husband for five years because of legal complications in the country where the crime happened
  • Two mothers and a father whose sons were killed overseas, who are fighting for criminal investigations to take place.

We are helping these families and others get access to justice. For the first time, these families have found stability and continuous support. 

We don't want them to be abandoned again, but we need your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, don't sweat it. You can help us by spreading the word and help us crowd fund the amount we need to survive.

You can:

  • Tweet in support of Justice Across Borders using #savejustice 
  • Share this page on Facebook, email and other media

story:
Why crowd source?

Although our imagination is grand, and we have done some amazing things, we do have our financial limits.  We have booked three days of eclectic and rare live music and performance spanning instrument builders, multimedia artists, turntablists, industrial music that covers the breadth of the genre, break core, ambient, idm, video artists, djs and performers who can hardly be compared to anyone else on earth.

This is not an inexpensive undertaking. Hotels and flights alone cost many thousands of dollars before the show begins.  Instead of going to traditional investors who typically care more about their return than the art, we are going directly to you, the enthusiasts, who will respect and appreciate that we are doing this campaign to give all of you that know our history, and those who don't, a chance to get your tickets early and at the lowest price while supporting the artform[s] you love..

Please support this ongoing art movement by donating to our 25th Anniversary event!

Looking back

We already know that we can accomplish a great deal on our own.  We have hosted multimedia circuses, multi-day music, multimedia and performance art festivals, producing club nights involving live drummers triggering video lighting and lasers, and on and on.  Here's some clips from past shows that we've produced.



And what do we give you for your support?

We have only 50 reduced price three day passes, a limited number of shirts, and a limited edition specially packaged numbered usb flash drive compilation that will feature hours of material including exclusive tracks and videos from most of the performers plus never before seen footage from Voidstar Productions' archives from past shows and more.

Who's playing this festival?

As of the time of the campaign launch we have been announcing an artist a day.
We have recently announced our complete line up. We are proud to announce the following artists:
Abstinence [NY - industrial]

Cenotype [NJ - industrial, rhythmic noise]

Cervello Elettronico [Los Angeles CA - techno, ebm, experimental]

High-Functioning Flesh [Los Angeles CA - industrial, ebm]

Insect Ark [NY - experimental, doom]

Author & Punisher [San Diego, CA - Industrial Doom]
∆AIMON [San Diego, CA - Witch House]
Compactor [New York, NY - Industrial, Experimental]
End.user [New Orleans, LA - Breakcore - Sonic Terror]
Greg Greg [Buffalo, NY - Experimental]
Greyscale [Buffalo, NY - Experimental]
Journey to the Center of the Colon [Boston, MA - Experimental]
Marching Dynamics [Los Angeles, CA - Idm]
Massdirge [Boston, MA - Industrial Doom]
Mend [Chicago, IL - Idm, Downtempo]
Pattern Behaviour [Providence, RI - Idm]
Pine Tree State Mind Control - [Maine - Experimental]
Sleep Clinic [Los Angeles, CA - Ambient]
Snow Beasts [Providence, RI - Idm]
Statiqbloom [Brooklyn, NY - Industrial, Ebm]
Theologian [Brooklyn, NY - Noise, Drone, Death Industrial - Crucial Blast, Annihilvs Power Electronix, Malignent]
Timeghost [Providence, RI - Experimental, Industrial, Performance Art]
Tonikom [NY - Idm, Downtempo - Hymen Records]
Ukuphambana [Boston, MA - Experimental]
The Vomit Arsonist [Providence, RI - Death Industrial - Malignent]
Zero Times Infinity [Boston, MA - Industrial, Experimental]
Further description of each act including videos, picture and music can be found at the Voidstar Productions website. 

What is unique about this festival?

Voidstar Productions has a long history of unusual event productions with high standards and strong practices for giving the audience experiences that they will rarely find elsewhere with minimal time wasted from the time doors open to the end of the night.  One artists that we have booked has described the way we operate as like a military campaign.

There are no opening acts and shows often start off with surprises.  We have legendary acts that have asked about playing this festival after it was already booked solid, so there's no point to waste a moment on booking any filler bands that don't bring something special to your experience.

Past surprises have included:
* Author and Punisher doing an extra set to debut a new project that at the time was called Women and Children.  This latter evolved into tracks that are on his album of the same name.
* Not Breathing and Raab Codec's only live collaboration.
* Pine Tree State Mind Control's destructive crowd participation street performance.
* Surprise performances by numerous artists.
* Many rare collaborative performances at past shows.

We play with the environment and experience.  This includes setting up performers to play back to back from different locations, installations, use of video and performance artists, and more.

The artists line up order is a secret that is built around the experience as a whole rather than the typical unknown opener starting and big draw headliner closing.

Popularity alone doesn't interest us.  We have been uncompromising about our art for the entirety of our history and we wont stop now.  We take pride in how often people say they were blown away by the artists that they didn't know on our lineups which happens far more often than not.
