story:
A Brief Intro

I am Lauri Wuolio from Helsinki, Finland. I am a musician, a sound artist and a busker. In 2011, after an adventurous trip to meet a Russian instrument builder, I dived deep into the world of handpans.

Handpan is a new musical instrument that was invented about 15 years ago in Switzerland and is now developed and built by tens of builders around the world.

In August 2014 I recorded a new album. I’m really excited about the result and now I want to share it with all of you! With your help we can now release this album!

From Electronic to Acoustic

My first studio album was released in 2013. At that time I felt I wasn’t ready for a 100 % acoustic studio live album. But it was ok because I had a lot of good ideas as a sound artist and a busker. So I distilled my background and experience into an ambient percussion album that combined acoustic rhythm music with beautiful and unexpected sounds and noises.

However, soon I noticed that recreating the same complex electronic soundscapes of the album on stage was more difficult than I had expected. As a result, I found myself performing more often acoustic than with my full acoustic-electronic live setup. And finally, in 2014 I decided I should record an album, that captured the soul and essence of my acoustic live performances.

Real Music for Unreal Times

Recording a cupola is surprisingly difficult. I decided that if I was to make an acoustic album, it should sound as good as possible. So I contacted Martin Kantola at Nordic Audio Labs. While fairly unknown to most people, in some audiophile circles Martin is known for building some of the finest microphones on this planet. So I kinda thought he might know how to record a cupola.

We talked over the phone and he was interested in recording my album, so in August 2014 I travelled to Nordic Audio Labs and recorded some 3,5 hours of new music. From this material I have now chosen the best parts and composed an album called Real Music for Unreal Times.

A great part of all music on the album was improvised live in studio. The songs flow freely, sometimes intertwining, then disappearing on an improvised sidetrack and returning later in a different form, but never losing a sense of structure.

Behind the Scenes

The album was recorded in an experimental setting with multiple mics and virtual acoustics. By using a panphonic surround mic (of his own design) Martin had captured a 3d-soundimage of the acoustics in the monastery of Solovetsky, Russia. With the help of convolution technology and two big loudspeaker walls we recreated the monastery acoustics live in his studio. The effect was almost like playing inside a sonic hologram. If I closed my eyes, I could almost smell the old stone walls of the monastery… The reverb was chosen intuitively, but it created an interesting conceptual layer on the album… not to mention how sweet it sounds!

To fully embrace the rich and detailed sound of the album, Real Music for Unreal Times will be available also on limited edition vinyl. In fact, this is most likely the first time ever a solo cupola album is released on vinyl!

As I do have a bit of a habit of a record collector, I know what difference a beautiful album packaging might make. On my debut album I asked one of my favourite Finnish artists, Kim Somervuori, to paint the cover image. For the new album, the cover art will be shot by the internationally acclaimed photographer Meeri Koutaniemi.

Funding & Perks

All the funds from this campaign go to physical printing and pressing of the albums and eventually shipping them to the supporters of this campaign.

I will need roughly 1000 euros for the CD production and 1500 euros for the vinyl production. Some of this money will also go into covering the shipping costs of the perks.

In addition to the CD’s and the vinyl, I’m offering wooden USB drives that contain the whole Kumea Sound discography (including all Kumea Street Records that have been previously only available at the streets when I’m busking). This is the real collector deal as there are only 20 of Kumea WOOD drives!

Also, if you missed my debut album and want to have it on CD, this might be your last chance, as the first edition will be soon sold out.

If you live in Helsinki (Finland) and want to organize a living room concert with your friends, check out my live gig perks. The sets include a 45-60 minute acoustic live at your chosen location and you can choose to include ten CD’s or vinyl records in the package. (If you want to choose this perk, but live outside of Helsinki/Finland, please contact me first & we’ll strike a good deal!)

And last, if you like sound art & feel adventurous, you can order a personal audio post card made just for you! I will record you a personal message with improvised music and some other interesting sounds and send the recording to you on a CDR (or mp3 if you prefer).

The album will be officially released early 2015, but the campaign supporters receive the digital downloads in December and the physical albums as soon as they arrive from the printers (expected December/January)!

The first 100 physical orders will also receive a personal handwritten note!

If no perk is selected, the supporter will receive a customized handwritten note/email.

The Impact

By preordering the album you will be supporting the first acoustic studio album by Kumea Sound! This is also probably the first time a full length solo handpan/cupola album is released on vinyl! My debut album was positively received (although it was hardly noticed in the music press). I believe this new album will help me to continue creating new music and pushing forward my sonic excursions.

Risks & Challenges

The album is now fully recorded and the tracklist is decided. The album will be mastered in November for both CD and vinyl release. The only realistic risk that I can think of would be a delay in the CD/vinyl production.

Other Ways to Help

Share this campaign and the video in your social networks! Promote it on Twitter and Facebook! Make a Kumea Sound tribute on Instagram! Write about the new album in your blog or on your website! Talk to your music loving friends about the new record and this campaign (as well as to the ones who think they don’t like music) — for I have noticed that real words from a friend to another, are usually amazingly powerful. Thank you!


Real Music for Unreal Times by Kumea Sound was recorded at Nordic Audio Labs by Martin Kantola in August 2014. All mixing and mastering was done with Amphion Loudspeakers. Follow the links to find more information about the instruments, the audio technology and the philosophy behind the sound of this album.

Some of this money will also go into covering the shipping costs of the perks.In addition to the CD’s and the vinyl, I’m offering wooden USB drives that contain the whole Kumea Sound discography (including all Kumea Street Records that have been previously only available at the streets when I’m busking). This is the real collector deal as there are only 20 of Kumea WOOD drives!Also, if you missed my debut album and want to have it on CD, this might be your last chance, as the first edition will be soon sold out.If you live in Helsinki (Finland) and want to organize a living room concert with your friends, check out my live gig perks. The sets include a 45-60 minute acoustic live at your chosen location and you can choose to include ten CD’s or vinyl records in the package. (If you want to choose this perk, but live outside of Helsinki/Finland, please contact me first & we’ll strike a good deal!)And last, if you like sound art & feel adventurous, you can order a personal audio post card made just for you! I will record you a personal message with improvised music and some other interesting sounds and send the recording to you on a CDR (or mp3 if you prefer).The album will be officially released early 2015, but the campaign supporters receive the digital downloads in December and the physical albums as soon as they arrive from the printers (expected December/January)!The first 100 physical orders will also receive a personal handwritten note!If no perk is selected, the supporter will receive a customized handwritten note/email.The ImpactBy preordering the album you will be supporting the first acoustic studio album by Kumea Sound! This is also probably the first time a full length solo handpan/cupola album is released on vinyl! My debut album was positively received (although it was hardly noticed in the music press). I believe this new album will help me to continue creating new music and pushing forward my sonic excursions.Risks & ChallengesThe album is now fully recorded and the tracklist is decided. The album will be mastered in November for both CD and vinyl release. The only realistic risk that I can think of would be a delay in the CD/vinyl production.Other Ways to HelpShare this campaign and the video in your social networks! Promote it on Twitter and Facebook! Make a Kumea Sound tribute on Instagram! Write about the new album in your blog or on your website! Talk to your music loving friends about the new record and this campaign (as well as to the ones who think they don’t like music) — for I have noticed that real words from a friend to another, are usually amazingly powerful. Thank you!Real Music for Unreal Times by Kumea Sound was recorded at Nordic Audio Labs by Martin Kantola in August 2014. All mixing and mastering was done with Amphion Loudspeakers. Follow the links to find more information about the instruments, the audio technology and the philosophy behind the sound of this album.

story:
Season Songs

Season Songs was the creative musical collaboration between me and my dear friend Emanuel Sandgren. For three days in January 2014 we escaped the city noise and went to the island of Marstrand at the Swedish west coast to create music together and dream greater dreams. During that time we started the recording of our first EP as a duo.

In May 2014 everything just stopped when Emanuel was diagnosed with serious cancer. Two months later he peacefully passed away after a brave fight. There are no words that can describe the pain and grief. Emanuel will forever be loved and always missed.
Despite the pain, I have decided to finish and release the EP in December 2014 to honor Emanuel. You are very welcome to support this project!

The goal

The goal is to raise an amount of 1500 USD (Approximately 10.000 SEK). The money will fund the mixing, mastering and printing/release of the EP and all profit will be used to start a foundation/project in our local neighborhood with the purpose to help and encourage people to rise above their circumstances and bloom like flowers. That was a dream that Emanuel and I had and now I together with Emanuels family and closest friends will make that dream come true.


    You

    Your participation in the crowd funding is really valuable but whether you have the ability to give money or not, your support is crucial. Please spread the word and let people know about the crowd funding and the upcoming EP.
    Yours sincerely 


    Jojje T Lindsmyr -The remaining member of Season Songs

story:
Jamie & James

Thank you so much for taking the time to review our campaign. 

If you don't know us, we are a Americana pop/rock duo based out of Washington D.C. We met at a young artist songwriter showcase in D.C. in 2010, and since then, have been performing and co-writing music. Show after show fans have asked for a way to hear and share this music, however, so far we have only been able to produce a few demos. Well, now it is time for that to change. We have the opportunity to record the songs that we have put our hearts and souls into....we just need you in order to make it happen.

We have the opportunity to work with the highly reputable producer, Mark Williams, at Sucker Punch Recording Co. in Bethesda, Maryland who will help us create a professional product that we will all be extremely proud of. Everything is in order and we are ready to get started. The only problem is that we need to be able to pay for the incredible services that we will receive at Sucker Punch, and right now this is not something that we can handle on our own. That's where you come in!

What We Need & What You Get

$10,000 is the magic number. This money is going to go towards paying for studio time, session musicians, and mastering of the project. While we are extremely grateful for EVERY donation we receive, we are offering some incentives for those that wish to make larger contributions.

If you donate $100, you will receive one of Jamie's original art pieces.
If you donate $300, you will receive a custom piece of art that incorporates lyrics from one or more of the songs off of the album.
If you donate $500, you will receive an 'Executive Producer' credit on the album.
Lastly, if you donate $1000, we will bring our full band to you for a private house show for you and your friends.

For More Info

Please check out our website, jamieandjamesmusic.com to find out more about us and hear some of our music. Demos of the songs "Maybe" and "We Call Home" are both featured on our website's music player, and are set to be on the new album. Additionally, please follow us on Twitter and Instagram at @jamieandjames_ to keep up with our progress on the album!


Thank you so much for all of your support.
We look forward to bringing you the best product possible.

story:
100 ONCES EUROPEAN TOUR

Hello World,

We are 100 ONCES. Lately, things have been going really well for us. So well, in fact, that we have a TOUR booked in western EUROPE this DECEMBER! We have the best promoters and blogs working with us in each town to make sure that each show is a huge success.

Math-rock is a booming underground scene, and we are on its frontier. We are going to be one of the few American math bands traveling over-seas to play shows. We. Are. Stoked.

5th December - Dublin, IR

6th December - Belfast, IR

7th December - Liverpool, UK

9th December - Nottingham, UK

11th December - Brighton, UK

12th December - London, UK

13th December - Le Mans, FR

MORE TBA.

Of course by helping us, we are going to give you something special! You will become the owners of the first ever 100 Onces merch! That will include stickers, CDs, T-Shirts, pins & more! 


Things we need to pay for -

2 round trip flights LAX/Dublin & travel expenses (car rental, gas, ferry, train). - $2900

Merchandise - $600


By helping us today, you're putting a dollar into the future of true live music. 

Our mission is go out to Europe, destroy every set and establish ourselves as international forerunners in this scene. Having your support would put us in the best mindset to accomplish our dreams. 

Thank you very much!


If money isn't the way you can support us, sharing is caring! ;) <3

story:
Short Summary

My Name is Uneq'ka I am a Singer, songwriter, teacher, and artist.  i have taught music and art all over Chicago in schools and community organizations. i also have several projects on iTunes and Amazon. Throughout the years of teaching I saw first hand how positive music can inspire and help to change negative situations and people.  I am campaigning to give Music and art to a community that is desperately in need of positive energy.  Living in Englewood i have seen some of the most violent situation with tragic outcome, I also have seen lives transformed with a little hope and inspiration.  I have completed a project that has the elements of hope, love, life and perseverance. Your contribution will help to get this music and message out in the community, to other communities all while documenting the process on film for TV and internet. It is important to show the positive change that is happening so that it can spread. Poverty and violence is a conditional mindset that can be changed.

If my goal is reached or not every cent will go into producing and distributing the music and art that will inspire, to filming and continuing to run grassroots programs on the streets of Englewood and throughout Chicago. Anyone who can contribute will receive one or more of the following:  CD Collection, Downloads, art prints, a thank you/mention on our film or tickets to a live show to personally thank you. We need your help please spread the word. The video is an example of a the change that has happened with music right here in my neighborhood. Please help us spread this change.

story:
Help Women Artists get to the 39th Annual National Women's Music Festival.

The 39th annual National Women's Music Festival will held at the Madison Marriott West Conference Center in Middleton WI June 26-29, 2014. All of the performers, workshop presenters and festival staff are women. And, unlike other Women's Festival that are held in the great outdoors, the National Festival inherently costs more because all of the stages, workshops and other events are in a climate-controlled conference center.Women In the Arts is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization whose purpose is to produce and sponsor programs that promote and affirm the creative talents and technical skills of women in the visual, performing, and fine arts. The primary vehicle to meet this purpose is the production of the National Women’s Music Festival. In producing this and other arts programs, WIA strives to facilitate the growth, knowledge, and empowerment of women in the other varied aspects of their lives. 

What We Need From You

We work very hard to keep our expenses to a minimum, but like everything else the costs of travel and accommodations increase every year. This year, the cost of travel and hotel accommodations for performers, presenters, and staff will be close to $20,000.00.

Donor contributions will pay for transportation, housing and food for over 35 women performers at the festival.  Your donation also means that we don't have to include the cost of travel and hotel in our determination of the price of a 4-day festival pass. It helps us keep the cost a 4-day festival pass within the range that a majority of women can afford to pay.

How We will Thank You

Please review the list of perks that you will receive for your donation. We will list your name in the program booklet with your perk. For example: if you donated $75 for Luggage fees; we will state that you paid for the transportation of Linda Tillery's drums to the Festival. Or, if you donated $200 we will state that you paid for Lucie Blue's transportation to the festival. We will have a list available of the artists and what it costs for their travel and lodging. You can choose whose transportation or lodging costs you would like to say that you sponsored.  So, the earlier that you donate the more likely you will be able to sponsor the artist of your choice.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass the word via Facebook posts, Tweets, Tumbler, LinkedIn and/or e-mails.  Make some noise about the 39th Annual National Women's Music Festival and our campaign for sponsors. 

The Women in the Arts Board appreciate your help.

story:
Hello! I am Dr. Gwendolyn McClure and I am excited to launch my very first CD, Songs for the Earth, dedicated to the Beauty and Sacredness of our Planet Earth.


A little about me: 

When not at Home on our land in Tucson, I spend my life traveling, giving Vocal Sound Healing Journey workshops & Private Vocal Sound Touch Healing Sessions. I have been doing this work since August, 1990.

 
By contributing to this Indiegogo campaign, you are helping to bring my Voice to a much larger audience, so that many people can experience the Healing effects of my Songs when I am not physically present!!!! 


I have a Ph.D. in Clinical Psychology from Pacifica Graduate Institute (1998); I wrote my Doctoral Dissertation on the use of Vocal Sound and Singing for the Transformation of Consciousness, and I am living my Dreams: This CD is one of them. 


I have promised this CD for many years to many people, and THANK YOU from ALL OF MY HEART for helping this DREAM come to fruition!!

More info/sneak peak:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HGwhdxqxkIg&feature=youtu.be


What We Need & What You Get


Specifically, by contributing to this $4,000. campaign to produce my Songs for the Earth CD, you are assisting in completing my financial obligation to the recording studio, Irreverent Productions, assisting in the duplication and distribution of this cd, as well as helping to pay for the "licenses" I need for recording six songs by other artists.


The Perks


The perks I am offering for participating in this campaign range from $1-1,000!! 

I am offering singing phone calls, cd's, autographed cd's, vocal sound healing workshops, private sessions, associate producer and executive producer credits!! 

(The sessions listed in these perks are 30% off normal session prices)


Final Comments:

People who have heard me sing say that they feel a deep peace, a connection to their wholeness, and a sense of healing, in response to my songs. 


Please feel free to check out my website: www.vocalsoundhealer.com  for photos, interviews, songs and further information! 


If I do not reach my entire goal, the funds will go towards all the aspects of producing the cd, just in a smaller duplication run.


Other Ways You Can Help: 

Please help get the word out about this campaign via facebook, emails, instagram, tumblr, the Indiegogo share tools, word of mouth, or any other means. 





Thank you so much!!! 

Gwendolyn

story:
WHO I AM

My name is Gershon Hamel, and I am a gospel artist, songwriter, producer and musician from Pensacola, Florida. This will be my first solo project and I want to share the experience with you.

                           

Music if nothing else has been the greatest and most stable thing in my life. I started playing drums around 8 or 9 months of age and the journey has gone from there. All the music I have made is original and that’s something I take much pride in and now I am ready to share this part of me with you. I am very diverse and have studies all types of music, so I don’t think there will be a dull moment on this album or tour.

·  This ALBUM will have 10-12 ORIGIANL songs

·  I need to be able to PAY for my beat producers for all of their hard work

·  I want to share my work with YOU.

·  I want to record a VIDEO for one of the songs

·  I want to commission someone to do the album ARTWORK                                                                 

"This is my dream and I never want to wake up from it." I want this album to be a quality product and again I want you to be apart of this great opportunity. I am a dedicated and hard worker, but even with all the hard work, I know I can’t achieve this goal financially on my own. So I am asking for support from you, my friends, family and even those of you who may not know me, anyone who believes in the power of MUSIC. This is my way and chance to spread the love of my father, by using the gifts he blessed me with.

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

·  Contribute to my cause by making a donation

·  SHARE!- Spread the word by using the share tab on my campaign homepage, twitter, phone, in-person, on your blog and/or Facebook. 

Thank you for helping make a difference and believing in my vision. You don’t know how much your support means to me and how grateful I am to have it. For more information, please feel free to e-mail me at: gergetm@gmail.com

story:
The Woodwards...

We've recorded a beautiful album. Attie waited until we had it just right. Our entire budget went to recording and promoting. We never stopped to think we'd need to tour. And we need more than just airline tickets: we need to bring our band with us, we need tour posters and we'd like to have somewhere to sleep.

So far we've done everything right but even to do this next part wrong we need some cash and we have to do this, right or wrong we have to do this. We've had a lot of press, they're expecting us. If we don't show up they're gonna be wondering where we are.

We want to bring Maarten van der Grinten (we were pleasantly surprised to discover that he was willing to join us). We'd like to bring Attie but he likely won't have time (priceless) and we're going to bring Boudewijn (but he gonna come cheap).

...need to tour

€2500? We could've bought a small house for what we've spent on production and promotion and artwork and printing. What we need now is to get the 5 of us around Europe (€1500), tour posters (€100), accommodation (€400), merchandise (€400) , Boudewijn might do it for nothing but I assume Maarten will want remuneration (€?), and to pay our rent while we're gone (€priceless). We're going anyway but oh man it would be nice to not have to sleep on Stevie's dad's floor, it's enough that he's driving us the gigs. I'm 54 years old and my singer's father is driving us to and from gigs. My hand is out.

Peter Schuyff has finally agreed to build a bridge between his music career and his illustrious career as an artist. So we have some very posh Woodwards memorabilia for you. Peter is well known for his carved pencils. We recently found a box of 50 original Woodward's pencils that he is eager to carve for you.

Believe it or not, The Woodwards have found their way into Peter's paintings:

When all's said and done

We're assuming we won't have to do this next time.

We've recorded a beautiful album. Attie waited until we had it just right. Our entire budget went to recording and promoting. We never stopped to think we'd need to tour. And we need more than just airline tickets: we need to bring our band with us, we need tour posters and we'd like to have somewhere to sleep.
So far we've done everything right but even to do this next part wrong we need some cash and we have to do this, right or wrong we have to do this. We've had a lot of press, they're expecting us. If we don't show up they're gonna be wondering where we are.
We want to bring Maarten van der Grinten (we were pleasantly surprised to discover that he was willing to join us). We'd like to bring Attie but he likely won't have time (priceless) and we're going to bring Boudewijn (but he gonna come cheap).
...need to tour
€2500? We could've bought a small house for what we've spent on production and promotion and artwork and printing. What we need now is to get the 5 of us around Europe (€1500), tour posters (€100), accommodation (€400), merchandise (€400) , Boudewijn might do it for nothing but I assume Maarten will want remuneration (€?), and to pay our rent while we're gone (€priceless). We're going anyway but oh man it would be nice to not have to sleep on Stevie's dad's floor, it's enough that he's driving us the gigs. I'm 54 years old and my singer's father is driving us to and from gigs. My hand is out.
Peter Schuyff has finally agreed to build a bridge between his music career and his illustrious career as an artist. So we have some very posh Woodwards memorabilia for you. Peter is well known for his carved pencils. We recently found a box of 50 original Woodward's pencils that he is eager to carve for you.


Believe it or not, The Woodwards have found their way into Peter's paintings:


When all's said and done
We're assuming we won't have to do this next time.

story:
Hello, I am Will Payne Harrison. You may know me from The Onlies or one of my many other musical projects. I am excited to announce my debut solo album LOUISIANA SUMMER. Much like my home state, Louisiana Summer holds a special place in my heart. In May of last year, I relocated to Nashville, TN where I have been pursuing my music career. Many of the songs from Louisiana Summer were written during my transition from Louisiana to Tennessee.

Louisiana Summer features eleven tracks with cover artwork by Louisiana comic book and graphic artist Kody Chamberlain (Sweets, Punks, 30 Days of Night). This album also has a very special line up of Nashville musicians that I am excited to tell you about. Americana/Alt-Country songwriter, cheesecake baking superstar and member of The Onlies, Fawn Larson, added fiddle, harmonica and sang harmonies on the album. Kentucky School of Bluegrass graduate, and Fireball Mail and Copperheads’ mandolinist Caleb Edwards added his fantastic mandolin chops. University of Illinois music graduate and one of the best bass players in Nashville, Katie Blomarz played upright bass.

This album is the perfect blend of Nashville and Louisiana. Even down to the photography. My good friends hailing from New Iberia, Louisiana by way of Nashville, Reaux Photo took all of my promos for the album.

I have poured my heart, soul, time and money into this album to give - what I believe to be - one of the best recordings and performances of my music career. I have paid for all of the production costs, artwork, musicians, photography and other expenses out of pocket. With this Indiegogo campaign, I am humbly asking for your support in pre-ordering my album to help fund the printing, distribution and promotion of Louisiana Summer. This project is a labor of love that I truly believe will be enjoyed by all who support.

So: what do you get? I’m glad you asked! With your support, I am offering GREAT incentives including: 

  • A pre-order of Louisiana Summer mailed to your front door and available to you before anyone else gets it! 
  • Pre-order tickets to my album release party at Cite Des Arts in September. 
  • A special listening party where I will cook you gumbo (One in Lafayette and one in Nashville).
  • A live performance at your house, and more!

 Want to help, but you don't have any money? No problem! You can help by sharing this pre-order album campaign with your co-workers, friends, family, & neighbors. Just click to share on your social media pages. The more you share, the more people know.

I just want to say that I appreciate all of your support. I look forward to sharing my new music with you. I hope to play your living room, in your cd player and I hope to see you at my official CD release at Cite Des Arts in Lafayette, Louisiana on September 5th!

story:
Jordan Deal's First LIVE Worship Album:

Over the past few years I have been able to record 3 amazing albums. I am super proud of what I have been able to do thus far but I have never been as excited about a project as I am now. This will be my first ever LIVE recording! I have done live studio sessions, but never with a live audience and I can not wait to track with that energy in the room. We will be tracking this album LIVE at Ignited Church on May 15th, 2016.

I love studio albums because of how creative and layered one can get with multi-tracking... BUT I have always longed to capture a live project for many years. There is something so special about capturing a moment in time/history. If you know me at all you know that I shine in a live atmosphere. Worshiping together with a group of people, especially a church family, it just pulls something different out of you. I can't wait to see what moments we capture that night. 

I actually don't have a title for this album yet. This is different for me. I've always known or at least had an idea of what I wanted an album to be titled before I started. The title for this project, I believe, is going to come to after it is tracked and I get to hear it. Something about listening to the moments captured is going to give the title to me. Looking forward to that process. 

I am stepping out in faith to do this project. All I have at this moment is a word from the Lord to do it. As some of you may know, I haven't done a solo project since 2013. "Beautiful Questions" was such an amazing part of my life and I am proud of how that record came out. Since then, I have dedicated myself to to Ignited Church in Lakeland FL. We have been developing a community of Worship Leaders and Musicians for the past 3 1/2 years. It has gone far beyond what I could have dreamed. We have recorded 2 albums together "Wake Us Up" & "Mirrors." These albums have been part of my discipleship process for the people the Lord has entrusted me to lead. Both of those records are babies. They feel and mean something so different to me because they were done in community, for a community, and that is something special. 

So here I am now. Ready to record my 3rd album in a 1 year gap of time. THAT'S A LITTLE CRAZY! But I know it's the Lord. I felt the Holy Spirit impress on me that it was time to do a personal project and it needed to be live. So I have started making plans, writing songs, setting dates, scheduled a band, and am doing pre-production currently. I am stepping out in faith, yet again, to do what I am hearing from the Lord. The Father has honored me every time I have done this in my life and I know that He will do it again. 

I don't believe in begging, that's not what I am doing. This is an opportunity for you to be a part of this project with me. This is why crowd-funding is becoming so popular. YOU, my friends, and my family, can partner with me even before we start! I love this. Indiegogo allows me to accomplish something that I could not do on my own by partnering with you. Through this partnership you will receive different kinds of Perks that are listed on the side of this page. Please look through them and choose what you would desire. They are pretty simple perks since I've never been into making T-Shirts, posters, and crafts (though I love that stuff). I do believe that these Perks are rewarding and can't wait to get them in your hands. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to even view this. It means the world to me that you would consider partnering with me on this album. I love you all dearly and have already been humbled time and time again by the generosity of the body of Christ. It is humbling and vulnerable to put this project in the hand of those I'm in relationship with... but I feel Jesus all over in doing so and I hope you will too.

 All My Love,

Jordan Deal

How Can You Help?

  • We need Your PRAYERS. Live projects are a huge undertaking. Need more grace than ever.
  • We need to raise the FUNDS for this project. $6,000 is just my Indiegogo goal, but it is not the only way I am raising funds. We are also collecting tax deductible funds through "RealDeal Ministries International." If you desire to bypass the crowdfunding platform and send money directly, you can do so. I will honor the same perks that are mentioned here that way as well. (I will include how and where to send checks at the bottom of page)
  • Help us SPREAD THE WORD. Share this link with as many people as you can. I can't get the word out all on my own. Any help is appreciated.

My Promise & Where Your Money Is Going:

No matter how much money comes in through Indiegogo, this record will get done. I know that the Lord will provide period. I have personally been saving and am raising funds outside of Indiegogo as well. The dollar amount of $6,000 is not all this record will cost. It will cost a bit more but the rest will be covered. Any funds that come in over and above the $6,000 mark will be funneled straight into the project as well. Everyone woking with me on this project is committed to it out of relationship. From producers, engineers, venue, equipment, album design, replication, etc. 

Albums take a lot of money, time, and effort. Here is just a short list of what the money will be going to:

  • Equipment Rental
  • Tracking
  • Engineers
  • Musicians
  • Producers
  • Album Design 
  • Replication
  • Copyrights 
  • Overdubs
  • Food (Mainly Pizza;-)

The Other Way You Can Give:

If you would prefer to write a check that would be Tax Deductible you can make it out to:

RDMI

6924 Krenson Oaks St. Lakeland, FL 33810 

Rewards/Perks:

"Beautiful Questions" Released in July 2013.

"Wake Us Up" released in 2015.

"Mirrors" released in 2016.

story:
I hope you enjoyed the music from my latest release, 'Run Toward the Mountains'. Here are two videos from that release. 

 

My Next Record 'Earth Suite'

We (live looper and sound designer Stephanie Case & Ian Ethan Case) have invited an incredible group of world class musicians including 4-Time Grammy Award winner Eugene Friesen (cello), world-renowned innovator Jamey Haddad (percussion), Israeli/Brazilian international touring veteran Amir Milstein (flute), Siberian virtuoso Vladiswar Nadishana (ethnic wind instruments), Berklee College of Music professor Bertram Lehmann (percussion), Jeff Willet (cajon, gongs), G Maxwell Zemanovic (drums), Jharis Yokley (drums), and Hartford Symphony musicians Tony Connaway (double bass) and Yun-Yang Lin (cello) to join us in the discovery and exploration of this new music. In addition, we are working with talented videographer Duncan Wilder (Rhythm of You Productions) to capture every single take in the studio and put together complete song videos as well as behind-the-scenes insight into the recording and production processes.

We would also like to invite You!

We wouldn't be anywhere without the amazing support and interest in our music that so many of you have shown up to this point.  We hope you'll continue the journey with us as we watch this new music unfold together!

The music business being what it is today, streaming music payments do not provide anywhere near the amount of money needed for a project of this scope and scale, so we are asking you, our listeners and supporters, to get involved and either pre-order 'Earth Suite' or take an even larger role and receive some additional perks, in return for being an integral part of the project.

Let's make this record incredible and share it with as many people as possible. With your support behind it, the sky's the limit!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand money can be tight. Whether or not contributing to the campaign is feasible, there are other ways you can be a valuable part of the 'Earth Suite' project.  Help us spread the word about this campaign by sharing the link, telling your friends, and thereby ultimately assisting us in reaching our goal! 

We hope you will join us and help 'Earth Suite' become an amazing collection of music to be enjoyed for many years to come.

We look forward to making the journey together with you!

story:
My music is funny, unique and lively

If you’re not familiar with it, check out www.howienewman.com. You’ll find audio tracks, videos and my touring schedule as well as a bio and information about my previous CDs.

Most of my songs are up-tempo country-folk-rock that is humorous or satirical, although I do have my serious moments. If you’ve ever seen me in concert, you know what I mean. Performing mostly in the greater Boston area, I include short comedy bits and lots of audience participation.

Lately, I’ve been playing in a folk-rock duo with fiddler Jackie Damsky, who also sings. It’s an eclectic combination of my songs and well-known rock covers. For our schedule, see www.howienewman.com/howieandjackie

New CD

I’ve just started recording my first full-length studio album in 10 years. It’s called “When You’re Happy” and I’m very excited about it. Along with the help of my recording engineer, I’ve enlisted some of the top local musicians, including Billy Novick and Todd Glacy.

There will also be a live track of one of my newer songs, “Where is Everybody?”

Also on the CD is my latest baseball song, “The Ballad of Mike Hessman,” the bittersweet tale of a ballplayer who set the all-time minor league record for home runs. Hessman spent 19 years in the minors so his achievement is a great feat as well as a dubious distinction.

In addition, I’m re-recording five of my favorite songs that were previously available only as live tracks. A brand new studio version of “My Baby Can’t Parallel Park” is included. You may have heard this song on NPR’s Car Talk.  

Here’s the complete lineup:

My Baby Can’t Parallel Park

Our Kids Aren’t Kids Anymore

When You’re Happy, I’m Happy, too

Low Tech

The Ballad of Mike Hessman (Minor League Home Run King)

Where is Everybody?

Reality Check

That Old Car

It’s Only Money

Last Cup of Coffee


Recording, mastering and mixing a studio album can be expensive so I’m looking to pre-sell some CDs to cover those costs. There are also expenses involved with design, artwork and pressing the actual CDs.

In addition, I’d like to use this campaign to generate some buzz so getting the music “out there” will really help. It’s going to be a great album!  

I’m offering big discounts and combo offers to help launch this project so you’ll be getting some great music in exchange for your support.

Expenses include:

Musicians: $1,500

Studio time (recording): $1,000

Studio time (mixing): $500

Studio time (mastering): $500

TOTAL: $3,500

Your support is greatly appreciated

I’ve been a professional musician for several decades and music is a majority of my income at this point. More importantly, I really enjoy performing and would appreciate some help in introducing new people to my unique brand of music.

You can help by pre-ordering “When You’re Happy” or buying any of my earlier CDs. This will help defray recording and production costs, and really get the ball rolling for this project.

Thanks in advance.

story:
My name is Paul Gonzenbach. For nine years, I was the lead singer of the Oakland-based five piece The Jim Yoshii Pile-Up. For the past ten years, I've been releasing albums on my own label, Unspeakable Records. Despite strongly desiring to press my albums on vinyl, I've only ever pressed one album on vinyl due to the high upfront costs. I'm looking to change that with this campaign.

My new album is called Anything At All Forever, and people who've heard it are saying it's my best yet. It's kind of a departure for me. The album is very influenced by bands like Siouxsie & the Banshees, Nadja, and Have A Nice Life. The songs are generally long and layered and unfold gradually.

The pressing of the record will be a 2LP 180 gram splatter vinyl in a gatefold sleeve, and it will come with an 11x17 poster and a lyrics zine. 

This is NOT an all-or-nothing campaign, meaning I do not need to make the goal in order for you to get your rewards. If you contribute, you WILL receive what you've paid for.

The Rewards

There are some awesome rewards at different levels as well. Check em:

  • If you spend $10 or more, you'll get the CD and mp3s of Anything At All Forever as well as a cassette and mp3s of the single EP from the album, "Whispers Of The Waves." The EP includes a single edit of "Whispers Of The Waves" (the album version is 19 minutes long) as well as three covers of songs by The Cure: "All Cats Are Grey," "At Night," and "Shake Dog Shake."
  • $25 + shipping will get you the mp3s, CD, and cassette, plus an 8" lathe cut single with two exclusive unreleased songs. One song, called "Others," is an outtake from Bright Alert, and another, called "Answers Just Beyond Your Reach," is an outtake from Slow Fire.
  • $40 + shipping gets you mp3s, CD, cassette, and the double 180 gram vinyl of Anything At All Forever. The vinyl includes three bonus tracks, which are the three songs from the Travis Waltons split CD Dangerous Boyfriends, new recordings of three classic songs: the Jim Yoshii Pile-Up song "Black & Gold," "Sing For Yourself" which originally appeared on Avalanche Kiss, and the Notify Your Friends: Everything Ends track "Time Now For Ghosts."
  • Any contribution over $60  gets you the mp3s, CD, cassette, 2LP 180 gram vinyl of Anything At All Forever, plus the 8" lathe cut single with two exclusive unreleased songs. 
  • My person favorite reward is the $85 level, which gets you everything from the $60 level, a thank you in the credits of the album, my entire physical back catalog, and an exclusive acoustic CD. The back catalog includes the Avalanche Kiss vinyl, and CDs of all of my full-length albums. The acoustic album consists of new recordings of songs spanning my 20ish-year musical career. The tracklist includes one or two songs from every album I've put out, including Jim Yoshii Pile-Up albums and each of my solo albums along with two new covers. Tracklist:
  1. Here's Where The Story Ends (The Sundays cover)
  2. Hello
  3. Middle Harbor Road
  4. Jailhouse Rock
  5. Silver Sparkler
  6. Kevin Decline
  7. Cartoon Violence
  8. Hangman's Door
  9. Timid Hearts
  10. Slow On The Draw
  11. Worse For You Than Smoking
  12. The Crunch Of Tires On Snow
  13. The Sweetest You've Heard
  14. House Arrest
  15. Whispers Of The Waves
  16. cover TBD
  • The $125 level is actually a pretty great deal, getting you everything from the $85 level plus a test pressing of Anything At All Forever and a handwritten thank you note and drawing done by me.
  • $650 gets you everything from the $125 level plus all the original pen and ink drawings from the Bright Alert artwork. Only one of these available, for obvious reasons. Ask for pictures if you'd like to see them before you purchase.
  • And finally, a generous $1250 contribution will get you everything from the $125 level plus a private show on a mutually agreeable date at your home or business anywhere in the United States. Your contribution will cover the airfare, car rental if needed, and hotel for me. You'll have input on the setlist, and you can make it a private show just for you and your friends, or you can advertise it and sell tickets and make some of your money back.
story_txt:
My name is Paul Gonzenbach. For nine years, I was the lead singer of the Oakland-based five piece The Jim Yoshii Pile-Up. For the past ten years, I've been releasing albums on my own label, Unspeakable Records. Despite strongly desiring to press my albums on vinyl, I've only ever pressed one album on vinyl due to the high upfront costs. I'm looking to change that with this campaign.
My new album is called Anything At All Forever, and people who've heard it are saying it's my best yet. It's kind of a departure for me. The album is very influenced by bands like Siouxsie & the Banshees, Nadja, and Have A Nice Life. The songs are generally long and layered and unfold gradually.The pressing of the record will be a 2LP 180 gram splatter vinyl in a gatefold sleeve, and it will come with an 11x17 poster and a lyrics zine. This is NOT an all-or-nothing campaign, meaning I do not need to make the goal in order for you to get your rewards. If you contribute, you WILL receive what you've paid for.The RewardsThere are some awesome rewards at different levels as well. Check em:
If you spend $10 or more, you'll get the CD and mp3s of Anything At All Forever as well as a cassette and mp3s of the single EP from the album, "Whispers Of The Waves." The EP includes a single edit of "Whispers Of The Waves" (the album version is 19 minutes long) as well as three covers of songs by The Cure: "All Cats Are Grey," "At Night," and "Shake Dog Shake."
$25 + shipping will get you the mp3s, CD, and cassette, plus an 8" lathe cut single with two exclusive unreleased songs. One song, called "Others," is an outtake from Bright Alert, and another, called "Answers Just Beyond Your Reach," is an outtake from Slow Fire.
$40 + shipping gets you mp3s, CD, cassette, and the double 180 gram vinyl of Anything At All Forever. The vinyl includes three bonus tracks, which are the three songs from the Travis Waltons split CD Dangerous Boyfriends, new recordings of three classic songs: the Jim Yoshii Pile-Up song "Black & Gold," "Sing For Yourself" which originally appeared on Avalanche Kiss, and the Notify Your Friends: Everything Ends track "Time Now For Ghosts."
Any contribution over $60  gets you the mp3s, CD, cassette, 2LP 180 gram vinyl of Anything At All Forever, plus the 8" lathe cut single with two exclusive unreleased songs. 
My person favorite reward is the $85 level, which gets you everything from the $60 level, a thank you in the credits of the album, my entire physical back catalog, and an exclusive acoustic CD. The back catalog includes the Avalanche Kiss vinyl, and CDs of all of my full-length albums. The acoustic album consists of new recordings of songs spanning my 20ish-year musical career. The tracklist includes one or two songs from every album I've put out, including Jim Yoshii Pile-Up albums and each of my solo albums along with two new covers. Tracklist:

Here's Where The Story Ends (The Sundays cover)
Hello
Middle Harbor Road
Jailhouse Rock
Silver Sparkler
Kevin Decline
Cartoon Violence
Hangman's Door
Timid Hearts
Slow On The Draw
Worse For You Than Smoking
The Crunch Of Tires On Snow
The Sweetest You've Heard
House Arrest
Whispers Of The Waves
cover TBD


The $125 level is actually a pretty great deal, getting you everything from the $85 level plus a test pressing of Anything At All Forever and a handwritten thank you note and drawing done by me.

$650 gets you everything from the $125 level plus all the original pen and ink drawings from the Bright Alert artwork. Only one of these available, for obvious reasons. Ask for pictures if you'd like to see them before you purchase.
And finally, a generous $1250 contribution will get you everything from the $125 level plus a private show on a mutually agreeable date at your home or business anywhere in the United States. Your contribution will cover the airfare, car rental if needed, and hotel for me. You'll have input on the setlist, and you can make it a private show just for you and your friends, or you can advertise it and sell tickets and make some of your money back.

story:
I was invited to participate in US projects.

I am 8 years old and I currently live in Yasnohorodka Ukraine.  Funding is needed for transportation, visa's, food and lodging
See my story, videos and photo gallery

Some history about me and what you are investing in.

​
My name is Katia Kuziakina and I am 8 years old from Ukraine.  I started playing drums a little over a year ago teaching myself by watching AC/DC videos.  I was a finalist in the global drum contest "hit like a girl" under 18 age group for 2016http://www.hitlikeagirlcontest.com/under-18/ent... have a youtube channel that is only 6 months old and I am closing in on 500,000 views with over 2600 subscribers.  I invite you to explore my channel here https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtVatdoUASnCJ5...  And in this picture I played as a solo artist to a crowd of 3,000 people.

 

Why I need funding

I have been invited to participate in the spring of 2017 recording session with the O'keefe Music Foundation in Cincinnati Ohio.   OMF is a foundation that works with gifted children Aaron O'keefe has scouts who scour youtube for gifted musical children and that is how I was discovered.  I just need to get to Cincinnati Ohio.

I ask the finance for you to invest in me. 

The financing will be used for flight, visa - ies, food and accommodation. I'll come by in the US Ukaine. This opportunity of a lifetime for me, and I really want this to happen from the bottom of my heart. Please help to make this dream come true for me.

Other ways you can help

If you can't spare any cash right now, we get it!  But please share this link, and tell your friends about me, above all else.  I value your willingness and if you do that, you will have done a lot.

thanks for your support

Kat

PS: Check frequently for my updates.

PS2: Please share my indiegogo campaign link with your friends, Thank you

story:
MC Blackwolf - [Redacted] EP

Hi, my name is MC Blackwolf.  God, that's so formal, MC Blackwolf was my father's name, call me Blackwolf.  I'm a rapper out of Fishtown/Port Richmond area Philadelphia where I frequently play shows.  I haven't released a song since 2011 because nothing in the interim has been good enough.  My inner critic has gotten a lot of work, and has very harshly judged all attempts to create a solid project.  I finally think that I have  wrestled my demons enough to make something that I am truly proud of.  I finally found my sound.  If you've seen me live (as Blackwolf or in my group Kim Jong Ill) then you know that I am all about energy.  Its a weird energy, but there's a lot of it.  That is something that was really important for me to capture on this EP and I think I just may have succeeded.

This campaign is meant to fund 2 things:

  • Physical Copies of the [Redacted] EP 
  • Blackwolf Tshirts

I know, it seems a bit weird to use a bullet list for only two items, but that's how excited I am about this project.

What I Need & What You Get

"Hey Blackwolf!" You say indignantly, "What do you need all this money for?  Are you just going to roll it all into a ball and throw it into a woodchipper?"

  • I promise that not one dollar that I get will end up in a woodchipper. (Some of it will be rolled up, but that's just how I store my money.)
  • Physical CD Printing Costs: All told printing costs are going to run me about $300.
  • T-Shirt Printing: T-Shirts are going to run me somewhere around $200
  • If I don't reach my goal, I'll pay the rest out of pocket and all rewards will still go out. 

What do I already have?

I already have the album finished.  It is mixed and mastered and sitting on my laptop dreaming of one day being a real EP.

  • Album art from the infinitely talented Sally Madden
  • T-shirt designs from the incomparable Sally Madden 
  • 6 songs recorded over beats from 4 amazing producers (keen, ostubash, Matt Cattie, and oldboi)
  • A go getter attitude

I can't really afford this, but I still want to help...

Just because you can't contribute financially does not mean that you can't help me:

  • Share this campaign page
  • Share my videos as I post them
  • Tell your friends to like my page
  • Create false accounts on facebook to artificially inflate both my like count and my ego
  • Come out to my shows

Anyone who shares this campaign on social media will receive a song download from the EP when this campaign is finished.

story:
Hello, my name is LINDA TUCKER, I am a photographer and science educator located in Baltimore MD. The women of my church, Restoration Temple Apostolic Center are embarking on a mission’s trip to Jamaica this summer.

I would like to go on this mission’s trip as I have never been out of the country before.  My role on this trip is to serve the people of Catadupa, Jamaica, capture images that reflect the beauty of the island as well as the reality of life in the mountains of Jamaica.  I will also be documenting the service project and assisting my church and the local ministry in any way I can, but I need your help. We will be traveling to Catadupa on St James Mountain, Jamaica.
 A donation in any amount will assist me in reaching my goal of $1500.00 which is the cost of my flight and accommodations for our week of service. In return, as incentive, I offer you a glimpse of the beauty of the Island and its people captured by my lens.

I have captured the beauty of the natural world for the last 5 years and although my photographers journey has allowed me to experience a variety of genres ranging from fashion to social justice. I desire to take my photographic experience to another level, observing other worlds and cultures is an integral part of that development.

I hope you will consider donating to my Mission Jamaica Campaign. Please check out the levels of incentives available. No donation is too small and all will be acknowledged. Thank you and I look forward to sharing my view of Jamaica with you when I return.

story:
Short Summary

On May 25, 2016, hear the U.S. Premiere of the music from Sandhills Reunion (2004), an album with music by Jerry Granelli and text by Rinde Eckert at National Sawdust in Brooklyn, NY, performed by a full ensemble of acclaimed musicians. The piece is a multi-layered interweaving of words and music that Granelli calls an audio movie or play. Granelli’s score is woven through Eckert’s text made from a glancingly linked sequence of reflections, imaginings, internal monologues and one historically accurate dialogue (“Twenty Questions for an Outlaw”) using the persona of Billy the Kid as a thematic touchstone, and the Sandhills region of northwestern Nebraska as the landscape of memory and desire.

Wednesday, May 29, 7:00 pm performance at National Sawdust

80 NORTH 6TH STREET, BROOKLYN, NY, 11249 UNITED STATES

Rinde Eckert - voice
Ben Goldberg - clarinet
Jeff Reilly - bass clarinet
Andy Lassiter - baritone sax
Richard Eckert - cello
Christian Kogel - electric and acoustic guitars
J. Anthony Granelli - bass, lap steel guitar
Jerry Granelli - drums, samples


What We Need & What You Get

Seeking $5,000 to pay the musicians for the U.S. Premiere of Sandhills Reunion. This concert marks a deepening of the relationship between the musicians and National Sawdust, as well as an opportunity to increase the exposure of these musicians, who hail from cities across North America, to presenters, industry stakeholders and audiences in New York City. 

For $30 donations, receive a handwritten/handcrafted surprise from Rinde, mailed to an address of your choice

For $50 receive a free copy of the 2004 Sandhills Reunion Album

For $100 get 2 tickets to the May 25th concert

For $250 enjoy a lunch with the artists, sharing ideas and lines of inquiry on process, inspiration and whatever else the afternoon might conjure

For $500 get 4 tickets to the May 25th Concert, plus an exclusive post-show meet and greet with the artists

For $1,500, welcome Rinde Eckert into your home or office for a short, solo music performance for you and your guests


Other Ways You Can Help

 Buy a ticket to the show!

http://nationalsawdust.org/event/rinde-eckert-presents-jerry-granellis-sandhills-reunion/

Read on for more about the album Sandhills Reunion

In Rinde's Words: 

"Jerry Granelli asked me to put a text to a suite of pieces he had already composed.  The original texts had to be tossed because of some legal complications.  So I listened to the thing and wrote my own story.  I’d just gotten back from Nebraska (my first residency toward the making of Horizon).  I’d been taken to the Sandhills, that glorious prairie that comprises pretty much all of northwest Nebraska. There is something simple and grand here.  Again, I would suggest you sit with it for the duration.  Beautiful, sensitive playing.  Subtle.  Also, these little stories are some of the best stories I’ve ever written."


Rinde Eckert is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Rinde Eckert must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
About After Funk

Four years into our time together as a band, After Funk has been maturing rapidly both in regards to our playing and and in our writing. Based out of Toronto, we've spent the year working at it full time, trying to tour frequently and write and record our new full length album.

'Til the Sun Comes Up

We are releasing a new album called 'Til the Sun Comes Up on October 16 and we need your support to finish it. The album is our best work to date and we're confident you will think so too.

What we have to pay for still

Though the music has already been recorded, there are still a lot of costs to cover, including; 
  • mixing/mastering
  • studio musicians 
  • guest artists (including Toronto's own Choclair) 
  • pressing the album to vinyl/cd 
  • music videos
  • promotion 
  • album art 

Other ways you can help

Even if you can't help monetarily, there other ways you can. Spread the word about our campaign, bring your friends to a show, invite your Facebook friends to like our page or just keep supporting us as we grow. We have the best fans and we couldn't be doing what we're doing without you. We can't wait to share our new album with you and we think it's our best music yet!

story:
With recording just completed on Monday, January 28th, here is the breakdown of where the money we raise (YOUR donations) will be going!:

Costs that MUST be covered:

Studio (Recording/Mixing): $1,300
Pressing CDs: $300
Original Posters: $100
Rights to Music & Distribution: $100
Indiegogo Fees: $245

30% of ALL FUNDS RAISED will be going to these two causes:

ECMS Student Scholarship Donation: $525
Free Clinic Donation: $525

 What we'd like to pay those who are currently working for FREE:

Studio Musicians: $300
CD Design: $50
Additional Advertising: $55

= $3,500

Please help us reach our goal!! Here is the story of "The Unsung":

            After a year-and-a-half of dealing with a crumbling hip, followed by surgery and recovery—which my surgeon at Mayo responded, “I could have dreamed the perfect surgery and recovery and it wouldn’t have gone this well" —I found myself feeling ten years younger (putting me at 36), but bereft of new musical material of my own. At the same time, I see a music industry bereft of real talent, unless one looks to the independent artists, the unsung, and the somewhat obscure songs of better-known artists. I was chomping at the bit to get back to work in the studio, and ready to take a long hiatus from live performance.

            I have many friends whose music far out-shines that of the “mainstream” you hear on corporate radio any given day. One afternoon, I was listening to the work of one such songwriter who had long-since given me permission to record his work. Then it struck me… why not record an album of cover songs by lesser-known artists and lesser-known songs by a couple well-known names? Thus began the project I dubbed “The Unsung”.

            As I promptly got to work at Pine Hollow Audio outside Eau Claire, Wisconsin, run by Evan Middlesworth whose generosity towards music education has given his name to a music scholarship program (of which a student of mine was a recipient), it dawned on me. If I’m going to take some time off from live performance, why not go out with a bang. I looked at two possibilities for causes I could contribute to: The Chippewa Valley Free Clinic (who provide myself and other uninsured patients with the healthcare they desperately need) and The Eau Claire Music School (where I teach) and their music scholarship program for underprivileged middle school students who show great talent, but haven’t the means to pay for private coaching.

            Knowing that a project such as this can build a greater network for the artists involved—who are ignored by an industry ignorant of most great talent—and contribute to a clinic that needs $2000 a month just to open the doors and buy prescriptions (even at a highly discounted rate), and the thought that I could help pay for scholarships to music education; I jumped on the idea. As I write this, several songs are either complete and awaiting the final mix or are near to being finished. The album will also include in its byline information that will further promote the causes of The CV Free Clinic and the ECMS Scholarship Program. Additionally, when the CD is released at my last live show (for an indefinite period of time), money from the door, raffles and a piece of the ring at the bar will all be included in donations to these causes.

            What can I offer you in return, other than the satisfaction of supporting the independent songwriters covered on this album, and giving to a free clinic and a music school? I’m offering many perks; from signed CDs to DVDs of live shows, and even the opportunity for me to play your private event, featuring the entire album live, along with hours of other material. Look over the levels of donations and understand that any amount is appreciated. Additionally, should you choose an amount in between the various suggested levels, ask what you can receive... the bottom line here, is not, the bottom line. This is all about building an on-going community and contributing to the needs of all of us; whether we're in need of health care, an education in music, or the one thing none of us lives without... music itself. We're all on this road together.

            I hope you’ll see this as an opportunity to be a part of the tremendous musical community available in this country and the world.  If only we all could look for something better… whether it’s providing the means that so many others lack, or bringing lesser known and highly talented artists and lesser known, but brilliant, songs to the public at large. Support “The Unsung”, The Chippewa Valley Free Clinic, and The Eau Claire Music School’s Student Scholarship Program, all with one donation of your choosing.

            I thank you on behalf of everyone involved. If you don’t have the means to donate, I encourage you to do as I do and give back in other ways. Please feel free to spread the word by sharing this page throughout your own networks.
story_txt:
With recording just completed on Monday, January 28th, here is the breakdown of where the money we raise (YOUR donations) will be going!:
Costs that MUST be covered:
Studio (Recording/Mixing): $1,300Pressing CDs: $300Original Posters: $100Rights to Music & Distribution: $100Indiegogo Fees: $245
30% of ALL FUNDS RAISED will be going to these two causes:
ECMS Student Scholarship Donation: $525Free Clinic Donation: $525
 What we'd like to pay those who are currently working for FREE:
Studio Musicians: $300CD Design: $50Additional Advertising: $55
= $3,500
Please help us reach our goal!! Here is the story of "The Unsung":
            After a year-and-a-half of dealing with a crumbling hip, followed by surgery and recovery—which my surgeon at Mayo responded, “I could have dreamed the perfect surgery and recovery and it wouldn’t have gone this well" —I found myself feeling ten years younger (putting me at 36), but bereft of new musical material of my own. At the same time, I see a music industry bereft of real talent, unless one looks to the independent artists, the unsung, and the somewhat obscure songs of better-known artists. I was chomping at the bit to get back to work in the studio, and ready to take a long hiatus from live performance.
            I have many friends whose music far out-shines that of the “mainstream” you hear on corporate radio any given day. One afternoon, I was listening to the work of one such songwriter who had long-since given me permission to record his work. Then it struck me… why not record an album of cover songs by lesser-known artists and lesser-known songs by a couple well-known names? Thus began the project I dubbed “The Unsung”.
            As I promptly got to work at Pine Hollow Audio outside Eau Claire, Wisconsin, run by Evan Middlesworth whose generosity towards music education has given his name to a music scholarship program (of which a student of mine was a recipient), it dawned on me. If I’m going to take some time off from live performance, why not go out with a bang. I looked at two possibilities for causes I could contribute to: The Chippewa Valley Free Clinic (who provide myself and other uninsured patients with the healthcare they desperately need) and The Eau Claire Music School (where I teach) and their music scholarship program for underprivileged middle school students who show great talent, but haven’t the means to pay for private coaching.
            Knowing that a project such as this can build a greater network for the artists involved—who are ignored by an industry ignorant of most great talent—and contribute to a clinic that needs $2000 a month just to open the doors and buy prescriptions (even at a highly discounted rate), and the thought that I could help pay for scholarships to music education; I jumped on the idea. As I write this, several songs are either complete and awaiting the final mix or are near to being finished. The album will also include in its byline information that will further promote the causes of The CV Free Clinic and the ECMS Scholarship Program. Additionally, when the CD is released at my last live show (for an indefinite period of time), money from the door, raffles and a piece of the ring at the bar will all be included in donations to these causes.
            What can I offer you in return, other than the satisfaction of supporting the independent songwriters covered on this album, and giving to a free clinic and a music school? I’m offering many perks; from signed CDs to DVDs of live shows, and even the opportunity for me to play your private event, featuring the entire album live, along with hours of other material. Look over the levels of donations and understand that any amount is appreciated. Additionally, should you choose an amount in between the various suggested levels, ask what you can receive... the bottom line here, is not, the bottom line. This is all about building an on-going community and contributing to the needs of all of us; whether we're in need of health care, an education in music, or the one thing none of us lives without... music itself. We're all on this road together.
            I hope you’ll see this as an opportunity to be a part of the tremendous musical community available in this country and the world.  If only we all could look for something better… whether it’s providing the means that so many others lack, or bringing lesser known and highly talented artists and lesser known, but brilliant, songs to the public at large. Support “The Unsung”, The Chippewa Valley Free Clinic, and The Eau Claire Music School’s Student Scholarship Program, all with one donation of your choosing.
            I thank you on behalf of everyone involved. If you don’t have the means to donate, I encourage you to do as I do and give back in other ways. Please feel free to spread the word by sharing this page throughout your own networks.

story:
HELP SUPPORT WEST AUSTRALIAN MUSIC!

Indigo are a four-­‐piece band out of Mandurah, Western Australia. Starting in 2012 as Sons of Saviour, founding members Chris Kinna and Sam Jackson started writing songs together as a duo before expanding to a full band and changing their name to Indigo in mid 2013.

After a few line up changes, they finally settled on the current line up that which consists of Chris Kinna on lead vocals and guitar, Sam Jackson on guitar and backing vocals, Russell Morton on bass guitar and backing vocals and Josh Beaumont on drums.

Together, the four boys produce a sound that reflects the good summer vibes that we all know and love. This soft rock/indie/alternative outfit easily translates from CD to an electric live performance that will have you dancing all night and singing along to their catchy tunes.

Indigo have just released their first official video clip for their debut single “Ain’t It Funny” which is available for download from the Reverb nation profile. The band is currently in the process of recording their EP, which is due for release in early 2014.

Not only have Indigo been selected to open the main stage at WA’s biggest music, arts and camping festival, Southbound 2014; but they have just been selected as one of five finalists to fly to Sydney and play in front of a variety of industry professionals on December 6th 2013 as part of the First Break 2013 competition. If successful, Indigo will win prizes such as $2 million worth of commercial radio airplay in Australia, a digital distribution deal with one of Australia’s most popular recording labels, marketing, publicity and media support, tour support and much more.

Due to the short notice given to us by the organizers of this competition, we are asking for your support in helping us get to Sydney so that we do not miss out on this once in a life time opportunity. We are asking for support in the form of financial support to cover the cost of travel expenses for the band to get to Sydney next weekend. In exchange for your support, we are offering LIMITED EDITION* merchandise packs that will be sent out to everyone who helps :) 

 

*Merchandise packs will be created in early 2014 and sent around February 28th 2014. If there is any delay in the creation and postage of the merchandise packs, we will keep you informed.


Facebook: www.facebook.com/indigomusicperth

Youtube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Afuj6LfVifk (Debut Music video) 

Reverbnation: www.reverbnation.com.au/indigomusicperth

First Break Competition: http://www.firstbreak.com.au

story:
Hey there.  I’m Kat Blu, a vocalist/songwriter born in Washington, D.C.  I make my living as a ‘covers’ singer, as I have for a number of years (with a few tours in office work in NYC in between and business degree study).  During this last decade, I have also co-written and performed on collaborative releases and live for international audiences in America, Europe, and Asia.  After bouncing around the musical world, I’m ready to head for home…musically-speaking. 

This album represents for me a 180-degree turn in the direction of blues-based songs written from the soul.  And, the journey ‘home’ begins with your help.  The process of recording and promoting a CD is a costly one, but with you as my “independent record label” I can get it done right.  Over the years, I have met people from all parts of the globe, many of whom have asked me why I haven’t “done my own thing” yet.  Well, finally…I am.  This debut CD is the beginning of my solo recording career and my heartfelt “thank you” to all of those who have applauded and encouraged me along the way.  I intend to keep thanking them and you in new releases and albums to follow this one.  Please read below to find out about how the requested funding will be used and the many “thank you” gifts you can receive for your giving.

From my heart, I thank you for your faith, generosity and support.

xx,

Kat

                                            * * * *

“…anything she sings carries the unique stamp of the soulful voice that is her trademark.”

                                     -- Inside Magazine quote (August 2011)

“Soul Therapy’s groove and Kat Blu’s vocals on “Dance Thru Revolution” are some mood-altering stuff, in the best possible way.”

                                     -- Popservations/Saturdance (April 7, 2012)


About the rest of the team: 

Luke and I have a tremendous synergy when working together that makes the flow of ideas and interpretations natural and constant.  I am looking forward to ‘getting the band back together’ and picking up where we left off in early 2000.  A newer connection, made here in the Algarve, is with Jonny Bull.  We met when I was recommended to him for the recording of a Motown-esque jingle he was commissioned to write and produce for a scientist’s convention.  It was one of the weirdest songs I have ever recorded, but loads of fun.  Jonny’s creativity, spontaneity and talent left an impression and I knew then that I wanted his input on this project.  This album will be written and recorded with them both, in Portugal and in London.  Check ‘em out.


Luke Henderson, Producer

Luke is the founder and owner of the East London commercial recording facility, Fluke Productions.  A vocalist and musician in his own right, Mr. Henderson plays guitar, bass guitar, keyboards, and the trumpet. He holds a BA with honors in Music and Philosophy.  Luke has been performing and writing since the age of 13 with a variety of different groups and bands, most extensively with the indie fusion act, Le Pig.  Musically, these bands range in genres from orchestral to jazz, pop, rock and Indian classical.  More recently, he has been involved in contemporary electronic/dance projects under the pen name, Skinnman.  His current projects include co-writing, producing and arranging for artists in the rock, rap and soul genres.  Luke also coordinates Jam session nights at venues around the UK.

Jonny Bull, Producer

Jonny is the founder and owner of Shabbey Road recording studio located in Aljezur, Portugal.  Mr. Bull brings to this project his experience as a performer, musician and producer, having been a co-writer and singer in bands such as Wild Weekend (EMI), Kinky Machine (East-West/MCA) and Rialto (East-West/China Records), and producer on projects with Mica Paris, Paul Johnson, and Caron Wheeler.  Jonny co-wrote a film soundtrack with John Du Prez on Monty Python fame, the track “Friday Night” on Lily Allen’s first album, and both co-wrote and produced Shaun Escoffery’s debut album.


Here’s how the funds will be used:

CD Recording/Mastering/Replication

  12,806

Equipment

  637

Location/administration expenses

  6,199

Advertising/promotional expenses (2-yr int’l campaign)

  33,997

Other expenses

  1,100

Total Startup Expenses

  54,739

Even if you can’t give money, there are still many other ways you can offer your support.  We need the services listed below …

+  Sharing really is caring – Share this campaign link with your fam/friends/colleagues, and follow me on Twitter and like my Facebook page

+  Administrative/Personal Assistant Services

+  Financial Management or Investment Firm

+  Fashion Designer

+  Publicist

+  Stylist

+  International Entertainment attorney

+  Music Equipment supplier

+  Hair Artist

+  Make-up artist

+  Personal Trainer

+  Nutritionist

+  International Booking agent

+  International artist management

+  Major label distribution

+  Choreographer 

+  Venue owner

+  DJs

+  Radio and Television station contacts

+  Filmmaker


CREDITS:
"The Look of Love" Remix & Production by Luke Henderson, Fluke Productions
Photos and video by Ashley Neubo, ANeubo Photography www.aneubo.com
